original: @1b # // dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: @1b # // dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Lamp of Wisdom Commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po nyi shu brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu brgyad pa /
translated: Volume twenty-eight

original: da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, the third chapter is begun by the power of the meaning to be taught, namely, the essencelessness of the sense bases, through the negation of the distinctions of the discordant side of arising.

original: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, the third chapter is begun in order to teach the emptiness of the sense bases through the negation of the discordant side of going.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta'o //
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir ni dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta'o //
translated: In this context, the word by the power of should be seen to have the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis and the meaning of connection with the text that will follow.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Regarding that, from the perspective of the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis,

original: da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: now, the negation of the distinctions of the discordant side of arising is stated.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the meaning that will be explained below,

original: skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩyang na dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas @2a * //
analyzed: skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so // yang na dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas @2a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn order to demonstrate the meaning of the lack of intrinsic existence of the sense spheres, I will compose the third chapter.‚ÄùüîΩOr, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging the promise, he says,

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy refuting the discordant class.‚Äù

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the meaning that will be explained below,

original: skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyi rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyi rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn order to demonstrate the emptiness of the sense spheres, I will compose the third chapter.‚Äù

original: de la da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba de ji ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba de ji ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how is ‚ÄúBy refuting the discordant class‚Äù in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging the promise?

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: Since the treatise author, in the first chapter of the examination of conditions, made the assertion that all things are not produced,

original: 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas kyang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas kyang sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: here, in the context of the third chapter, the author of the commentary, in order to engage in the topic of the treatise as it was asserted,

original: da ni skye pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni skye pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now says, ‚ÄúThe refutation of the specific attributes of production, which is incompatible with production.‚Äù

original: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba nyid skye ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since production itself is incompatible with nonproduction, it is called ‚Äúthe incompatible attribute of production.‚Äù

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos 'og nas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos 'og nas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The specific attributes of that are as follows.

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: The opponent's position is stated in such passages as because they are ascertained individually.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du @2b byas nas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du @2b byas nas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word negation is to be supplied; the third chapter is begun in order to refute the special attributes of the opponent's position, i.e., arising.

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if the third chapter is begun in order to refute the special attributes of the opponent's position, i.e., arising, the desired aim will be accomplished, i.e., the negation of arising.

original: skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the third chapter is begun in order to demonstrate that the sensory bases are essenceless?

original: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas
translated: The meaning of the passage is as follows:üîΩThe passage from the Treatise on the Examination of the Faculties that will be cited belowüîΩis cited in terms of the meaning of the statement that the faculties are essenceless.

original: 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In this way, the third chapter is begun in terms of the meaning of the statement that the faculties are essenceless.

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, a Mahayana sutra says:

original: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna dang ni //
translated: The eye, the ear, the nose,

original: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
analyzed: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
translated: The tongue, the body, and also the mind,

original: de dag ngo bo nyid stong par //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid stong par //
translated: These are empty of essence.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad //
translated: This has been taught by the perfect buddhas.

original: ces kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: ces kyang gsungs la /
translated: Also, it says:

original: gzhan yang mig ni mig gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig ni mig gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The eye is empty of the essence of the eye.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ni yid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid ni yid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Likewise, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of the entityness of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause that is their intrinsic nature.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
translated: In order to establish those, the third chapter is begun.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: sngar skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngar skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bstan to //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the nonexistence of arising that was previously taught, and in order to establish the statement in the scriptures that the sense spheres are essenceless, the third chapter is begun.

original: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas zhes bya ba de ji ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas zhes bya ba de ji ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Or, how does the meaning of the cause of engagement in the proposition, ‚Äúthe refutation of the discordant position,‚Äù come into the purview of the chapter?

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad la 'gro ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad la 'gro ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: Since the treatise master composed the first chapter of the Investigation of the World, he made the thesis that all things are devoid of going.

original: 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩyang na 'gro ba mi mthun @3a * //
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas / yang na 'gro ba mi mthun @3a * //
translated: Since he composed the third chapter here, the author of the commentary, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging in that thesis,

original: pa'i phyogs dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: states, ‚ÄúOr else, since it is the negation of the class of nongoing.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba nyid 'gro ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba nyid 'gro ba med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since going is the class of nongoing, it is called the class of nongoing.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Since it is the negation of that, the third chapter is composed in terms of the negation of that class of nongoing.

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus, the third chapter is composed in terms of the meaning of the cause for engaging in such a commitment.

original: 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩskye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba de ji ltar gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Since the establishment of the desired goal is accomplished by the prevention of the discordant class of beings, the third chapter is composed.üîΩHow is it that the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe third chapter is composed in order to demonstrate the emptiness of the sense bases‚Äù is taken in terms of the meaning of the text that follows?

original: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yang yin pas 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yang yin pas 'dir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba
translated: The meaning of the following text of the third chapter, the Examination of the Sense Bases, is that it demonstrates the emptiness of the sense bases. Therefore, even at the point of composing the third chapter, the author of the commentary connects it with the following text.

original: dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the emptiness of the sense-spheres from the perspective of that meaning connected with ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù the third chapter is begun.

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩsngar 'gro ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / sngar 'gro ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught:üîΩIn order to demonstrate the previously established non-going, and in order to establish the sense-spheres as empty as taught in the scriptures, the third chapter is begun.

original: gang gi tshe dang po ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang po ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni da ni skye ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis
translated: When the investigation is done in the first way, then the so-called ‚Äúpresentation of the counter-position‚Äù is as follows: Now, in order to demonstrate the sense-spheres as devoid of intrinsic reality by way of the meaning of the power of the refutation of the particularities of the counter-position of arising,

original: rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas sngar skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong par gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bshad pa dang po zhes de ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas sngar skye ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid kyis stong par gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bshad pa dang po zhes de ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni /
translated: When the first chapter is analyzed in this way, the former opponent's position is as follows:

original: pha rol pos 'og nas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol pos 'og nas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The opponent below will maintain that ultimately the internal sensory bases are only produced,

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin te /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin te /
translated: because objects are ascertained individually.

original: 'di ltar phyogs snga ma nye bar sbar ba bkag nas bstan bcos mdzad pa'i bzhed pa 'grub pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel @3b ba byed pas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs snga ma nye bar sbar ba bkag nas bstan bcos mdzad pa'i bzhed pa 'grub pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel @3b ba byed pas phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa byas so //
translated: Thus, in order to refute the opponent's position and establish the treatise's own position, the Commentary here sets forth the opponent's position.

original: de'i phyir don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should accept that ultimately the internal sense bases are produced,

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: because their objects are determinate.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, and the example of the dissimilar class, respectively.

original: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de /
translated: Here, that which is not produced does not have determinate objects,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: like the sense bases of the son of a barren woman, which do not have determinate objects. This is the example of the dissimilar class.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta du yod de /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta du yod de /
translated: The internal sense bases are determined in relation to their objects.

original: 'di lta ste lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / rig par byed pa dang yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / rig par byed pa dang yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The objects of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and mental cognition are form, sound, smell, taste, tangible objects, and entities, respectively.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the internal sense bases should be understood as only arising, as stated by the reason. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe gnyis pa ltar brtag pa de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyis pa ltar brtag pa de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When it is considered in the second way, then...

original: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas sngar 'gro ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs dgag pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bas sngar 'gro ba med pa bsgrub pa'i don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / lung las skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du gsungs pa de dag bsgrub pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa gsum pa brtsam mo //
translated: The second explanation is that the third chapter is composed in order to demonstrate the meaning of the previously established non-existence of going, and in order to establish that the sense-spheres are emptiness as stated in scripture.

original: zhes bshad pa gnyis pa shos de ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gnyis pa shos de ltar brtag pa de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: When one analyzes in this way, the former discordant side should be posited in this way.

original: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: When one analyzes in this way, the former discordant side should be posited in this way.

original: sngar 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'i mjug tu /
analyzed: sngar 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'i mjug tu /
translated: At the conclusion of the second chapter, the examination of going, it was said:

original: de'i phyir 'gro dang 'gro bo dang // bgrod par bya ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro dang 'gro bo dang // bgrod par bya ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore going, the goer, and that which is to be gone over do not exist.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'gro ba smra ba dag gis de mi bzod pas de'i phyir pha rol po dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir 'gro ba smra ba dag gis de mi bzod pas de'i phyir pha rol po dag na re 'di skad ces zer ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because of this, the proponents of going cannot accept this, and so they say, ‚ÄúOthers say this.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that going exists.üîΩBecause it is the effect of action, like seeing form and so on.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They say this.

original: de dag kyang chos @4a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos @4a * //
translated: They say that the subject,

original: can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na mig la sogs pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba yang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o
analyzed: can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te dper na mig la sogs pa ni bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba yang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du shes par bya'o
translated: the predicate of the proposition, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order. For example, just as the eyes and so on are to be understood as existing because they are the effect of action, so too going is to be understood as existing because it is the effect of action.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: They say this.

original: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba'i lan du /
translated: In response to this, Candrakƒ´rti says,üîΩ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs gnyi ga'i lan du bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis phyogs gnyi ga'i lan du bshad pa /
translated: Here, the author of the commentary explains the response to both positions:

original: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
analyzed: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
translated: Seeing, hearing, smelling, Tasting, touching, and mind

original: dbang po drug po de dag gi //
analyzed: dbang po drug po de dag gi //
translated: are the six sense faculties.

original: spyod yul blta bar bya la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
analyzed: spyod yul blta bar bya la sogs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so ;
translated: Their objects are the visible and so on.üîΩThe visible is so called because it is seen.

original: / lta zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: / lta zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan ni med de /
translated: The inner person who sees does not exist as another.

original: mig gi dbang po nyid gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i phyir mi gces bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nyid gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i phyir mi gces bya'o //
translated: The eye sense faculty itself is called the seer because it sees visible form.

original: gzhan du na 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smos par 'gyur ba zhig na do skad ma smos so //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'dis lta bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes smos par 'gyur ba zhig na do skad ma smos so //
translated: Otherwise, it would say ‚Äúbecause it sees with this,‚Äù but it does not say that.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same applies to the rest.üîΩThe ear is so called because it hears sound.üîΩThe nose is so called because it smells smell.

original: nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid rnams la yang sgra nyan par byed pa'i phyir rna ba yin /
analyzed: nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid rnams la yang sgra nyan par byed pa'i phyir rna ba yin /
translated: The tongue is so called because it tastes taste.üîΩThe body is so called because it touches touch.üîΩThe mind is so called because it cognizes phenomena.

original: dri snom par byed pa'i phyir sna yin /üîΩro myong bar byed pa'i phyir lce yin /
analyzed: dri snom par byed pa'i phyir sna yin / ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir lce yin /
translated: The nose is so called because it smells gandha.üîΩThe tongue is so called because it tastes rasa.

original: reg bya reg par byed pa'i phyir lus yin /
analyzed: reg bya reg par byed pa'i phyir lus yin /
translated: The body is so called because it contacts tangible objects sprastavya.

original: chos rnams sems par byed pa'i phyir yid yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams sems par byed pa'i phyir yid yin te /
translated: The mind is so called because it thinks dharmas.

original: nyan par byed pa la sogs pa'i byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan med par de bzhin du sbyar ro //üîΩdrug po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i phyir tshogs de la dbang po dang bdag po nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nyan par byed pa la sogs pa'i byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan med par de bzhin du sbyar ro // drug po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba'i phyir tshogs de la dbang po dang bdag po nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa ste /
translated: The agent of hearing and so on is not a separate inner being.üîΩThe six are so called because they are the dominant condition of the collection of consciousnesses that apprehend form and so on.üîΩThe meaning of the term sense faculty is explained in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po dag gzung ba'i phyir dbang po dang / yul dang snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i tshogs ci rigs par de dag las dbang po ni tshogs lhag ma de dag la gtso cher dbang ba nyid dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po dag gzung ba'i phyir dbang po dang / yul dang snang ba dang / nam mkha' dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa'i tshogs ci rigs par de dag las dbang po ni tshogs lhag ma de dag la gtso cher dbang ba nyid dang /
translated: The six sense faculties are so called because they are the dominant condition of the collection of consciousnesses that apprehend the six objects such as form and so on.

original: bdag po nyid byed pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po nyid byed pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because they exercise power.

original: drug po zhes bya ba ni so so'i ming smos pa nyid kyis grangs kyang rab tu 'grub mod kyi /
analyzed: drug po zhes bya ba ni so so'i ming smos pa nyid kyis grangs kyang rab tu 'grub mod kyi /
translated: The number six is established by the mere mention of their individual names.

original: de nges par gzung ba ni tha snyad du yang de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i byed pa po med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro @4b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nges par gzung ba ni tha snyad du yang de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i byed pa po med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro @4b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But they are specified as six in order to show that, even conventionally, there is no other agent that perceives form, etc., apart from them.üîΩThe eye, ear, and nose,

original: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //üîΩces dbang po so so'i ming smos pa nyid kyis grangs drug yin par yang rab tu 'grub mod kyi drug po zhes bya ba'i grangs de nges par gzung ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang drug po de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa la
analyzed: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid // ces dbang po so so'i ming smos pa nyid kyis grangs drug yin par yang rab tu 'grub mod kyi drug po zhes bya ba'i grangs de nges par gzung ba ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang drug po de dag las gzhan pa gzugs la sogs pa la
translated: and also the tongue, body, and mind,

original: dmigs par byed pa'i byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i byed pa po nang gi skyes bu gzhan med par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The number six is established by the mere mention of the individual names of the faculties. But they are specified as six in order to show that, even conventionally, there is no other internal agent that perceives form, etc., apart from them.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug po de dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi spyod yul gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩspyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul te de dag la mthu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug po de dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi spyod yul gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro // spyod yul zhes bya ba ni yul te de dag la mthu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni spyod yul zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bshad pa ste /
translated: The object-field of these is the six object-fields: visible form, sound, odor, taste, the tangible, and entities.

original: spyod yul ni yul te /
analyzed: spyod yul ni yul te /
translated: The object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.

original: yul de dag la dbang po rnams spyod pa'i mthu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: yul de dag la dbang po rnams spyod pa'i mthu yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba dang / bsnam par bya ba dang / myang bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug po de dag gi spyod yul ni /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba dang / bsnam par bya ba dang / myang bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug po de dag gi spyod yul ni /
translated: The object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams yin te /
translated: The object-field is the domain of the sense faculties.üîΩThe object-field is

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag dang go rims bzhin no //üîΩyul can dang yul so sor nges pa de yang tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin pas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag dang go rims bzhin no // yul can dang yul so sor nges pa de yang tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin pas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs
translated: and the object of seeing, etc., respectively.üîΩSince the determination of the object and the subject is conventional, not ultimate, the meaning of the reason is contradictory, because it exists only in a dissimilar instance.

original: kyi don 'gal ba nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi don 'gal ba nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
translated: This is the establishment of the contradiction in the meaning of the reason of both former positions.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i dbang po yul can dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa de yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pas phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gtan tshigs de ni don dam par yod par bsgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob 'ba' zhig la
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i dbang po yul can dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor nges pa de yang kun rdzob kyi tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pas phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gtan tshigs de ni don dam par yod par bsgrub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun rdzob 'ba' zhig la
translated: The sense faculties and their objects are distinct, and that is a conventional truth, not an ultimate truth. Therefore, the reason stated by the opponent is not established in the sense that it is a conventional truth that is discordant with the probandum, ultimate existence.

original: yod pa'i phyir don dam par yod par bsgrub pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin pas ma grub po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir don dam par yod par bsgrub pa dang / don 'gal ba nyid yin pas ma grub po zhes bstan to //
translated: It is contradictory to the probandum, and so it is not established.

original: don dam par ji ltar mig la sogs pa yul can dang yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad pa de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste @5a * //
analyzed: don dam par ji ltar mig la sogs pa yul can dang yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad pa de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste @5a * //
translated: The way in which it is untenable for the sense faculties such as the eyes to be subjects and objects ultimately will now be explained.

original: zhes bya bas ni don snga ma gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag gi mgo 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni don snga ma gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa 'og ma dag gi mgo 'dren par byed do //
translated: In order to clarify the previous meaning, he introduces the following verses.

original: re zhig mig gi dbang po gcig pu'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: re zhig mig gi dbang po gcig pu'i dbang du mdzad nas / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: First, with regard to the single eye sense faculty,

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: The eye does not see itself.

original: ces bya ba ni don dam par mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po dag yul can dang / yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad par ston pa'i skabs las /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni don dam par mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po dag yul can dang / yul gyi dngos por mi 'thad par ston pa'i skabs las /
translated: This is the context for demonstrating that ultimately the six sense faculties such as the eye and the six objects such as form are not tenable as subjects and objects.

original: re zhig dang por mig gi dbang po dang gzugs yul can dang yul gyi dngos pos mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas te ston to //
analyzed: re zhig dang por mig gi dbang po dang gzugs yul can dang yul gyi dngos pos mi 'thad pa'i dbang du byas te ston to //
translated: First, with regard to the eye sense faculty and form, the subject and object, he demonstrates the untenability of their status as subject and object.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa'i phyir te mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu mig gi skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan te gang gi phyir mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs la lta bar byed pa ste de'i
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni lta bar byed pa'i phyir te mig gi dbang po zhes bya ba'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu mig gi skye mched kyi mtshan nyid bstan te gang gi phyir mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs la lta bar byed pa ste de'i
translated: ‚ÄúVision‚Äù is so called because it sees, that is, the eye faculty.üîΩThis explains the conventional characteristic of the eye base.

original: phyir lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the eye faculty sees visible form, it is called ‚Äúvision.‚Äù

original: rang gi bdag nyid na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po de don dam par gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po de don dam par gzugs kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were its own nature‚Äù means if the eye faculty were the ultimate nature of visible form.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not see itself.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la ci'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la ci'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why would it not see itself?üîΩThe meaning of this statement will be clarified by the following passage.

original: phyogs de ni tshig gi don 'og nas 'byung bas gsal bar byed do zhes bya bar ni mig gi dbang po des mig gi dbang po de ni mi mthong ba de nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs de ni tshig gi don 'og nas 'byung bas gsal bar byed do zhes bya bar ni mig gi dbang po des mig gi dbang po de ni mi mthong ba de nyid yin te /
translated: The eye faculty does not see that eye faculty itself.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs de ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos kyis gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs de ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma shos kyis gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The latter half of the verse clarifies that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des de mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: des de mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not see itself.üîΩThe master [Vasubandhu] thinks that this is well known.

original: de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir mig gi dbang po des mig gi dbang po de mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: de ni grags pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir mig gi dbang po des mig gi dbang po de mi mthong zhe na /
translated: Why does that eye faculty not see that eye faculty?

original: de rang gis rang mi mthong ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de rang gis rang mi mthong ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it does not see itself.

original: de ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa yin pas bsgrub mi dgos so zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa yin pas bsgrub mi dgos so zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis dgongs so //
translated: Since this is well known to both parties in the debate, it does not need to be established. This is what the master [Vasubandhu] thinks.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: The word itself has the meaning of exclusion.

original: der mi mthong ba nyid ces bya bar blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: der mi mthong ba nyid ces bya bar blta bar bya'i /
translated: It should be seen that it does not see itself.

original: gzhan du na mthong ba zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na mthong ba zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise, it would be understood as seeing something else.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: That does not see itself.

original: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa de'i skabs nas nyid ces bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni mi mthong ba nyid ces bya bar nges par bzung ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa de'i skabs nas nyid ces bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni mi mthong ba nyid ces bya bar nges par bzung ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúitself‚Äù in the verse is a definite description, meaning ‚Äúnonseeing itself.‚Äù

original: des ni de nyid mi mthong ste //
analyzed: des ni de nyid mi mthong ste //
translated: It does not see itself.

original: zhes bya ba ltar sgra ji bzhin du nges par bzung na des de nyid mi @5b mthong na yul gzhan mthong ngo zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ltar sgra ji bzhin du nges par bzung na des de nyid mi @5b mthong na yul gzhan mthong ngo zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur bas de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If one takes the term ‚Äúitself‚Äù literally, it would mean that if it does not see itself, it sees other objects.

original: ji ste de lta na khyod kyis ci zhig bsgrubs par gyur te /üîΩgang gi tshe mig rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes smras pa de'i tshe gzhan du gyur pa de'i gzugs mthong ngo zhes khas len to zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol pos 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: ji ste de lta na khyod kyis ci zhig bsgrubs par gyur te / gang gi tshe mig rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes smras pa de'i tshe gzhan du gyur pa de'i gzugs mthong ngo zhes khas len to zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol pos 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: But if that is so, what have you proven?

original: de yis des ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis des ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: If you say that the eye does not see itself, then you accept that it sees other things, that is, forms.

original: ces bshad pa de lta na khyed dbu ma pas ci zhig bsgrubs par gyur te /
analyzed: ces bshad pa de lta na khyed dbu ma pas ci zhig bsgrubs par gyur te /
translated: If you say that, then what have you Madhyamikas established?

original: gang gi tshe mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba smras pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba smras pa'i tshe /
translated: When you say that the eye does not see itself,

original: kho bo cag mig gis gzhan du gyur pa gzugs mthong ngo zhes khas len pas des na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag mig gis gzhan du gyur pa gzugs mthong ngo zhes khas len pas des na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing de skad ces zer ba yin no //
translated: you think and say that we do not lose our position when we accept that the eye sees form, which is other.

original: de skad ces zer ba'i len du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba'i len du /
translated: In response to that,üîΩthe author of the commentary says that what you accept

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis khyod 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis khyod 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: is also

original: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: If it does not see itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: how will it see another?

original: mig la gzugs mthong ba'i mthu nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mig la gzugs mthong ba'i mthu nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that the eye does not have the power to see form.

original: khyed mig gis gzhan du gyur pa gzugs mthong bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang kho bos mi mthong ba nyid du bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: khyed mig gis gzhan du gyur pa gzugs mthong bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang kho bos mi mthong ba nyid du bsgrubs zin te /
translated: You who maintain that the eye sees another, that is, form, I have already established that it does not see even itself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba ;
translated: When one does not see itself,

original: / de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: / de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: how can it see another?

original: zhes bya ba smras te tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni mig la gzugs mthong ba'i mthu nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don ni mig la gzugs mthong ba'i mthu nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this verse is that the eye itself does not have the power to see form.üîΩHere, the first half of the verse teaches that the eye does not see itself.

original: de la 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong mas ni mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i chos bstan la zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: de la 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong mas ni mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i chos bstan la zhes bya ba ni / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The first half of the verse states:üîΩThe seeing of one‚Äôs own self

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: does not see itself.

original: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma des ni mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid du sgrub pa'i chos ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma des ni mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid du sgrub pa'i chos ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The first half of the verse teaches that the property that establishes that the eye does not see form is that it does not see itself.

original: phyed 'og mas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs mi mthong ba bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyed 'og mas ni bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs mi mthong ba bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second half of the verse indicates that the property to be established is the non-seeing of form.üîΩThe second half of the verse:

original: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: When one does not see the self,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: how can one see another?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des ni chos can mig la bsgrub par bya ba chos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin par bstan to //üîΩdpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi @6a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des ni chos can mig la bsgrub par bya ba chos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin par bstan to // dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi @6a * //
translated: indicates that the property to be established is the non-seeing of form, the property, in the subject, the eye.

original: dbang gis gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can rnams rna ba la sogs pa yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang gis gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can rnams rna ba la sogs pa yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The example is the ear, etc., which are subjects that are renowned to both parties in the debate, in terms of the property to be established and the proof.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pas sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba ches dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pas sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba ches dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúthe desire to connect the words of the proof by positing the property to be established and the proof‚Äù is to be applied to the subject, the property to be established, the proof, and the example.

original: de'i phyir don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately the eye faculty does not see form.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not see itself.

original: dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like the ear and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang ; sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang ; sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na rna ba la sogs pa ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rna ba la sogs pa ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, because the ear and so on do not see themselves,

original: de dag gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir des gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir des gzugs mi mthong ba nyid yin te /
translated: they do not see form. In the same way, because the eye faculty does not see itself, it does not see form.

original: rjes su dpag pa des ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ba nyid bstan to //
translated: This inference teaches that the eye faculty does not see form.

original: yang na phyed gong mas ni mig gi dbang po gzung ba nyid ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: yang na phyed gong mas ni mig gi dbang po gzung ba nyid ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Or, the first half teaches that the eye faculty is not the apprehender.

original: mig gi dbang po rang gi bdag nyid chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag la zhes bya ba ni yang na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po rang gi bdag nyid chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag la zhes bya ba ni yang na /
translated: The eye sense faculty is posited as an example that is similar to itself.üîΩ

original: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na // de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: The eye sense faculty itself is posited as an example that is similar to itself.üîΩThe verse of the root text that begins ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚Äù is a summary of the above verse.

original: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i tshig gong ma des ni mig gi dbang po nyid mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul nyid ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i tshig gong ma des ni mig gi dbang po nyid mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul nyid ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: The above verse teaches that the eye sense faculty is not the object apprehended by the eye sense faculty itself.

original: mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag go /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma yin pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag go /
translated: The eye sense faculty is posited as an example that is similar to itself in that it is not the object of the eye sense faculty.

original: phyed 'og mas ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong bar bstan pas bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: phyed 'og mas ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong bar bstan pas bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba ni / gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: The second half of the root verse teaches that the eye sense faculty does not see form. This teaches that form is not the object of the eye sense faculty.üîΩThe verse of the root text that begins ‚ÄúWhen it does not see itself‚Äù is a summary of the above verse.

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: The above verse teaches that if the eye sense faculty does not see itself, how could it see other things?

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong bar bstan pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des ni mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong bar bstan pas /
translated: The second half of this verse demonstrates that the eye faculty does not see form.

original: chos can gzugs la bsgrub par bya ba chos mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //üîΩ'dir de'i dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe de'i dbang @6b gis sbyor ba'i tshig tu gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
analyzed: chos can gzugs la bsgrub par bya ba chos mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa nyid du bstan to // 'dir de'i dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i dpe de'i dbang @6b gis sbyor ba'i tshig tu gyur ba ni 'og nas chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang /
translated: Thus, the subject, form, is demonstrated as the predicate, not being an object of the eye faculty.üîΩHere, the words ‚Äúdue to the power of that‚Äù refer to the subject, the predicate, the property of the subject, and the example that are due to the power of that.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúdue to the power of that‚Äù are applied to the subject, the predicate, the property of the subject, and the application of the example.

original: de'i phyir don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately form is not an object of the eye faculty,

original: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is an aggregation, like, for example, the nature of the eye faculty itself.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid ni bsags pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang bsags pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid ni bsags pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang bsags pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: For example, the nature of the eye faculty is not the object of the eye faculty because it is an aggregation. Likewise, form is not the object of the eye faculty because it is an aggregation.

original: rjes su dpag pa des ni gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des ni gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This inference demonstrates that form is not the object of the eye faculty.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba dang bsags pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba dang bsags pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The reason is stated in terms of the nature of the eye faculty and form, which are not seen by themselves because they are aggregations.

original: gtan tshigs thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid dang gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang phyogs gnyis ka la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya'o zhes
analyzed: gtan tshigs thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid dang gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang phyogs gnyis ka la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya'o zhes
translated: Also, the two parties should state their inferences, such as ‚Äúbecause it possesses resistance,‚Äù ‚Äúbecause it is derived from the elements,‚Äù ‚Äúbecause it is derivative form,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is included in the form aggregate.‚Äù

original: bya ba ni /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: bya ba ni / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The treatise states:üîΩThe seer does not see itself.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //üîΩgang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid // gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: If it does not see itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: How can it see others?

original: zhes bya bas mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ba'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul tsam nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi phyogs de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa
analyzed: zhes bya bas mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ba'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul tsam nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi phyogs de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa
translated: This is merely an illustration because it merely holds the mere mode of the term definition.

original: dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The reasons for those two positions are also that it is impeded and so on.

original: dper na khva dag las zhun mar bsrung bar bya'o zhes smras na khyi dag las mi bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na khva dag las zhun mar bsrung bar bya'o zhes smras na khyi dag las mi bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if it is said that one should protect from crows, one should not protect from dogs.

original: 'dir yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / bsags pa zhes bya ba de gnyis gtan tshigs su smos pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gtan tshigs su mi rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / bsags pa zhes bya ba de gnyis gtan tshigs su smos pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gtan tshigs su mi rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, the reason is stated as ‚Äúnot seeing itself‚Äù and ‚Äúaccumulation,‚Äù so it is not that ‚Äúhaving obstruction‚Äù and so on are not suitable as reasons.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: Ultimately, the eye faculty does not see form.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi @7a * //üîΩphyir ram / 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi @7a * // phyir ram / 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Because it has obstruction,üîΩbecause it is derived from the elements,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because it is derivative form,

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am /
translated: because it belongs to the form aggregate, and so on, like the ear and so on.

original: don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Or, ultimately, form is not the object of the eye faculty.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram /üîΩ'byung ba las gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram / 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: Because it has obstruction,üîΩbecause it is derived from the elements,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because it is derivative form,üîΩbecause it belongs to the form aggregate, and so on, like the ear and so on.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes tshad ma sngar bstan pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes tshad ma sngar bstan pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because they are included in the aggregate of form, etc., like the nature of the eye faculty.

original: 'dir kha cig na re mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi /
translated: Here, one opponent says: ‚ÄúIt is reasonable that the eye does not see itself because it is imperceptible.üîΩBut form is perceptible, so it is said that it is seen.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni bstan du yod pa yin pas de'i phyir de mthong ngo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir sde pa gzhan dag dbu ma pas gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te zhes bshad pa de khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes rgolüîΩba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni bstan du yod pa yin pas de'i phyir de mthong ngo zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir sde pa gzhan dag dbu ma pas gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te zhes bshad pa de khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba yin no //
translated: Here, other schools argue that if the Madhyamaka accepts the explanation that form is not the object of the eye faculty, it is undermined.

original: de dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: They say: ‚ÄúThe Madhyamaka says that ultimately the eye faculty does not see form.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad par gtan tshigs /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bshad par gtan tshigs /
translated: Because it does not see itself, like the ear and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rung ste /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba // zhes bya ba ni rung ste /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it does not see itself‚Äù is appropriate.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn also said:

original: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bstan du med la thogs pa med pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bstan du med la thogs pa med pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Form is threefold: that which is demonstrable and impeded, that which is not demonstrable but impeded, and that which is neither demonstrable nor impeded.

original: de la bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de la bstan du yod pa thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi skye mched do //
translated: Among those, that which is demonstrable and impeded is the form base.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa ni rnam par rigs byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa med pa ni rnam par rigs byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: That which is not demonstrable but impeded is nonindicative form.üîΩThat which is neither demonstrable nor impeded is the five sense faculties such as the eyes and so on.

original: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig la sogs pa dbang po la sogs pa lnga'o zhes gsungs pas mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi /
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa ni mig la sogs pa dbang po la sogs pa lnga'o zhes gsungs pas mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi /
translated: Since it is said that the eye does not see itself because it is not demonstrable, this is appropriate.

original: khyed kyis don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: You say that ultimately form is not the object of the eye facultyüîΩbecause it is composite, like the nature of the eye faculty itself.

original: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bshad pas mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes bsgrubs pa @7b de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bshad pas mig gi dbang pos gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes bsgrubs pa @7b de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That proof that the eye faculty does not see form is illogical.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched ni sngar bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir de mthong ngo zhes gsungs bzhin du de mi mthong ngo zhes bsgrub pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched ni sngar bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir de mthong ngo zhes gsungs bzhin du de mi mthong ngo zhes bsgrub pa ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The form base was previously taught to exist and to be impeded. Therefore, it is said that it is seen. To prove that it is not seen contradicts your assertion.

original: de skad ces zer ba'i len du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la rgyu gzhan des kho bo cag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba'i len du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la rgyu gzhan des kho bo cag gis smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúIn that case, the reason and example that we state are not undermined by that other reason.‚Äù

original: de la khyed na re mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi zhes zer ba'i byed rgyu gzhan des kho bo cag gis don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de rangüîΩgi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de la khyed na re mig gis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba ni bstan du med pa yin pa'i phyir rung mod kyi zhes zer ba'i byed rgyu gzhan des kho bo cag gis don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs dang don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: You say: It is reasonable that the eye does not see itself because it is not visible.üîΩBut we say that ultimately the eye faculty does not see form because it does not see itself.

original: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras ba'i dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi rjes su dpag pa de khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes smras ba'i dpe bsgrub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi rjes su dpag pa de khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: The reason that ultimately form is not the object of the eye faculty because it is composite is established by our example, like the nature of the eye faculty itself. Therefore our inference is not undermined.

original: chos mngon pa pa dag na re gal te khyad par med pa dag mig gis gzugs rnams mi mthong ba nyid ces zer na de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa dag na re gal te khyad par med pa dag mig gis gzugs rnams mi mthong ba nyid ces zer na de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Abhidharmikas say: If you say that the eye does not see form because it does not see itself, that is establishing what is already established.

original: phyogs ni de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs ni de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the direction is not seen by the eye that is similar to it.

original: 'on te mig gis gzugs rnams mi mthong ba rten pa mtshungs pa la bya'o zhes zer na ni de lta na khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te mig gis gzugs rnams mi mthong ba rten pa mtshungs pa la bya'o zhes zer na ni de lta na khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that the eye does not see forms in terms of the similar basis, then in that case, your assertion is undermined.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: Because the Abhidharma states:

original: rten mtshungs mig gis gzugs rnams mthong //
analyzed: rten mtshungs mig gis gzugs rnams mthong //
translated: The eye sees forms that are of a similar basis.

original: der brten rnam par shes pas min //
analyzed: der brten rnam par shes pas min //
translated: Consciousness does not, because it is based on that.üîΩThis is what they say.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya bya ba ni sngar sde pa gzhan dag la dbu ma pas lan btab pa dang / 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag dbu ma pa la grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa dang / khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya bya ba ni sngar sde pa gzhan dag la dbu ma pas lan btab pa dang / 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag dbu ma pa la grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa dang / khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba yin no //
translated: This is the response of the Madhyamikas to the other schools, and the fault of the Abhidharma masters proving what is already established for the Madhyamikas, and the fault of undermining their own assertions.

original: de dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gal te de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba la bya'o zhes zer na ni ma grub pa'i skyon chagsüîΩpa yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces dbu ma pas don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de gal te de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba la bya'o zhes zer na ni ma grub pa'i skyon chags pa yin te /
translated: If they say that the eye sense faculty does not see form ultimately, as explained by the Madhyamaka, and that this means it does not see form with an eye that is similar to it, then they commit the error of not establishing their own position.

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba ni nged kyi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te rten pa mtshungs @8a * //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba ni nged kyi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro // 'on te rten pa mtshungs @8a * //
translated: Because the eye that is similar to it does not see form is established for our position.
