original: pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba la bya'o zhes zer na ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i mig gis mi mthong ba la bya'o zhes zer na ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: If they say that it means the eye that is similar in support does not see, then they contradict their own assertions.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: Because the Abhidharma states:

original: rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs rnams mthong gi /
analyzed: rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs rnams mthong gi /
translated: The eye that is similar in support sees form.

original: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas ni mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩde skad ces zer na de'i lan du /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas ni mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer na de'i lan du /
translated: The consciousness that is supported on it does not see.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: To respond to such statements, the author of the commentary says:

original: de la 'dir rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin la khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, since the eye itself, which is the similar support, is taken as the subject, it is not that which is established being established, nor is it that which is accepted being undermined.

original: mig gis gzugs ni mi mthong zhing //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs ni mi mthong zhing //
translated: The eye does not see form,

original: yid kyis chos rnams mi shes te //
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams mi shes te //
translated: the mind does not know phenomena,

original: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug go //
translated: where the world does not engage,

original: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: that is the highest truth.

original: 'dir nged dbu ma pas rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nged dbu ma pas rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig nyid phyogs su byas pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, since the eye itself, which is the similar support, is taken as the subject, it is not that which is established being established,

original: khyed la rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed la rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because for you it is not established that the eye, which is the similar support, does not see form.

original: khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is it that which is accepted being undermined.

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: For the Abhidharma says:

original: rten mtshungs mig gis gzugs rnams mthong //
analyzed: rten mtshungs mig gis gzugs rnams mthong //
translated: The eye with a similar support sees forms.

original: der brten rnam par shes pas min //
analyzed: der brten rnam par shes pas min //
translated: Consciousness supported by that does not.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni nged kyang khas len mod kyi de ni kun rdzob tu gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni nged kyang khas len mod kyi de ni kun rdzob tu gsungs pa yin te /
translated: We agree with that, but it is said in terms of the conventional.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Lord said in the Subahupariprccha-sutra:üîΩ‚ÄúThe Omniscient One said

original: mig gis gzugs ni mthong ngo zhes //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs ni mthong ngo zhes //
translated: That the eye sees form,

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gang gsungs pa //
translated: Is taught as conventional truth

original: log pa'i nga rgyal 'jig rten la //üîΩde ni kun rdzob bden par bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal 'jig rten la // de ni kun rdzob bden par bstan // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the world with its false pride.

original: de kun rdzob tu gsungs pa yin gyi don dam par gsungs pa ma yin par ci ltar nges par shes she na /
analyzed: de kun rdzob tu gsungs pa yin gyi don dam par gsungs pa ma yin par ci ltar nges par shes she na /
translated: How do we know that it is said in terms of the conventional and not in terms of the ultimate?

original: 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo nyid las /
analyzed: 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo nyid las /
translated: The Subahupariprccha-sutra itself says:

original: mig gis gzugs ni mi mthong zhing //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs ni mi mthong zhing //
translated: The eye does not see form,

original: yid kyis chos rnams mi shes te //
analyzed: yid kyis chos rnams mi shes te //
translated: The mind does not know phenomena.

original: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
translated: That which the world does not engage

original: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o ;
translated: Is the ultimate truth.

original: / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kho bo cag rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis kun rdzob tu gzugs mthong bar khas blangs pa de don dam par mi mthong bar bsgrubs pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pa'i phyir kho bo cag rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis kun rdzob tu gzugs mthong bar khas blangs pa de don dam par mi mthong bar bsgrubs pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since we have accepted that the eye which is a similar support sees form conventionally, but we have proven that it does not see ultimately, therefore our position is not undermined.üîΩSince we have not accepted that the eye sees form ultimately, and since the eighth example of an inference has been taught, therefore it is established.

original: don dam par mig gis gzugs mthong bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir @8b dang ; rjes su dpag pa brgyad pa ji skad bstan pa'i phyir de grub pas zhes bya bas ni rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba de grub pas de'i phyir yang khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: don dam par mig gis gzugs mthong bar khas ma blangs pa'i phyir @8b dang ; rjes su dpag pa brgyad pa ji skad bstan pa'i phyir de grub pas zhes bya bas ni rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba de grub pas de'i phyir yang khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: This shows that since it is established that the eye which is a similar support does not see form, therefore our position is not undermined.

original: de'i phyir don dam par rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ste ;
translated: Therefore, the eye which is a similar support does not see form ultimately.

original: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir na de dang mtshungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir na de dang mtshungs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is the eye faculty, it is like that which is similar to it.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig ni mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig ni mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, the eye that is similar to that is the eye faculty because it does not see form.

original: gzugs mi mthong ba de bzhin du rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig kyang mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi mthong ba de bzhin du rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig kyang mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the eye that is similar in being a support is the eye faculty because it does not see form.üîΩOr, because it is a physical sense faculty, like the ear.

original: yang na dbang po gzugs can yin pa'i phyir rna ba bzhin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na rjes su dpag pa dang gtan tshigs dang dpe 'di ltar yang sbyar te /üîΩdon dam par rten pa ma tshangs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ste /
analyzed: yang na dbang po gzugs can yin pa'i phyir rna ba bzhin no zhes bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yang na rjes su dpag pa dang gtan tshigs dang dpe 'di ltar yang sbyar te / don dam par rten pa ma tshangs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ste /
translated: Or, this inference, reason, and example can be applied in the following way:

original: dbang po gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba bzhin no //
translated: The eye that is not similar in being a support does not see form in ultimate truth because it is a physical sense faculty, like the ear.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa de dag gis don dam par rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba bkag pa'i phyir yang khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dir gal te gzhan dag na re 'jig rten la mig gis gzugs mthong bar grags pa sel bar byed pa ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis grags pa'i gnod
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa de dag gis don dam par rten pa mtshungs pa'i mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba bkag pa'i phyir yang khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro // 'dir gal te gzhan dag na re 'jig rten la mig gis gzugs mthong bar grags pa sel bar byed pa ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis grags pa'i gnod
translated: Thus, because those inferences refute the ultimate non-seeing of form by the eye that is similar to the support, the opponent‚Äôs position is undermined.üîΩHere, if others say that the refutation of the world‚Äôs renown that ‚Äúthe eye sees form‚Äù is undermined by renown, the opponent‚Äôs position that is implied is this:

original: par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary himself says, ‚ÄúIt is not undermined by renown.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar bzung ba nyid kyis de ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar bzung ba nyid kyis de ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúBecause the specific thesis is accepted, it is not refuted, and because it has already been responded to.‚Äù

original: don dam par mig gis gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar bzung ba nyid kyis 'jig rten la mig gis gzugs mthong bar grags pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir dang sngar skye ba med pa bstan pa'i skabs su kun rdzob tu skyeüîΩba yod na don dam par skye ba med do zhes lan btab pa nyid kyis 'dir yang kun rdzob tu mig gis gzugs mthong la don dam par mi mthong bar bstan pas grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i @9a * //
analyzed: don dam par mig gis gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar bzung ba nyid kyis 'jig rten la mig gis gzugs mthong bar grags pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir dang sngar skye ba med pa bstan pa'i skabs su kun rdzob tu skye ba yod na don dam par skye ba med do zhes lan btab pa nyid kyis 'dir yang kun rdzob tu mig gis gzugs mthong la don dam par mi mthong bar bstan pas grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i @9a * //
translated: The special thesis ‚Äúultimately the eye does not see form‚Äù does not abandon the worldly renown that the eye sees form, since it is stated in the context of teaching nonarising thatüîΩif there is arising conventionally, there is no arising ultimately.

original: skyon med do //
analyzed: skyon med do //
translated: Since this is taught here, the eye sees form conventionally but does not see it ultimately, so the fault of contradicting renown does not arise.

original: kha cig dag na re mig gis mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig dag na re mig gis mthong ba nyid de /
translated: Some say: The eye itself sees form.üîΩBecause it is the agent of the action of seeing.

original: lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir kha che'i bye brag tu smra bdag na re dbu ma pas mig gis gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes bshad pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir kha che'i bye brag tu smra bdag na re dbu ma pas mig gis gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes bshad pa de mi rung ste /
translated: This is the assertion of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas. They say that the statement by the MƒÅdhyamika that the eye does not see form is incorrect.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig gis gzugs mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong ba nyid do //
translated: The eye sees visible form.

original: lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Because it is the agent of the action of seeing.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: Moreover, these are the subject, the predicate to be proven, and the proof.

original: mig ni lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gzugs mthong ba nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mig ni lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir gzugs mthong ba nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The eye is the seer because it is the agent of the action of seeing.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary says:

original: kha cig na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Some say that is not logical.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re kha che ba dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re kha che ba dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes zer bar sbyar ro //
translated: Some say that the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that is not logical.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is only a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is the agent of the action of seeing‚Äù is not established, because it is only part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: mig gis mthong ba nyid de zhes dam bcas pa de ni lta ba'i bya ba byed pa'i don yin pas de bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: mig gis mthong ba nyid de zhes dam bcas pa de ni lta ba'i bya ba byed pa'i don yin pas de bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir
translated: The thesis ‚Äúit is the eye itself that sees‚Äù means that the eye is the object that performs the action of seeing. Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the agent of the action of seeing‚Äù is only part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: ma grub po //
analyzed: ma grub po //
translated: Therefore it is not established.

original: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical because there is no pervasion.

original: kha che dag gi rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs de la dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha che dag gi rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs de la dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the system of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, there is no example for inference.

original: gzhan yang dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical because the refutation has already been stated.

original: rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan ma thag pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid du dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir kha che dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan ma thag pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid du dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir kha che dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ro //
translated: The Autocommentary states, ‚ÄúThe assertion of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas is illogical.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re kha che dag gis smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon de ba shar mas kha che dag gis smras pa'i phyogs de rigs pa ma yin par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kha che dag gis smras pa ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon de ba shar mas kha che dag gis smras pa'i phyogs de rigs pa ma yin par sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúThe assertion of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas is illogical‚Äù and so on. This is the master Devasharma‚Äôs refutation of the position of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, which is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: skad cig mar smra ba rnams la ni skad cig ma yin pas bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig mar smra ba rnams la ni skad cig ma yin pas bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because for those who assert momentariness, action is untenable because it is momentary.

original: @9b zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: @9b zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The Autocommentary states,üîΩ‚ÄúThe assertion of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas is illogical.‚Äù

original: gang dag skad cig mar smra ba rnams kyi phyogs la ni chos thams cad skad cig ma yin pas de dag la ni kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang dag skad cig mar smra ba rnams kyi phyogs la ni chos thams cad skad cig ma yin pas de dag la ni kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: For those who advocate momentariness, all phenomena are momentary, and therefore it is untenable for them to say, ‚ÄúBecause the eye is the agent of the action of seeing.‚Äù

original: mig gis lta ba'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de gal te skad cig ma nyid yin na de'i phyir de skyes ma thag kho nar 'jig pas lta ba'i bya ba byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gis lta ba'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de gal te skad cig ma nyid yin na de'i phyir de skyes ma thag kho nar 'jig pas lta ba'i bya ba byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the action of seeing that is performed by the eye is momentary, then because it ceases immediately after it arises, it is untenable that it performs the action of seeing.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams la yang de nyid de las gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams la yang de nyid de las gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is also illogical for those who advocate nonmomentariness because it is untenable that it is the same or different from that.

original: gang dag skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams kyi phyogs la yang chos thams cad skad cig mar mi 'dod pas de dag la yang kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thadüîΩpa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang dag skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams kyi phyogs la yang chos thams cad skad cig mar mi 'dod pas de dag la yang kha che dag gi gtan tshigs lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, in the case of those who assert that things are not momentary, since they do not assert that all phenomena are momentary, it is also untenable for them to say, ‚ÄúBecause it is the agent of the action of seeing,‚Äù as the reason for the existence of the seer.

original: mig gis lta ba'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de gal te skad cig ma nyid ma yin na de'i phyir mig snga na lta ba'i bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de nyid phyis de las gzhan pa'i lta ba'i bya ba byed pa nyid du 'gyur
analyzed: mig gis lta ba'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de gal te skad cig ma nyid ma yin na de'i phyir mig snga na lta ba'i bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de nyid phyis de las gzhan pa'i lta ba'i bya ba byed pa nyid du 'gyur
translated: If the eye that is the agent of the action of seeing is not momentary, then it would be untenable for that very eye that previously was not the agent of the action of seeing to later be the agent of the action of seeing that is different from it.

original: bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir kha che dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes slob dpon de ba shar mas rang gi dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa dkar po 'char ba zhes bya ba las bshad do //
analyzed: bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir kha che dag gis smras pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes slob dpon de ba shar mas rang gi dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa dkar po 'char ba zhes bya ba las bshad do //
translated: Therefore the master Devasharma explains in his commentary on the root text of the Middle Way, called the Rising of the Sun, ‚ÄúThat which is said by the Kashmiri is not logical.‚Äù

original: mdo sde ba dag na re 'du byed rnams la bya ba med pa'i phyir mig gis kyang ma mthong la gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde ba dag na re 'du byed rnams la bya ba med pa'i phyir mig gis kyang ma mthong la gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: Because compounded phenomena have no action, the eye does not see and others do not see.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pas /üîΩkhyed mig gis mi mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni grub pa kho na la sgrub pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re lus bya ba 'du byed rnams la bya ba dang / g-yo ba dang spyod pa med pa'i phyir mig gis kyang gzugs mi mthong la /
analyzed: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pas / khyed mig gis mi mthong ngo zhes zer ba ni grub pa kho na la sgrub pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re lus bya ba 'du byed rnams la bya ba dang / g-yo ba dang spyod pa med pa'i phyir mig gis kyang gzugs mi mthong la /
translated: The sutras state: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.üîΩTherefore, it is established that the eye does not see and you are simply proving what is already established.

original: nang gi skyes bu la sogs pa bdag gi rdzas gzhan gyis kyang gzugs mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi skyes bu la sogs pa bdag gi rdzas gzhan gyis kyang gzugs mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Sautrantikas say: The eye does not see form because the body and compounded phenomena have no action, movement or performance and the inner being and so on, which are other substantial entities of the self, do not see form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pas bdag cag gi lung de las mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen de dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar gsungs par zad kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pas bdag cag gi lung de las mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen de dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar gsungs par zad kyi /
translated: our scriptures say that eye consciousness arises from conditions such as the eye and forms.

original: mig gis gzugs mthong bar ma gsungs pas /üîΩkhyed dbu ma pa @10a * //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong bar ma gsungs pas / khyed dbu ma pa @10a * //
translated: But it does not say that the eye sees form.

original: dag gi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba ji skad smras pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid do zhes sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa kho na la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dag gi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba ji skad smras pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba nyid do zhes sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa kho na la sgrub pa yin pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the argument that you Madhyamaka put forward, ‚ÄúThe eye does not see form,‚Äù is a proof of what is already established and thus is not correct.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: skye ba bkag pa kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the refutation of arising alone refutes the nonexistence of eye consciousness, it is not a proof of what is already established.

original: kho bos rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba bkag pa kho nas don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir de khyed la ma grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bos rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis dang / rgyu med pa las skye ba bkag pa kho nas don dam par mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir de khyed la ma grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the arising of eye consciousness is untenable in an ultimate sense, it is not established for you, and so it is not an established basis.

original: gal te mdo sde pa dag 'di skad ces mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin du khyed skye ba dgag pa kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'thad do zhes zer
analyzed: gal te mdo sde pa dag 'di skad ces mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin du khyed skye ba dgag pa kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'thad do zhes zer
translated: If the SautrƒÅntikas say, ‚ÄúJust as it is said in the s≈´tras that the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form, you are refuting arising alone when you say that the arising of eye consciousness is untenable,‚Äù

original: ba ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: ba ni khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du /
translated: then this is the opponent‚Äôs position that is implied in the Commentary, which is stated as, ‚ÄúThis would contradict your acceptance.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the Commentary says, ‚ÄúThis would not contradict our acceptance.‚Äù

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mdo sde'i don khas blangs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mdo sde'i don khas blangs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because we accept the meaning of the sutras that accords with conventional truth.

original: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden par bka' stsal pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde las mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs pa ni tha snyad kyi bden par bka' stsal pa yin la /
translated: The sutra statement, ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,‚Äù is a statement about conventional truth.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mdo sde'i don de kho bo cag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i mdo sde'i don de kho bo cag gis khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because we accept the meaning of the sutras that accords with conventional truth, we are not undermined by our acceptance.

original: gal te mdo sde'i don de don dam par gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ba de'i lan du /üîΩdon dam par mdo sde'i don la rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te mdo sde'i don de don dam par gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ba de'i lan du / don dam par mdo sde'i don la rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the sutras is stated ultimately,üîΩwe reply that the meaning of the sutras is not logical ultimately.

original: mdo sde'i don de don dam par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de la rigs pa dang lung med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde'i don de don dam par gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de la rigs pa dang lung med pa'i phyir te /
translated: We reply that there is no logic or scripture to support the claim that the meaning of the sutras is stated ultimately.

original: kho bos rjes su dpag pa dag gis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / lung las kyang /
analyzed: kho bos rjes su dpag pa dag gis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / lung las kyang /
translated: Because we refute ultimate arising by means of inference and because a scripture says:

original: gzugs kyi skye ba la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one engages in the arising of form, one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir @10b dang ; mig dang gzugs dag gi lta ba po dang lta ba nyid bkag pa'i phyir de'i khyad par mi srid pas chog mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i don 'og nas 'byung baüîΩdag gi mgo 'dren par byed do //üîΩde la bye brag pa dag mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir @10b dang ; mig dang gzugs dag gi lta ba po dang lta ba nyid bkag pa'i phyir de'i khyad par mi srid pas chog mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma de nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i don 'og nas 'byung ba dag gi mgo 'dren par byed do // de la bye brag pa dag mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: Since the arising of the eyes and the form source is refuted, the seer and the seen of the eyes and form are refuted, and since it is sufficient that their attributes are impossible, the verse summary is stated in order to introduce the meaning of the following that is explained in another way.üîΩThe Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine that the eyes see forms,

original: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes rtog pa dang grangs can dag mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes rtog pa dang grangs can dag mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: grasping objects without contact. The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the eyes see forms,

original: yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes rtog par byed pa de dag kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes rtog par byed pa de dag kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmig dang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa yang 'dzin par mi byed la phrad pa yang 'dzin par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / mig dang gzugs dag gi lta ba po dang / blta bar bya ba nyid bkag pa'i phyir mig kyang lta ba po nyid ma yin la gzugs kyang blta bar bya ba nyid ma yin pas mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa yang mi 'dzin la phrad pa yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dang grangs can dag
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa yang 'dzin par mi byed la phrad pa yang 'dzin par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / mig dang gzugs dag gi lta ba po dang / blta bar bya ba nyid bkag pa'i phyir mig kyang lta ba po nyid ma yin la gzugs kyang blta bar bya ba nyid ma yin pas mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa yang mi 'dzin la phrad pa yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir bye brag pa dang grangs can dag
translated: Why?üîΩBecause the arising of the eye and form sources is refuted, the eye does not see noncontacted form and it does not see contacted form.üîΩBecause the seer and the seen of the eye and form are refuted, the eye is not the seer and form is not the seen.

original: gis brtags pa ma phrad pa 'dzin pa dang phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de'i khyad par mi srid pas de dag yang dgag par bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: gis brtags pa ma phrad pa 'dzin pa dang phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de'i khyad par mi srid pas de dag yang dgag par bya mi dgos te /
translated: Since the eye does not see noncontacted form and it does not see contacted form, the distinctions imputed by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, such as apprehending noncontact and apprehending contact, are impossible. Therefore it is unnecessary to refute them.

original: chog mod kyi 'on kyang nyan pa'i skye bo'i blo gros dbye bar 'dod pas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩ'on kyang kun rdzob tu skye mched rnams kyi skye ba khas blangs nas nyan pa'i skye bo'i blo gros kyi kha dbye zhing bye brag tu rtogs par bya bar 'dod pas mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin pa dang phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs
analyzed: chog mod kyi 'on kyang nyan pa'i skye bo'i blo gros dbye bar 'dod pas phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / 'on kyang kun rdzob tu skye mched rnams kyi skye ba khas blangs nas nyan pa'i skye bo'i blo gros kyi kha dbye zhing bye brag tu rtogs par bya bar 'dod pas mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin pa dang phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs
translated: Although that is sufficient, still, because I wish to open the intellect of those who listen, I will explain a mere fraction.üîΩHowever, having accepted the arising of the sense bases conventionally, I wish to open the intellect of those who listen and make them understand the distinctions, so I will explain a mere fraction here in order to dispel theüîΩpositions of those who assert that the eye sense faculty apprehends uncontacted form and those who assert that it apprehends contacted form.

original: bsal ba'i phyir yang 'dir phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir yang 'dir phyogs tsam zhig bshad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro // lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The view that the eye sense faculty sees formüîΩis not tenable.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: The view that the eye sense faculty sees form is not tenable.

original: ces bya bas snga ma bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan nas zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma des sngar don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: ces bya bas snga ma bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan nas zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma des sngar don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: As before, the first half of the verse teaches the property of the position, the fact that the eye does not see itself.üîΩThe second half of the verse teaches the example, the fact that the ear and so on do not see.üîΩThe first half of the verse teaches the property of the position, the fact that the eye does not see itself, as was previously stated in the line, Ultimately, the eye sense faculty does not see form, because it does not see itself, like the ear and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas rang gi bdag nyid ma mthong ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan pa dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /üîΩbsags pa'i phyir dper na @11a * //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas rang gi bdag nyid ma mthong ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan pa dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /üîΩbsags pa'i phyir dper na @11a * //
translated: The second half of the verse teaches the example, the fact that the ear and so on do not see, as was previously stated in the line, The ear and so on do not see, because they are not eyes, like the nose and so on.

original: mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas bsags pa nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba nyid dang / 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan nas rjes su dpag pa 'og ma dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas bsags pa nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba nyid dang / 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid phyogs kyi chos su bstan nas rjes su dpag pa 'og ma dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, here, the first half of the verse teaches that not seeing itself and being derived from the elements are the properties of the subject. The latter half of the verse should be applied to establish the latter inferences.

original: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: When it does not see itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: how does it see another?

original: zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba chos nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des sngar don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba chos nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des sngar don dam par mig gi dbang pos ni gzugs mi mthong ba nyid de /
translated: This is the statement of the property of the subject to be established. The latter half of the verse states that ultimately the eye sense faculty does not see form.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas gzugs mi mthong ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas gzugs mi mthong ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Because it does not see itself, like the ear and so on.üîΩIn the same way, the second half of the verse sets forth the probandum, the object of refutation, that ultimately form is not the object of the eye sense faculty,

original: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis yul ma phrad paüîΩ'dzin pa ma yin pa nyid dang / mig gi dbang po yul la phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'og ma dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bas mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa de bzhin du 'dir yang tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis yul ma phrad paüîΩ'dzin pa ma yin pa nyid dang / mig gi dbang po yul la phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba chos su nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'og ma dag bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because it is an aggregation, like the nature of the eye sense faculty itself.üîΩIn the same way, the latter half of the verse sets forth the probandum, the object of refutation, that the object is not apprehended without contactüîΩand that the eye sense faculty does not apprehend the object through contact.

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bsal bar 'dod pas sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bsal bar 'dod pas sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúshould be applied‚Äù means that because it is desired to eliminate other misconceptions imputed by others, the statements of the syllogism should be applied.

original: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes yongs su brtags pa dang / grangs can dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes yongs su brtags pa dang / grangs can dag gis mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas impute that the eye sees form and apprehends uncontacted objects,üîΩand the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas impute that the eye sees form and apprehends contacted objects.

original: yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bsal bar 'dod pas 'di man chad rim bzhin du sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan bsal bar 'dod pas 'di man chad rim bzhin du sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is desired to eliminate those other misconceptions, the statements of the syllogism should be applied in order from here on.üîΩIn this regard, for those who say that the eye apprehends without contact, the syllogism is:

original: de la gang dag mig ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir mthong ba ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyal po de dag gis rtog chen dag las shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de la gang dag mig ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir mthong ba ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir dper na rgyal po de dag gis rtog chen dag las shes pa bzhin te /
translated: The object of seeing is the meaning of consciousness because it is like, for example, the consciousnesses of the great thinkers of those kings.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re mig gis gzugs mthong ste /
translated: The Vaiseikas say that the eye sees visible form,üîΩand that it apprehends an object without coming into contact with it.

original: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin @11b par byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir dbu ma pas mig gis yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yul ma phrad pa 'dzin @11b par byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir dbu ma pas mig gis yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The Madhyamikas prove to them that the eye does not apprehend an object without coming into contact with it.

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni bye brag pa dag go //üîΩmig ni ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs mthong ste de yang mig gi dbang po rang gi gnas na gnas pa nyid kyis yul phyi rol na gnas pa thag nye ba'am ring ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni bye brag pa dag go // mig ni ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzugs mthong ste de yang mig gi dbang po rang gi gnas na gnas pa nyid kyis yul phyi rol na gnas pa thag nye ba'am ring ba yang rung ste /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúthose who say‚Äù refers to the Vaiseikas.üîΩThe eye apprehends without coming into contact.

original: ma phrad pa kho na 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: ma phrad pa kho na 'dzin par byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: The eye sees visible form. And that is to say that the eye faculty, remaining in its own location, apprehends an object, whether near or far, only without coming into contact with it.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi phyogs dgag pa'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mthong ba ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The author of the commentary states, ‚ÄúBecause seeing is the meaning of knowledge,‚Äù in order to refute that position.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The verbal root d·πõ≈õ means to know, not to apprehend, therefore it is said that the eye does not apprehend visible form without contact.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩdper na rgyal po dag gis rtog chen dag las shes pa bzhin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na / dper na rgyal po dag gis rtog chen dag las shes pa bzhin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How is that?üîΩIt is like the knowledge of kings from spies.

original: dper na rgyal po dag gis rtog chen pa dag dang / bya ma rta dang / nyan rna ba dag gi tshig las pha rol gyi yul 'khor gyi rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba de ni mthong ba'am 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin la de yang rtog chen la sogs pa brgyud pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad
analyzed: dper na rgyal po dag gis rtog chen pa dag dang / bya ma rta dang / nyan rna ba dag gi tshig las pha rol gyi yul 'khor gyi rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba de ni mthong ba'am 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin la de yang rtog chen la sogs pa brgyud pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad
translated: For example, it is said that kings know the affairs of other countries through the words of spies, birds, and informants. That is not knowledge of seeing or apprehending, it is knowledge of what is known. That is also merely imputed in dependence on spies and so on.

original: kyi dngos su shes pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de yang mthong ba'am 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: kyi dngos su shes pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de yang mthong ba'am 'dzin pa'i don ma yin gyi shes pa'i don yin la /
translated: Just as the eye does not directly see visible form, in the same way, the eye does not directly apprehend or see the visible form that is not in contact with it.

original: de yang rkyen gzhan dag la sogs pa brgyud pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad kyi dngos su shes pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rkyen gzhan dag la sogs pa brgyud pa las nye bar gdags pa tsam du zad kyi dngos su shes pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúapprehends‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúconsciousness,‚Äù and that is merely nominally designated in dependence on other conditions, etc., but it is not directly consciousness itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it does not see itself.

original: mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa gzhan mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa gzhan mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eye sense faculty does not see itself, and therefore it does not see other objects that are not in contact with it.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not see itself‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ni rang gi bdag nyid mi shes pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ni rang gi bdag nyid mi shes pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the reason is that it does not know itself.‚Äù

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid me mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ni rang gi bdag nyid mi shes pa yin pas rang gi bdag nyid mi shesüîΩpa des yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par @12a * //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang pos rang gi bdag nyid me mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ni rang gi bdag nyid mi shes pa yin pas rang gi bdag nyid mi shes pa des yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par @12a * //
translated: The verbal root of ‚Äúseeing‚Äù means ‚Äúto know,‚Äù and since the eye sense faculty does not see itself, the meaning of the reason is that it does not know itself.

original: mi byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It does not apprehend an object that is not in contact with it.

original: de'i phyir don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately the eye does not apprehend an object that is not in contact with it,

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it does not see itself, like the nose sense faculty and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.

original: dper na sna la sogs pa ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sna la sogs pa ni rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the eye does not apprehend imperceptible objects because it does not see its own self.

original: rjes su dpag pa des ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This inference teaches that the eye sense faculty does not apprehend imperceptible objects.

original: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang /
translated: In the same way, ultimately form is not apprehended by the eye sense faculty that apprehends imperceptible objects because it is derived from the elements, like smell and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason and the example, respectively.

original: dper na dri la sogs pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir mig dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzinüîΩpa'i gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na dri la sogs pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir mig dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: For example, smell and so on are not objects apprehended by the eye faculty because they are derived from the elements, and form is also not an object apprehended by the eye faculty because it is derived from the elements.

original: rjes su dpag pa des ni gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa des ni gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This inference teaches that form is not an object apprehended by the eye faculty that does not contact its object.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not see itself and because it is derived from the elements, it is like sound and so on.üîΩBecause it possesses resistance and so on, it is like the eye faculty and so forth.

original: gtan tshigs thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya zhing sbyor ba'i tshig ci rigs par rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya zhing sbyor ba'i tshig ci rigs par rgyas par bya'o zhes bya ba yang /
translated: These inferences should be stated and the words of the syllogism should be expanded as appropriate for both parties.

original: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The seeing does not see itself.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //
translated: That does not see itself.

original: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: When it does not see itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: How can it see another?üîΩThis passage states the reason ‚Äúbecause it does not see itself‚Äù that the eye faculty does not apprehend an object that is not in contact with it, and the reason ‚Äúbecause it is derived from the elements‚Äù that form is not apprehended by the eye faculty that is not in contact with it.

original: zhes bya bas mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs 'byung ba las gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar @12b gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi phyogs de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ni
analyzed: zhes bya bas mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / gzugs mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs 'byung ba las gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar @12b gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi phyogs de gnyis kyi gtan tshigs ni
translated: These are merely illustrations because they are included in the method of the definition of terms.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that the reasons for those two positions are also ‚Äúbecause it is impeded‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na khva dag las zhun mar bsrung bar bya'o zhes smras na khyi dag las mi bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba de gnyis gtan tshigs su smos pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gtan tshigs su mi rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na khva dag las zhun mar bsrung bar bya'o zhes smras na khyi dag las mi bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba de gnyis gtan tshigs su smos pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa dag gtan tshigs su mi rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, here, since the two reasons ‚Äúnot seeing itself‚Äù and ‚Äúderived from the elements‚Äù are stated, it is not that ‚Äúhaving obstruction‚Äù and so on are not suitable as reasons.

original: 'di skad bstan te don dam par mig gi ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te don dam par mig gi ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te / thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: This is explained as follows: Ultimately, the eye does not apprehend its object without contacting it,üîΩbecause it has obstruction,

original: bsags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: bsags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because it is aggregated,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because it is derivative form,

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhe 'am /
translated: because it belongs to the form aggregate, and so on, like the nose and so on.

original: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te /üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te / thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: So too, ultimately form is not an object apprehended by the eye sense faculty that does not contact its object becauseüîΩit possesses obstruction,

original: bsags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: bsags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: it is aggregated,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: it is derivative form,üîΩit is included in the form aggregate and so on.üîΩThe examples of smell and so on should be stated in both the former and latter systems of valid knowledge.

original: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes tshad ma sngar bstan pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya zhing sbyor ba'i tshig de bzhin du ci rigs par rgyas parüîΩbya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes tshad ma sngar bstan pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la rjes su dpag pa dag brjod par bya zhing sbyor ba'i tshig de bzhin du ci rigs par rgyas par bya ba yin no //
translated: The words of the syllogism should be stated in detail as appropriate.üîΩAlternatively, ultimately the eye is not asserted to apprehend objects without contacting them because its object is directly perceptible, like the nose sense faculty and so on.

original: yang na don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod de da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i
analyzed: yang na don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod de da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i
translated: This is the syllogism that refutes the eye sense faculty apprehending objects without contact.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gzhan yin no //
translated: The other reason is a different type of valid knowledge.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na sna la sogs pa ni da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mig kyang da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na sna la sogs pa ni da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mig kyang da ltar gyi yul mngon sum pa yin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par mi 'dod
translated: They are applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: do // ci ste mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: do // ci ste mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: For example, just as it is not accepted that the nose and so on apprehend noncontiguous objects because they are sense faculties that directly perceive present objects, so too the eye is not accepted to apprehend noncontiguous objects because it is a sense faculty that directly perceives present objects.

original: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir @13a * //
analyzed: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir @13a * //
translated: But the eye apprehends noncontiguous objects because it apprehends form that is obstructed, because it does not have a separate effort and because it apprehends without a separate time.

original: dang rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gsum ston pa yin te /
analyzed: dang rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par bsgrub pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gsum ston pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the eye sense faculty apprehends its object field without contact because it is superior to the mind, then it is like the wish fulfilling jewel.

original: de la bye brag pa dag 'di skad ces mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bye brag pa dag 'di skad ces mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: This is the first of three valid cognitions that the Vaiseikas cite to prove that the eye sense faculty apprehends its object field without contact.üîΩThe Vaiseikas say: The eye sense faculty apprehends its object field without contact because it apprehends form obstructed by an obstruction.

original: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni tshad ma gcig ste de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni tshad ma gcig ste de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: For example, it is like the mind.üîΩThis is the first valid cognition.

original: dper na yid ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs nam mkhas bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na yid ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs nam mkhas bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, just as the mind apprehends its object field without contact because it apprehends form obstructed by an obstruction, so too the eye sense faculty apprehends its object field without contact because it apprehends form obstructed by space.

original: yang na mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Or the eyes apprehend uncontacted objects because they apprehend objects without a difference of exertion and without a difference of time, like the mind.

original: rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni tshad ma gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni tshad ma gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second valid cognition.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason and the example.

original: dper na yid ni rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na yid ni rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du mig kyang rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: For example, just as the mind apprehends uncontacted objects because it apprehends objects without a difference of exertion and without a difference of time, so too the eyes apprehend uncontacted objects because they apprehend objects without a difference of exertion and without a difference of time.

original: gal te mig dang yid dag yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par gyur na yul la phyogs pa'i rtsol ba las yul kyi  gan du 'gro ba'i rtsol ba tha dad pa yang dmigs par 'gyur la /üîΩrtsol ba tha dad pa yod na dus ji srid du yul gyi gan du 'gro ba'i dus de srid du mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: gal te mig dang yid dag yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par gyur na yul la phyogs pa'i rtsol ba las yul kyi  gan du 'gro ba'i rtsol ba tha dad pa yang dmigs par 'gyur la / rtsol ba tha dad pa yod na dus ji srid du yul gyi gan du 'gro ba'i dus de srid du mi 'dzin la /
translated: If the eye and mind sense faculties apprehend objects with which they make contact, then it would be observed that the exertion of the eye sense faculty moving toward the object is different from the exertion of the mind sense faculty moving toward the object.üîΩIf the exertion of the eye sense faculty is different from that of the mind sense faculty, then it would not apprehend the object for as long as the eye sense faculty moves toward the object.

original: gang gi tshe yul dang phrad pa de'i tshe na 'dzin pa'i dus tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul dang phrad pa de'i tshe na 'dzin pa'i dus tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: And when it makes contact with the object, it would be observed that the time of apprehension is different from the time of the eye sense faculty moving toward the object.

original: de lta na yid la bsams ma thag tu mi dran zhing mig phyi ma thag tu mi mthong gi /
analyzed: de lta na yid la bsams ma thag tu mi dran zhing mig phyi ma thag tu mi mthong gi /
translated: In that case, the mind would not recall an object immediately after it is contemplated and the eye would not see an object immediately after it moves toward it.

original: gang gi tshe yid dang mig gis yul gyi gan du phyin pa de'i tshe na gdong shes shing mthong bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te rtsol ba tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yid dang mig gis yul gyi gan du phyin pa de'i tshe na gdong shes shing mthong bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te rtsol ba tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it is observed that the eye sense faculty apprehends an object without a difference in exertion and it apprehends an object without a difference in time. Therefore it apprehends objects with which it does not make contact.

original: yang na mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Or the eyes apprehend uncontacted objects because they apprehend objects that are superior to themselves, like the mind.

original: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni @13b tshad ma gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhes zer ba ni @13b tshad ma gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third valid cognition.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason and the example.

original: dper na yang ni rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na yang ni rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because the mind apprehends objects that are superior to itself, it apprehends uncontacted objects.

original: mig kyang rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: mig kyang rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, because the eyes apprehend objects that are superior to themselves, they apprehend uncontacted objects.

original: gal te yid dang mig dag yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par gyur na rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yid dang mig dag yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par gyur na rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the mind and eyes apprehended contacted objects, they would not apprehend objects that are superior to themselves.

original: de lta na yid kyi dbang pos kyang rang gi de ma thag pa'i skad cig gcig las lhag pa'i yul skad cig ma rgyun dang dus gsum dang rang dang gzhan gyi yul 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na yid kyi dbang pos kyang rang gi de ma thag pa'i skad cig gcig las lhag pa'i yul skad cig ma rgyun dang dus gsum dang rang dang gzhan gyi yul 'dzin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the mental faculty would not apprehend objects of its own time, such as a single moment, a continuum, the three times, its own object and the object of another.

original: mig gi dbang pos kyang rang gi tshad las lhag pa'i yul rgyang grags dang dpag tshad la sogs pa'i khyon chen po dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos kyang rang gi tshad las lhag pa'i yul rgyang grags dang dpag tshad la sogs pa'i khyon chen po dag 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
translated: And the eye faculty would not apprehend a vast field of objects such as a kro≈õa or a yojana, which exceeds its own measure.

original: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it apprehends objects that exceed its own measure. Therefore it apprehends uncontacted objects.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, That is also not good and so on.

original: bye brag pa dag smras pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni bzang po ma yin te zhes sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: bye brag pa dag smras pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag ni bzang po ma yin te zhes sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: He refutes the three valid cognitions proposed by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, saying, That is not good.

original: de la gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not good to say that it apprehends form that is obstructed?

original: de'i phyir 'di la ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i don yin la /
translated: Therefore, in this context, apprehending without contact means apprehending form that is obstructed.

original: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don kyang de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don kyang de nyid yin pas /
translated: And that is the meaning of apprehending form that is obstructed.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that because it is only a part of the meaning of the thesis,

original: 'di la yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di la yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don ni gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa nyid yin la /
translated: it is not good. In this context, the thesis is that it apprehends its object without contact. The meaning of that thesis is that it apprehends form that is obstructed.

original: de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pas de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su gzugs bar du chod pa 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa ni dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pas de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: The reason that it apprehends form that is obstructed is stated as a reason that proves that thesis. Because it is only a part of the meaning of the thesis, the reason is not established. Therefore, it is not good.

original: rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not good to say that it is because they apprehend without a difference in exertion and without a difference in time?

original: de'i phyir rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang / dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that because apprehending without a difference in exertion and without a difference in time is not established, it is not good.

original: 'di ltar lus dang dbang po dang blo la sogs pa chos thams cad ni @14a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dang dbang po dang blo la sogs pa chos thams cad ni @14a * //
translated: Thus, all phenomena such as the body, sense faculties, mind, and so on

original: skad cig las lhag par mi sdod pas de'i phyir sems pa dang lta bar 'dod pas ji srid du yul la 'dzin par mi byed pa de'i bar skabs su yang rtsol ba'i skad cig ma dang 'dzin pa'i skad cig ma'i dus tha dad pa du ma 'gag par
analyzed: skad cig las lhag par mi sdod pas de'i phyir sems pa dang lta bar 'dod pas ji srid du yul la 'dzin par mi byed pa de'i bar skabs su yang rtsol ba'i skad cig ma dang 'dzin pa'i skad cig ma'i dus tha dad pa du ma 'gag par
translated: do not remain for more than an instant. Therefore, as long as the desire to see and the desire to think do not apprehend an object, in that interval many different moments of exertion and many different moments of apprehension cease.

original: 'gyur bas rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa ma grub pa'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur bas rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa ma grub pa'i phyir de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Because apprehending without a difference in exertion and without a difference in time is not established, it is not good.

original: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na /üîΩde ni / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ji ltar bzang po ma yin zhe na / de ni / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
