translated: Why is it not good to say that it apprehends objects that are other than itself?üîΩThat is explained by the reasoning:üîΩThe view does not see itself.

original: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid //üîΩgang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
analyzed: de yis de ni mi mthong nyid // gang tshe bdag nyid mi mthong ba //
translated: Since it does not see itself,

original: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i rigs pa nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong bas /üîΩgzhan mi mthong bar bsgrubs zin pas rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yis gzhan ni ji ltar mthong // zhes bshad pa'i rigs pa nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid mi mthong bas / gzhan mi mthong bar bsgrubs zin pas rang las lhag pa'i yul 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: How could it see another?üîΩSince it does not see itself,üîΩit is established that it does not see another.

original: de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not good to say that it apprehends objects that are other than itself.üîΩEven if the reason is established, the pervasion is not established.

original: gtan tshigs grub tu zin na yang rjes su 'gro ba mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag gis skad cig ma'i rgyun cha phra mos dus tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa dag mi rtog pas khyed
analyzed: gtan tshigs grub tu zin na yang rjes su 'gro ba mi 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa la sogs pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag gis skad cig ma'i rgyun cha phra mos dus tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa dag mi rtog pas khyed
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on, who are not in equipoise, do not conceive of the subtle part of the continuum of moments that is posited as a different time.

original: la rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs grub tu zin na yang khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs de la rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe mi 'grub pas de'i phyir yang bzang po ma
analyzed: la rtsol ba tha dad pa med pa dang dus tha dad pa med par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs grub tu zin na yang khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa'i phyogs de la rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe mi 'grub pas de'i phyir yang bzang po ma
translated: Even if you think the reason is established, still it is not good because you do not establish an example that is concomitant with the probandum in your thesis.

original: yin no // ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yin no // ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it that you do not establish an example that is concomitant with the probandum?

original: de'i phyir don dam par yid kyang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩji ltar kho bos don dam par mig kyang yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par yid kyang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / ji ltar kho bos don dam par mig kyang yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore it says, because ultimately the mind is not established as apprehending without contact.

original: gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po'i yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin no zhes bkag pa de bzhin du don dam par yid kyang chos ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub la chos kyang yid kyi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: gzugs kyang mig gi dbang po'i yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin no zhes bkag pa de bzhin du don dam par yid kyang chos ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub la chos kyang yid kyi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i
translated: Just as we refute that ultimately the eye does not apprehend without contact with its object and form is not the object apprehended by the eye sense faculty without contact, so ultimately the mind is not established as apprehending phenomena without contact and phenomena are not the object apprehended by the mental sense faculty without contact.

original: gzung ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is not established as something to be apprehended.

original: gal te 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pa la yang kun rdzob tu yid ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub la nged la yang ma grub pas de'i phyir nged kyi dpe ma grub pa ma yin no zhes zer na yang de'i lan du
analyzed: gal te 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pa la yang kun rdzob tu yid ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid du ma grub la nged la yang ma grub pas de'i phyir nged kyi dpe ma grub pa ma yin no zhes zer na yang de'i lan du
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúFor you MƒÅdhyamikas, the mind does not exist as an apprehender of an object that it does not contact, and it does not exist for us either. Therefore our example is not unestablished,‚ÄùüîΩthe response to that is

original: / yang na don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / yang na don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúOr it is contradictory.‚Äù

original: khyed don dam par dpe ma grub pa mi 'dod pas yang na kun rdzob tu bsgrubs na ni don dam par mi 'grub pas khyed don dam par sgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid kyang @14b yin pas de yang bzang po ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: khyed don dam par dpe ma grub pa mi 'dod pas yang na kun rdzob tu bsgrubs na ni don dam par mi 'grub pas khyed don dam par sgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid kyang @14b yin pas de yang bzang po ma yin no / // / bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: Since you do not assert that the example is not established ultimately, if you establish it conventionally, it is not established ultimately. Therefore your argument is contradictory to your own position. That is also not good.

original: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa dag gis mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bye brag pa dag gis mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having in this way refuted the Vai≈õe·π£ika‚Äôs imputation that the eye sense faculty apprehends an object that it does not contact,

original: da ni grangs can dag gis mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas grangs can dag mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yinüîΩno zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni grangs can dag gis mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal bar 'dod pas grangs can dag mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To refute this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúThe SƒÅ·πÉkhya say, ‚ÄòThe eye does not apprehend objects with which it does not come into contact.‚Äô This is a proof of what is already established.‚Äù

original: grangs can dag ni mig gzugs la lta bar byed de phrad par 'dzin to zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pas de'i phyir de dag na re sngar dbu ma pas don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni mig gzugs la lta bar byed de phrad par 'dzin to zhes bya bar yongs su rtog pas de'i phyir de dag na re sngar dbu ma pas don dam par mig ni yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya think that the eye sees form and apprehends it with which it comes into contact. Therefore, previously the Follower of the Middle Way said to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, ‚ÄúThe eye does not ultimately apprehend objects with which it does not come into contact.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: This is because it does not see itself, just like the nose and so on.‚Äù And, ‚ÄúForm is not ultimately apprehended by the eye sense faculty as an object with which it does not come into contact.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa dag byas pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par grub pas sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dper na dri la sogs pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa dag byas pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par grub pas sgrub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But in our system, the eye is established as apprehending objects with which it makes contact, and this is the proof.

original: de skad ces zer ba di'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mig yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa nyid du bstan pas yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ma bstan pa'i phyir gnas ma yinüîΩpa la dbugs 'byin to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba di'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis mig yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa nyid du bstan pas yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ma bstan pa'i phyir gnas ma yinüîΩpa la dbugs 'byin to zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says that the eye is empty of the property of apprehending objects with which it does not make contact, and it is not taught by the method of proof that it apprehends objects with which it makes contact.üîΩTherefore, it is not a proper response.

original: kho bos bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dgag par bstan pas grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs ma yin par dgag pas sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir grangs can
analyzed: kho bos bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs med par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dgag par bstan pas grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs ma yin par dgag pas sgrub pa'i tshul gyis ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir grangs can
translated: I have taught that the Particularists are refuted by a reductio argument that shows that it is impossible for them to perceive objects with which they are not in contact. But I have not taught that the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are established by a positive argument that shows that they are not in the position of asserting that perception occurs through contact.

original: dag gi rang gi phyogs gnas ma yin pa la phrad pa 'dzin pa 'grub tu re zhing dbugs 'byin par byed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dag gi rang gi phyogs gnas ma yin pa la phrad pa 'dzin pa 'grub tu re zhing dbugs 'byin par byed do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, who are not in the position of asserting that perception occurs through contact, should be consoled with the thought that they have succeeded in establishing that the Particularists are not in the position of asserting that perception occurs through contact.üîΩAlthough this is so, the meaning of a thesis is not established by mere words. Therefore, here too one must state the syllogistic reasoning. Thus, BhƒÅviveka says:

original: de lta yin mod kyi tshig tsam gyis dam bcas pa'i don mi 'grub pas 'dir yang sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya dgos pas de'i phyir gzhan yang mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod de dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhesüîΩbya ba smras te /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi tshig tsam gyis dam bcas pa'i don mi 'grub pas 'dir yang sbyor ba'i tshig dag bya dgos pas de'i phyir gzhan yang mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod de dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na yid bzhin no zhesüîΩbya ba smras te /
translated: Moreover, the eye is not asserted to perceive objects with which it is in contact because it is a sense faculty, like the mind.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: @15a * // dper na yid ni dbang po yin pa'i phyir yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mig kyang dbang po yin pa'i phyir yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: @15a * // dper na yid ni dbang po yin pa'i phyir yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mig kyang dbang po yin pa'i phyir yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: For example, just as the mental faculty is not asserted to apprehend an object that it contacts because it is a sense faculty, so too the eye is not asserted to apprehend an object that it contacts because it is a sense faculty.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don dbang po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ci re zhig dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na yid kyi dbang po bzhin du yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par 'gyur ram
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don dbang po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ci re zhig dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na yid kyi dbang po bzhin du yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par 'gyur ram
translated: Here, if the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the Madhyamaka reason ‚Äòbecause it is a sense faculty‚Äô is this: Is it that because it is a sense faculty, like the mental faculty, it does not apprehend an object that it contacts?

original: / 'on te dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhin du yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / 'on te dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhin du yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Or is it that because it is a sense faculty, like the nose faculty and so on, it apprehends an object that it contacts?

original: des na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa yin pas ma grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du ni 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sna la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te
analyzed: des na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa yin pas ma grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan du ni 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis sna la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te
translated: The sense faculties such as the nose are not indeterminate.

original: / de dag kyang 'og nas de dang 'dra ba kho nar ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩsna la sogs pa de dag kyang skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyi mjug nas /
analyzed: / de dag kyang 'og nas de dang 'dra ba kho nar ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / sna la sogs pa de dag kyang skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di nyid kyi mjug nas /
translated: Because it will be shown later that they are just like the eyes.

original: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //üîΩnyan pa po dang nyan la sogs //üîΩrnam par bshad par shes par bya //üîΩzhes 'byung bas mig gi yul ma phrad pa yang mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid // nyan pa po dang nyan la sogs // rnam par bshad par shes par bya // zhes 'byung bas mig gi yul ma phrad pa yang mi 'dzin la /
translated: The sense faculties such as the nose are not indeterminate because it will be shown later that they are just like the eyes.üîΩThe nose does not apprehend its object without contacting it, nor does it apprehend its object by contacting it.

original: phrad pa yang mi 'dzin pa de dang 'dra ba kho nar ston pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa yang mi 'dzin pa de dang 'dra ba kho nar ston pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The nose is just like the eyes.üîΩThe nose does not apprehend its object without contacting it because it is not omnipresent.

original: phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phrad pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang gang gis yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúgrasping that which is encountered‚Äù?

original: dbu ma pas grangs can dag la dri ba'i tshig yin no //üîΩgal te gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su song ste 'dzin par byed pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag mig ni mig gi dbang po rang gi gnas mig gi 'bras bu'i phyogs nas yul gzugs kyi phyogs su song ste /
analyzed: dbu ma pas grangs can dag la dri ba'i tshig yin no // gal te gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su song ste 'dzin par byed pa'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag mig ni mig gi dbang po rang gi gnas mig gi 'bras bu'i phyogs nas yul gzugs kyi phyogs su song ste /
translated: This is a question that the MƒÅdhyamika asks the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.üîΩIf you say that the eye sense faculty goes from its own place to the side of the object and grasps it,üîΩthen the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the eye sense faculty, from its own place, the side of the eye, goes to the side of the object, form, and grasps form.

original: gzugs 'dzin par byed par 'dod pas gal te grangs can dag de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin par byed par 'dod pas gal te grangs can dag de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: If the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that,

original: de skad ces zer na de yang mi rung ste /üîΩde'i phyir don dam par mig gi 'jug pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de yang mi rung ste / de'i phyir don dam par mig gi 'jug pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro ste /
translated: then that is also not correct.

original: 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the engagement of the eye does not go outside from the place that is a synonym for the eye consciousness, because it is engagement, like, for example, the engagement of the sense faculties such as the nose.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa ni 'jug @15b pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na sna la sogs pa'i dbang po'i 'jug pa ni 'jug @15b pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example.üîΩFor example, the engagement of the nose sense faculty and so on is not external to the place that is the basis of the synonyms of the nose consciousness and so on because it is engagement.

original: sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro ba de bzhin du mig gi 'jug pa yang 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro ba de bzhin du mig gi 'jug pa yang 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs kyi gnas nas phyi rol du mi 'gro'o //
translated: In the same way, the engagement of the eye sense faculty is not external to the place that is the basis of the synonyms of the eye consciousness because it is engagement.

original: gal te mig gi dbang po yul 'dzin par byed pa'i 'jug pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyi gnas mig gi 'bras bu'i phyogs nas phyi rol gzugs kyi phyogs su 'gro zhing yul 'dzin par byed par 'gyur na ji srid du
analyzed: gal te mig gi dbang po yul 'dzin par byed pa'i 'jug pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyi gnas mig gi 'bras bu'i phyogs nas phyi rol gzugs kyi phyogs su 'gro zhing yul 'dzin par byed par 'gyur na ji srid du
translated: If the engagement of the eye sense faculty that apprehends objects were external to the place that is the basis of the synonyms of the eye consciousness called the eye sense faculty, it would go to the side of external form from the side of the eye sense faculty and apprehend objects.

original: gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su 'gro ba de srid du /
analyzed: gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su 'gro ba de srid du /
translated: For as long as it goes to the side of the object from its own place,üîΩfor that long

original: dus tha dad pa dmigs par 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa dmigs par 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: The error of the object being observed at different times would occur.

original: 'di ltar thag ring por 'gro ba ni yun ring po nas phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thag ring por 'gro ba ni yun ring po nas phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one who goes a long distance would go for a long time,

original: chos de ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that phenomenon would possess going.

original: des na nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa thag ring po na 'dug pa la lta bas ni yun ring pos mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa thag ring po na 'dug pa la lta bas ni yun ring pos mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, since one sees the sun and moon, which are far away, after a long time,

original: shing ljon pa'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i thag nye ba na 'dug pa la lta bas ni dus nye bas mthong bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i rtse mo la sogs pa'i thag nye ba na 'dug pa la lta bas ni dus nye bas mthong bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
translated: and one sees the top of a tree, which is nearby, after a short time,

original: nyi zla dang shing ljon pa'i rtse mo dag mthong ba la dus snga phyi med pas de'i phyir mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi zla dang shing ljon pa'i rtse mo dag mthong ba la dus snga phyi med pas de'i phyir mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: the eye does not grasp an object with which it comes into contact, because there is no difference in the time it takes to see the sun and moon and the top of a tree.

original: gal te yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par 'gyur na yul mig gi 'bras bu'i khyon tsam zhig mthong zhing de las lhag pa mi mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yin par 'gyur na yul mig gi 'bras bu'i khyon tsam zhig mthong zhing de las lhag pa mi mthong bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye grasped an object with which it came into contact, then only an object the size of the eye‚Äôs pupil would be seen, and more than that would not be seen.

original: gal te mig yul phrad pa 'dzin cing gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su 'gro ba yin na lta ba po lhas byin long bar 'gyur zhing gdong bkab pas kyang gzugs mthong ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mig yul phrad pa 'dzin cing gnas nas yul gyi phyogs su 'gro ba yin na lta ba po lhas byin long bar 'gyur zhing gdong bkab pas kyang gzugs mthong ba'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye sense faculty apprehends objects with which it comes into contact and moves to the side of the object, then Devadatta, the seer, would be blind and the fault would arise that one would see forms even with one‚Äôs face covered.

original: don de nyid tshad ma kun las btus pa dang / dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa dag las kyang /üîΩmig ni gnas nas phyi rol du //
analyzed: don de nyid tshad ma kun las btus pa dang / dbu ma'i tshig le'ur byas pa brgya pa dag las kyang / mig ni gnas nas phyi rol du //
translated: This point is also explained in the Compendium of Valid Knowledge and in the Catuhfi sÃÅataka:üîΩThe eye does not have the power

original: yul la rtog pa'i mthu med de //
analyzed: yul la rtog pa'i mthu med de //
translated: to perceive objects from a distance.

original: phrad nas shes pa yin gyur na //
analyzed: phrad nas shes pa yin gyur na //
translated: If consciousness were to arise through contact,

original: bar chad can dang lhag 'dzin min //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bar chad can dang lhag 'dzin min // zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: it would not be obstructed or incomplete.

original: des ni mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the eye sense faculty does not apprehend objects with which it comes into contact.

original: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs ni mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin te rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba
translated: So too, form is not apprehended by the eye sense faculty that encounters its object in the ultimate because it has a cause, like sound and so on.

original: ma yin par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ma yin par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches that form is not apprehended by the eye sense faculty that encounters its object.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya @16a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya @16a * //
translated: They are the subject,üîΩthe predicate of the probandum,

original: ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the logical reason and the example, respectively.

original: dper na sgra la sogs pa ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra la sogs pa ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po yul phrad pa 'dzin pa'i gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, sound and so on are not apprehended by the eye sense faculty that encounters its object because they have a cause. So too, form is not apprehended by the eye sense faculty that encounters its object because it has a cause.

original: ci phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa brgyad pa dag gis phyogs gcig gis gcig bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas
analyzed: ci phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i rjes su dpag pa brgyad pa dag gis phyogs gcig gis gcig bsal ba'i phyir gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag / dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces khyed dbu ma pas
translated: The opponent says, You Madhyamikas,

original: bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yang bsal la /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yang bsal la /
translated: with the consequences that refute the Vaisesikas' assertion that the object is apprehended without contact, also refuted the apprehension of an object without contact.

original: grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yang bsal bas des na khyed dbu ma pa la mig yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yang ma grub la /
analyzed: grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gis yul phrad pa 'dzin pa yang bsal bas des na khyed dbu ma pa la mig yul ma phrad pa 'dzin pa yang ma grub la /
translated: With the consequences that refute the Samkhyas' assertion that the object is apprehended through contact, you also refuted the apprehension of an object through contact. Therefore, for you Madhyamikas, the apprehension of an object without contact is not established,

original: yul phrad pa 'dzin par yang ma grub pas de'i phyir khyed kyi 'dod pa ma grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: yul phrad pa 'dzin par yang ma grub pas de'i phyir khyed kyi 'dod pa ma grub po zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: and the apprehension of an object through contact is also not established. Therefore your assertion is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnyi ga med pa'i phyir mi sgrub par 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnyi ga med pa'i phyir mi sgrub par 'dod pa grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary says, ‚ÄúBecause neither is the case, the assertion that nothing is established is established.‚Äù

original: don dam par bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dang / grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyi ga med pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa mtha' gnyis po de dag mi sgrub par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa sgrub po //
analyzed: don dam par bye brag pa dag yul ma phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa dang / grangs can dag yul phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod pa'i phyogs gnyi ga med pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa mtha' gnyis po de dag mi sgrub par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa sgrub po //
translated: Because neither of the two positions is the case‚Äîthat is, because neither Vai≈õe·π£ikas nor SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that the object is apprehended without contact or that the object is apprehended through contact‚Äîthe assertion of the MƒÅdhyamikas, who do not assert either of those two extremes, is established.

original: gang dag la mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song ste yul 'dzin par byed do snyam pa'i blo gros yod pa de dag la yang 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag gi gzhung las mig gi dbang po ni
analyzed: gang dag la mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song ste yul 'dzin par byed do snyam pa'i blo gros yod pa de dag la yang 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag gi gzhung las mig gi dbang po ni
translated: To those who think that the light rays of the eye go to the object and apprehend the object, it should be said that the eye sense faculty does not go to the object.

original: 'od zer dang bcas pa yin pas mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song ste yul 'dzin par byed do zhes 'byung bas des na de dag la mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do snyam pa'i blo gros yod pas de dag la yang 'grel pa
analyzed: 'od zer dang bcas pa yin pas mig gi 'od zer yul gyi phyogs su song ste yul 'dzin par byed do zhes 'byung bas des na de dag la mig ni yul phrad pa 'dzin par byed do snyam pa'i blo gros yod pas de dag la yang 'grel pa
translated: Therefore, since they have the idea that the eye apprehends objects with which it comes into contact, they also have the idea that the eye is the agent of seeing.üîΩSince the eye is not the agent of seeing, this is stated in the Autocommentary.

original: byed pa nyid kyis 'di skad cis brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: byed pa nyid kyis 'di skad cis brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, this is to be applied:

original: tha snyad du yang mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt should be known that even conventionally the eye sense faculty is not accompanied by light rays

original: gzugs dmigs pa'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba yang chos can dang / @16b bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs dmigs pa'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba yang chos can dang / @16b bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: because it is the active cause of observing form, like form.‚Äù

original: dper na mar me'i snying po'i gzugs ni bum pa'i gzugs dmigs pa'i mar me'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang gzugs dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i byed rgyu
analyzed: dper na mar me'i snying po'i gzugs ni bum pa'i gzugs dmigs pa'i mar me'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ba de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang gzugs dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i byed rgyu
translated: Similarly, the eye faculty is the active cause of the eye consciousness that observes form,

original: yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: and thus it is understood that the eye faculty is not associated with light.

original: gang bstan du yod pa'i gzugs ni 'od zer dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang bstan du yod pa'i gzugs ni 'od zer dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is taught that any visible form is associated with light,

original: dper na nyi ma'i gzugs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i gzugs lta bu yin no //
translated: for example, the form of the sun.

original: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The eye faculty is not associated with light because it is invisible form.

original: gal te mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa kho na yin te /
translated: If you say that the eye faculty is only associated with light

original: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na byi ba la sogs pa mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir dper na byi ba la sogs pa mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is an eye faculty, like the eyes of a mouse and so on that move at night,üîΩthis is not so.

original: dpyod pa can dag dbu ma pas mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes bshad pa de la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag dbu ma pas mig gi dbang po ni 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin par shes par bya ste zhes bshad pa de la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas object that the Madhyamaka statement, ‚ÄúThe eye sense faculty is not endowed with light rays,‚Äù is faulty, because it is undermined by nonerroneous contradiction.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They say that the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example are respectively as follows.

original: dper na byi ba la sogs pa mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig ni mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa kho naüîΩyin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na byi ba la sogs pa mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig ni mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig gi dbang po yang mig gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, the eyes of nocturnal animals such as cats are endowed with light rays because they are eye sense faculties. In the same way, the eye sense faculty is endowed with light rays because it is an eye sense faculty.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThis is not logical.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not logical?

original: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the eye sense faculty is not visible.

original: gang bstan du yod pa'i gzugs ni 'od zer dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang bstan du yod pa'i gzugs ni 'od zer dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: That form which is visible is endowed with light rays,

original: dper na nyi ma'i gzugs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i gzugs lta bu yin no //
translated: like the form of the sun, for example.

original: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ni bstan du med pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir 'od zer dang bcas pa ma yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the eye sense faculty is invisible form, it is not endowed with light rays. Therefore, since the example is empty of the property to be established, that is illogical.

original: gal te pha rol po na re mig gi dbang po'i gnas mig gi 'bras bu 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan @17a * //
analyzed: gal te pha rol po na re mig gi dbang po'i gnas mig gi 'bras bu 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin pas dpe bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas 'byung ba de'i lan @17a * //
translated: If the opponent says: The eye sense faculty‚Äôs location, the eye, is endowed with light rays, so the example is not empty of the property to be established, then the following is an internal response.

original: du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de'i gnas 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin na yang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i gnas 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin na yang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even if its location were endowed with light rays, the example is not established.

original: mig gi dbang po de'i gnas mig gi 'bras bu 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin na yang byi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig 'od zer dang bcas pa de don dam par ma skyes pas khyed kyi dpe ma grub pa'i phyir de
analyzed: mig gi dbang po de'i gnas mig gi 'bras bu 'od zer dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin na yang byi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mo rgyu ba'i mig 'od zer dang bcas pa de don dam par ma skyes pas khyed kyi dpe ma grub pa'i phyir de
translated: If the eye sense faculty were the eye‚Äôs eyeball together with its light, then your example would not be established because the eyes of mice and so on that move about at night together with their light are ultimately unarisen.

original: yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical.

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir yang de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir yang de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because there is the refutation of the nonerroneous contradiction, it is illogical because there is the refutation of the nonerroneous contradiction.

original: 'di ltar khyed la dpe bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa de bzhin du kho bo la yang khyed kyi dpe sun 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed la dpe bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa de bzhin du kho bo la yang khyed kyi dpe sun 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you have an inference that establishes your example, in the same way I have an inference that refutes your example.

original: dpyad pa rnam par 'phros pas chog gi skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dang grangs can dag yul ma phrad pa dang phrad pa 'dzin par yongs su rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i dpyad pa rnam par 'phros pas chog
analyzed: dpyad pa rnam par 'phros pas chog gi skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dang grangs can dag yul ma phrad pa dang phrad pa 'dzin par yongs su rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i dpyad pa rnam par 'phros pas chog
translated: The analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.üîΩNow, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚ÄùüîΩThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception that the object is apprehended without or with contact.üîΩNow, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚Äù

original: gi da ni lta ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i skabs de nyid kyi dbang du byas te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: gi da ni lta ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i skabs de nyid kyi dbang du byas te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient,‚Äù means that the analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception that the object is apprehended without or with contact.

original: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: Now, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient,‚Äù means that the analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception that the object is apprehended without or with contact.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: Now, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient,‚Äù means that the analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception that the object is apprehended without or with contact.

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: Now, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient,‚Äù means that the analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception that the object is apprehended without or with contact.üîΩNow, in this context, we will explain the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig na re 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la mthong na de dang ldan pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig na re 'di la dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid la mthong na de dang ldan pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient,‚Äù means that the analysis of whether or not the object is contacted is sufficient to refute the Vaise·π£ika and SƒÅ·πÉkhya philosophers‚Äô conception

original: dper na chu la rlan mthong na de dang ldan pas sa la yang dmigs pa dang / me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang / sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na dngos po gang rang gi bdag nyid la mi snang ba de gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na chu la rlan mthong na de dang ldan pas sa la yang dmigs pa dang / me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang / sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na dngos po gang rang gi bdag nyid la mi snang ba de gzhan gyi bdag nyid la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, if one sees moisture in water, one also observes it in earth because it is endowed with it. If one sees heat in fire, one also observes it in water because it is endowed with it. If one sees a sweet fragrance in a jasmine flower, one also observes it in cloth because it is endowed with it. But how could one observe something in another thing if it does not appear in itself?

original: 'di ltar sna ma'i me tog la dri nga ba nyid ma mthong na gos la yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar sna ma'i me tog la dri nga ba nyid ma mthong na gos la yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o /
translated: For example, if one does not see a foul odor in a jasmine flower, one also does not observe it in cloth.

original: de'i phyir gal te lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed na ni des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na lta ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed na ni des na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ba zhig na lta ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, if seeing sees itself, then it would be tenable to call it seeing because it sees form. But seeing does not see itself.

original: da gang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta bar byed de //
analyzed: da gang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta bar byed de //
translated: But if it does not see itself, how can it see something else?

original: de bas na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba @17b zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba @17b zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that seeing exists because of seeing form.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: ƒÄryadeva also says:

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin ni //

analyzed: thog mar bdag la snang 'gyur na // mig nyid la yang mig nyid ni //
translated: First appears in itself.üîΩWhy doesn‚Äôt the eye

original: ci yi phyir na 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: Grasp itself?

original: zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta ni tshig le'ur byas pa de'i don 'di skad du rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the verse by the elder BuddhapƒÅlita, the author of the commentary.

original: de la 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re lta ba gzugs dmigs pa de gal te ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med do zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re lta ba gzugs dmigs pa de gal te ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med do zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Here, the Buddhist schools say that if the seeing that observes form does not exist in the eye, it does not exist in form. But this is an argument that proves what is already established.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
translated: It does not exist in the eye or in form.

original: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It does not exist between them.

original: gang du de ni gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang du de ni gnas gyur pa //
translated: Where it does not exist,

original: de yod ma yin de med min //
analyzed: de yod ma yin de med min //
translated: it is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa gzhan dag gis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa gzhan dag gis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is the refutation by other Buddhist schools of the elder Buddhadeva‚Äôs explanation of the Abhidharma.

original: 'di la mig gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di la mig gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the eye sees form because it is seeing?

original: lta ba gzugs dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skyes pas mig gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes bya bar shes pa yin na lta ba gzugs dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes
analyzed: lta ba gzugs dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i skyes pas mig gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes bya bar shes pa yin na lta ba gzugs dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes
translated: The statement ‚ÄúSeeing is the apprehension of form‚Äù indicates that the eye sees form because eye consciousness, which has the aspect of form, arises.

original: pa de ni ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med pas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed par rang gi sde pa dag gi gzhung las yang grub pa yin na de la gal te gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta lta baüîΩgzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa de ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med pas /
analyzed: pa de ni ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med pas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed par rang gi sde pa dag gi gzhung las yang grub pa yin na de la gal te gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta lta ba gzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa de ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med pas /
translated: Just as it does not exist for the eye, so too it does not exist for form. Therefore, the eye does not see form.üîΩIf the elder Buddhapalita establishes this, then if he says,üîΩThe eye does not see form because the eye consciousness that observes form does not exist for the eye just as it does not exist for form,

original: mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then he is proving what is already established for us.

original: de ltar yang rang gi sde pa spyi'i grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: de ltar yang rang gi sde pa spyi'i grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: This is because our own schools' philosophical systems in general state:

original: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs la med //
translated: It does not exist for the eye and form.

original: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis bar na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: It also does not exist between those two.

original: gang du de ni gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang du de ni gnas gyur pa //
translated: Where it does not exist

original: de yod ma yin de med min ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yod ma yin de med min ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: it is not nonexistent.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Some say, etc. The author of the commentary himself refutes the explanation of the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita.

original: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin no //üîΩci ste rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed @18a * //üîΩpa'i nus pa med do zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mig rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa'i nus pa med pas gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar sgrub
analyzed: kha cig ces bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid yin no // ci ste rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed @18a * // pa'i nus pa med do zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de mig rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa'i nus pa med pas gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar sgrub
translated: ‚ÄúSome‚Äù refers to the author of the commentary himself.üîΩIf you say that it does not have the power to see itself, etc. If the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita proves that the eye does not see visible form because it does not have the power to see itself,üîΩthen the example of the jasmine flower is not appropriate. The jasmine flower is an example that does not share the property of not seeing itself. When the jasmine flower is seen to have a sweet fragrance, the cloth that possesses it

original: na ni'o // de lta na sna ma'i me tog de'i dper mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang
analyzed: na ni'o // de lta na sna ma'i me tog de'i dper mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang
translated: is also seen to have a sweet fragrance. But the eye does not have the power to see itself. Therefore, the example of the jasmine flower is not appropriate.

original: dmigs pa lta bu yin na zhes smos pa de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa lta bu yin na zhes smos pa de mi rung ngo //
translated: If you say that the smell of the sesame oil is like the object, that is not correct.

original: ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not correct?

original: sna ma'i me tog dag la tshogs pa'i dbang gis dri zhim pa nyid dag 'byung ba'i phyir me tog dang phrad pas 'bru mar dri zhim pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog dag la tshogs pa'i dbang gis dri zhim pa nyid dag 'byung ba'i phyir me tog dang phrad pas 'bru mar dri zhim pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the sweet smell of the jasmine flower arises due to the power of the collection of causes and conditions, just as sesame oil becomes fragrant through contact with the flower.

original: sna ma'i me tog dag la rang gi bdag nyid kyis dri zhim pa yod pa ma yin gyi sa bon dang sa la sogs pa tshogs pa'i dbang gis dri zhim pa nyid dag glo bur du 'byung zhing de dang phrad pas gos la sogs pa gzugs gzhan dag
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog dag la rang gi bdag nyid kyis dri zhim pa yod pa ma yin gyi sa bon dang sa la sogs pa tshogs pa'i dbang gis dri zhim pa nyid dag glo bur du 'byung zhing de dang phrad pas gos la sogs pa gzugs gzhan dag
translated: The sweet smell of the jasmine flower does not exist in the flower by its own nature, but sweet smell arises adventitiously due to the power of the collection of causes and conditions such as the seed, soil, and so on.

original: la yang dri zhim pa nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la yang dri zhim pa nyid dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Through contact with that, the sweet smell is observed in other forms such as cloth.

original: dper na 'bru mar dag la rang gi bdag nyid kyis dri zhim pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi me tog dri zhim po dang phrad pa'i dbang gis 'bru mar dri zhim pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na 'bru mar dag la rang gi bdag nyid kyis dri zhim pa nyid yod pa ma yin gyi me tog dri zhim po dang phrad pa'i dbang gis 'bru mar dri zhim pa nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, sesame oil does not have a sweet smell by its own nature, but sesame oil becomes fragrant due to the power of contact with a fragrant flower.

original: de bas na lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dper sna ma'i me tog dag mi rung bas gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i chos mi mthun pa'i dper sna ma'i me tog dag mi rung bas gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the example of a jasmine flower is not suitable as a dissimilar example of a phenomenon that does not see its own nature, the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita‚Äôs explanation is not correct.üîΩAnd since no one accepts that there is an action of seeing form, it is not tenable to refute that.

original: gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i bya ba yang sus kyang khas ma blangs pas de 'gog pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pas gzhan dag la yang
analyzed: gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i bya ba yang sus kyang khas ma blangs pas de 'gog pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas lta ba rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pas gzhan dag la yang
translated: The elder BuddhapaÃÑlita refutes this by saying that since it does not see its own self, it does not see other things either.

original: lta bar mi byed do zhes 'gog par byed pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lta bar mi byed do zhes 'gog par byed pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gis mig la rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa'i nus pa yod cing de dang ldan pas gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i bya ba yod par khas blangs na ni de 'gog pa yang 'thad grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gis mig la rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa'i nus pa yod cing de dang ldan pas gzugs la lta bar byed pa'i bya ba yod par khas blangs na ni de 'gog pa yang 'thad grang na /
translated: If someone accepted that the eye has the ability to see its own self and that it has the action of seeing form, then it would be tenable to refute that.

original: sus kyang de skad khas ma blangs bzhin du de 'gog par byed pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sus kyang de skad khas ma blangs bzhin du de 'gog par byed pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also untenable to refute that without anyone accepting it.

original: ci ste bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub na ni de lta na yang dpes mi nus te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa bzhin du gzhan dag la yang 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub na ni de lta na yang dpes mi nus te /
translated: But if you prove that just as it does not grasp itself, so too it does not grasp others, then in that case the example is not possible,üîΩbecause fire and a jasmine flower do not grasp themselves or others.

original: me dang sna ma'i me tog dag rang dang gzhan gyi @18b bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta mig bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa bzhin du gzugs gzhan dag la yang
analyzed: me dang sna ma'i me tog dag rang dang gzhan gyi @18b bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta mig bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi byed pa bzhin du gzugs gzhan dag la yang
translated: If the elder BuddhapaÃÑlita says that just as it does not grasp itself, so too it does not grasp other forms,

original: 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub na ni de lta na yang de'i chos mi mthun pa'i chos me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang ; sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na zhes smos pa des mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dzin par mi byed par sgrub na ni de lta na yang de'i chos mi mthun pa'i chos me la tsha ba mthong na de dang ldan pas chu la yang dmigs pa dang ; sna ma'i me tog la dri zhim pa nyid mthong na de dang ldan pas gos la yang dmigs pa lta bu yin na zhes smos pa des mi nus te /
translated: If you establish that it does not grasp, then even so, it is not possible, since it is seen that when one sees heat in fire, which is a property of fire, one also observes it in water, which has that property, and when one sees sweet fragrance in a jasmine flower, one also observes it in cloth, which has that property.

original: don dam par me ni rang la sreg par mi byed cing gzhan yang sreg par mi byed la /
analyzed: don dam par me ni rang la sreg par mi byed cing gzhan yang sreg par mi byed la /
translated: In the ultimate sense, fire does not burn itself nor does it burn another.

original: sna ma'i me tog kyang rang la yang dri zhim pa nyid du mi byed la gzhan yang bri zhim pa nyid du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog kyang rang la yang dri zhim pa nyid du mi byed la gzhan yang bri zhim pa nyid du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And a jasmine flower does not make itself fragrant nor does it make another fragrant.

original: de lta bas na de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid na re gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not logical. This is what the commentator himself says, that the explanation of the elder Buddhapalita is not logical.

original: de'i phyir de ltar mig lta bar ma grub pas skye ba yang ma grub 'gro ba yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mig lta bar ma grub pas skye ba yang ma grub 'gro ba yang ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, since the eye is not established as seeing, arising is not established and going is not established.

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Since there is no example, this is a conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pas dpyad na mig lta bar ma grub pas sngar phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pas dpyad na mig lta bar ma grub pas sngar phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, when analyzed with reasoning, since the eye is not established as seeing, the previous position is posited, namely, that ultimately the internal sense sources are only apprehended as arisen.

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are ascertained in individual objects.

original: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de /
translated: Here, that which does not arise is not ascertained in individual objects.üîΩFor example, like the sense sources of the son of a barren woman, which are not ascertained in individual objects.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i skye ba de yang ma grub la /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i skye ba de yang ma grub la /
translated: The arising that was stated is also not established.

original: 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: And going should be understood to exist.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i 'gro ba de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smos pa'i 'gro ba de yang ma grub ste /
translated: But that going is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sngar phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta bu yod de /
analyzed: sngar phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta bu yod de /
translated: Previously, in the context of the prior position, it was said that the internal sense bases have such and such a specific object field,

original: 'di lta ste lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang / yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no zhes smos pa'i dpe de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang / yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no zhes smos pa'i dpe de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for example, the object fields of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and mental consciousness are form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and phenomena, respectively.

original: yang na gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, the reason is contradictory.

original: ci ste pha rol po dag kun rdzob tu lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed par sgrub na ni de dag don @19a * //
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po dag kun rdzob tu lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed par sgrub na ni de dag don @19a * //
translated: If the opponent proves that seeing sees form conventionally, then that reason is contradictory, because it is not established for the opponent.

original: dam par sgrub pa dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin pas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dam par sgrub pa dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin pas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the proof of the eye as ultimate and the reason are contradictory, that is also not correct.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: khyod sgrub pa'i don sgro btags nas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed de /
analyzed: khyod sgrub pa'i don sgro btags nas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúYou impute the meaning of proof and say, ‚ÄòThe eye does not see form because it does not see itself.‚ÄôüîΩBut this is stated as follows: If it has no power over itself, it is shown that it has no power over others.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚ÄùüîΩis a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚Äù

original: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas ni 'di skad ces gal te de la rang gi bdag nyid la nus pa med na de la gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang de med par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas ni 'di skad ces gal te de la rang gi bdag nyid la nus pa med na de la gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang de med par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la
translated: is a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚Äù

original: sogs pa ni skye bar smra ba dag dbu ma pas /
analyzed: sogs pa ni skye bar smra ba dag dbu ma pas /
translated: is a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚ÄùüîΩis a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚ÄùüîΩis a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //üîΩde gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba // de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚ÄùüîΩis a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see itself‚Äù

original: zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma nges pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma nges pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: is a statement that proves that the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'di skad bstan te dbu ma pa khyod rang gi sgrub pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro btags nas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed de /üîΩrang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas ni don du na 'di skad ces gal te mig de la rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par byed pa'i nus pa med na mig de la gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang 'dzin par
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te dbu ma pa khyod rang gi sgrub pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro btags nas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed de / rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer bas ni don du na 'di skad ces gal te mig de la rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par byed pa'i nus pa med na mig de la gzhan gyi bdag nyid la yang 'dzin par
translated: This is taught: You MƒÅdhyamika, having superimposed an unreal object of affirmation, say, ‚ÄúThe eye does not see forms,

original: byed pa'i nus pa med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i nus pa med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it does not see its own self.‚Äù In fact, this teaches that if the eye lacks the power to apprehend its own self, then the eye also lacks the power to apprehend another‚Äôs self.

original: de lta na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: de lta na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it was said, ‚ÄúIn that case, it is still not ascertained.‚Äù

original: de lta na khyod kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na khyod kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon chags pa yin no //
translated: In that case, you have committed the error that your reason is not ascertained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me la rang gi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang /
analyzed: me la rang gi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though fire lacks the power to burn its own self,

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩci re zhig mig la rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par byed pa'i nus pa med pas gzhan dag la 'dzin par mi byed pa lta bur 'gyur ram 'on te me la rang gi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te / ci re zhig mig la rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par byed pa'i nus pa med pas gzhan dag la 'dzin par mi byed pa lta bur 'gyur ram 'on te me la rang gi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan
translated: Because it has the power to burn other things.

original: gyi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi bdag nyid la sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa lta bur 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Is it that the eye does not see other things because it does not have the power to see itself? Or is it that fire does not burn itself, but it has the power to burn other things?üîΩIt is not certain.

original: des na me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: des na me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, seeing and so on are established to be like fire.

original: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, although fire burns, it burns other things, but it does not burn itself.

original: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: So too, although seeing sees, it sees other things but does not see itself.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir @19b bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir @19b bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains here:üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.

original: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: The eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fire

original: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
translated: is not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.

original: mig ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: mig ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.
