analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i don de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon brjod pas te zhes bya ba ni skye bar smra ba dag gis mig ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don de rab tu bsgrub pa'i
translated: The meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fireüîΩis not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the fault of the reason being indefinite is stated in order to prove that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe meaning of that is that the eye has the nature of seeing.üîΩThe example of fire

original: phyir me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang /
analyzed: phyir me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang /
translated: is not able to prove seeing.üîΩThe eye has the

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes me'i dpes dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon brjod pa gang yin pa des ni lta ba rab tu bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes me'i dpes dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon brjod pa gang yin pa des ni lta ba rab tu bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The reply to that is: ‚ÄúThe fault of the reason‚Äôs uncertainty that you state, namely, that the example of fire is not established, is not able to establish the view.

original: dpe des mi chog pa dang mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe des mi chog pa dang mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the example is not sufficient and is not able to do that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdon dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩThe thought is that ultimately fire is not established as that which burns, and conventionally it is not established as the nature of seeing.‚Äù

original: nged dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir khyed na re me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa
analyzed: nged dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par me ni sreg par byed pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir khyed na re me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa
translated: In our Madhyamaka position, ultimately fire is not established as that which burns. Although you say that fire does not have the capacity to burn its own nature, it has the capacity to burn another‚Äôs nature.

original: nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i dpe de ma grub pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du yang mig rang gi bdag nyid la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i dpe de ma grub pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du yang mig rang gi bdag nyid la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid la lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro
translated: Because the example you cite is not established, and because even conventionally, the eye is not established as having the nature of seeing itself, it is also not established as having the nature of seeing something other than itself.

original: zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: This is what the Sutra master intended to say.

original: yang na / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Or, to establish seeing,

original: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
translated: The example of fire is not suitable.

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni yang na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni yang na /
translated: To state the faults of the reason,

original: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ;
translated: Or, to establish seeing,

original: / me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: / me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
translated: The example of fire is not suitable.üîΩIn this context, someone might say that the eye sees visible form, and that fire is the reason, because it illuminates itself and others.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di la kha cig lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed gtan tshigs su me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i skyon dbu ma pas brjod pa'i phyir lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di la kha cig lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed gtan tshigs su me ni rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i skyon dbu ma pas brjod pa'i phyir lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir
translated: The faults of that are stated by the Madhyamika.

original: me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not so by the example of fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: me'i ngo bo nyid rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi phyogs la yang med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩme'i ngo bo nyid rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar @20a * //
analyzed: me'i ngo bo nyid rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa de ni gzhan gyi phyogs la yang med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te / me'i ngo bo nyid rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar @20a * //
translated: Because the nature of fire, which illuminates itself and others, does not exist in the other part, and because it is not established as having the nature of burning even conventionally.

original: byed pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la yang med de /
analyzed: byed pa de ni kho bo cag gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la yang med de /
translated: The nature of fire, which illuminates itself and others, does not exist in our part or in the other part.

original: de la mun pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang me rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
analyzed: de la mun pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang me rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma grub pas gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so //
translated: Because there is no darkness there, and because fire is not established as having the nature of burning itself even conventionally, it is not established as having the nature of burning others.

original: des na me de ci ste rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa yin na //
analyzed: des na me de ci ste rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa yin na //
translated: But if it illuminates itself and another,

original: de rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sreg par 'gyur ba'i yang rigs na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag sreg par 'gyur ba'i yang rigs na de lta ma yin no //
translated: it is logical that it would also burn itself and another, but that is not the case.

original: 'on kyang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it burns another but does not burn itself,üîΩthen just as fire burns another but does not burn itself, so too seeing sees another but does not see itself.

original: de lta na yang mes ji ltar gzhan dag sreg par byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar
analyzed: de lta na yang mes ji ltar gzhan dag sreg par byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed kyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar
translated: How could that be possible?

original: rung ste / me ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rung ste / me ji ltar rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as fire illuminates itself and another,

original: lta ba yang gal te lta ba yin na rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de lta bur yang 'gyur ba zhag na mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no
analyzed: lta ba yang gal te lta ba yin na rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag la lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de lta bur yang 'gyur ba zhag na mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no
translated: If seeing were seeing, then it would be like this: ‚ÄúIt sees itself and others.‚Äù But it is not like that. Therefore, the example of fire is not able to establish seeing.

original: // kun rdzob tu yang me'i ngo bo nyid ni tsha ba nyid yin gyi sreg par byed pa nyid ni ma yin pas de'i phyir sreg pa zhes bya ba yang mes byas pa'i bud shing 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir me'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes byaüîΩba smras te /
analyzed: // kun rdzob tu yang me'i ngo bo nyid ni tsha ba nyid yin gyi sreg par byed pa nyid ni ma yin pas de'i phyir sreg pa zhes bya ba yang mes byas pa'i bud shing 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir me'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since heat is the essence of fire, and burning is not, therefore burning is the transformation of fuel produced by fire. Therefore, it is not the essence of fire.

original: sreg pa zhes bya ba ni me'i mthus bud shing gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi me'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pas khyod song la me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed
analyzed: sreg pa zhes bya ba ni me'i mthus bud shing gzhan du 'gyur ba yin gyi me'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pas khyod song la me la rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa'i nus pa nyid med du zin kyang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sreg par byed
translated: Since burning is the transformation of fuel due to the power of fire, it is not the essence of fire. Therefore, you should go to fire and say, ‚ÄúAlthough you lack the power to burn yourself, you burn others.

original: pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dpe des lta ba rab tu bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: pa'i nus pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dpe des lta ba rab tu bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, the example cannot establish seeing.

original: gzhan yang / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover,

original: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin //
translated: The example of fire cannot establish seeing.

original: zhes bya ba ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dang brtag pa dag gis me'i dpe de lta ba dang bcas pa'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩde'i phyir / song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dang brtag pa dag gis me'i dpe de lta ba dang bcas pa'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de'i phyir / song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
translated: The example of fire is not able to establish seeing, because the response in terms of that which has been traversed, that which has not been traversed, and that which is being traversed has already been given.üîΩTherefore,

original: de ni ltar bcas lan btab bo //
analyzed: de ni ltar bcas lan btab bo //
translated: The response in terms of that which has been traversed, that which has not been traversed, and that which is being traversed

original: ltar bcas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ltar bcas zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Has already been given.üîΩThat which has been traversed, that which has not been traversed, and that which is being traversed have already been refuted.

original: gang zhe na me'i dpe de'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na me'i dpe de'o //
translated: What? The example of fire.

original: ci zhig byas she na lan btab @20b po ;
analyzed: ci zhig byas she na lan btab @20b po ;
translated: What has been done? The response.

original: / gang gi zhe na song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dag gis te /
analyzed: / gang gi zhe na song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dag gis te /
translated: By whom? By that which has been traversed, that which has not been traversed, and that which is being traversed.

original: ji ltar sngar don dam par song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dag la 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar don dam par song ba dang ma song ba dang bsgom pa dag la 'gro ba med de /
translated: Just as previously, ultimately there is no going on that which has been traversed, that which has not been traversed, and that which is being traversed.

original: song zin pa'i phyir dang ma song ba'i phyir dang song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bsgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du don dam par mes kyang bud shing bsregs pa dang / bsreg bzhin pa dag sreg par mi byed de /
analyzed: song zin pa'i phyir dang ma song ba'i phyir dang song ba dang ma song ba ma gtogs par bsgom pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du don dam par mes kyang bud shing bsregs pa dang / bsreg bzhin pa dag sreg par mi byed de /
translated: Just as it was explained that fire does not burn fuel that has already burned, that is not being burned, and that is not separate from that being burned because it has burned, because it has not burned, and because apart from that which has burned and that which has not burned, that being burned is not cognized, so too, in the ultimate truth, fire does not burn fuel that has been burned, that is not being burned, and that is not separate from that being burned because it has burned, because it has not burned, and because apart from that which has burned and that which has not burned, that being burned is not cognized.

original: bsregs pa'i phyir dang / ma bsregs pa'i phyir dang / bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa ma gtogs par bsreg pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par mig kyang gzugs bltas pa dang ma bltas pa dang lta ba dag la lta bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bsregs pa'i phyir dang / ma bsregs pa'i phyir dang / bsregs pa dang ma bsregs pa ma gtogs par bsreg pa shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par mig kyang gzugs bltas pa dang ma bltas pa dang lta ba dag la lta bar mi byed de /
translated: So too, in the ultimate truth, the eye does not see form that has been seen, that has not been seen, and that is not separate from that being seen because it has seen, because it has not seen, and because apart from that which has been seen and that which has not been seen, that being seen is not cognized.

original: bltas pa'i phyir dang ma bltas pa'i phyir dang bltas pa dang ma bltas pa ma gtogs par lta ba shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes go rims bzhin du sbyor ba'i tshig dag brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bltas pa'i phyir dang ma bltas pa'i phyir dang bltas pa dang ma bltas pa ma gtogs par lta ba shes par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes go rims bzhin du sbyor ba'i tshig dag brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is seen, because it is not seen, and because apart from that which is seen and that which is not seen, seeing is not known.

original: de ltar me yang sreg par mi byed la lta ba yang lta bar mi byed na ci zhig gang gi dper 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar me yang sreg par mi byed la lta ba yang lta bar mi byed na ci zhig gang gi dper 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if fire does not burn and seeing does not see, then what is the example of what?

original: de'i phyir yang lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example of fire is not capable of establishing seeing.

original: 'di la gzhan dag ni pha rol pos me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan dag ni pha rol pos me bzhin du lta ba la sogs pa 'grub ste /
translated: Here, others say that the opponent establishes seeing, etc., like fire.

original: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, although fire burns, it burns others, but it does not burn itself.

original: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes smras pa'i lan du /üîΩlta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //

translated: To respond to that, the root text says:üîΩThe example of fire

original: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin ;üîΩ/ song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: me yi dpes ni nus ma yin ; / song dang ma song bsgom pa yis //
translated: does not establish seeing.üîΩThe response to the view that it does

translated: is through meditation on where one has gone and where one has not gone.üîΩThe master BuddhapƒÅlita explains this third verse as follows.üîΩHe says that the example of fire does not establish seeing because fire does not burn itself.

original: de yang gzhan sreg par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa gsum pa 'di la 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta ni 'di skad ces rnam par bshad pa byed do zhes bya bar sbyar roüîΩ// de yang sngar /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi lta nyid //

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //

original: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan @21a * //
analyzed: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan @21a * //
translated: For example, although fire burns, it burns others,

original: dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes me'i dpes gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon smras pa de bsal ba'i
analyzed: dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no // de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes me'i dpes gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon smras pa de bsal ba'i

original: lan du gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas tshig le'ur byas pa gsum pa 'di bshad de lta ba de yang gzhan la lta bar mi byed la me de yang gzhan sreg par mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zerüîΩba yin no //
analyzed: lan du gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas tshig le'ur byas pa gsum pa 'di bshad de lta ba de yang gzhan la lta bar mi byed la me de yang gzhan sreg par mi byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon med do zhes zerüîΩba yin no //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te / dpe tsam gyis phyogs snga ma shin tu snying po ma yin pas de 'gog pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gnas brtan bud dha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par
translated: Others say that is not correct,üîΩbecause it is not logical to refute the opponent‚Äôs position merely through analogy, since the opponent‚Äôs position is not very meaningful.

original: sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i tshig yin no //

original: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /

translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that seeing and so on are established by their own intrinsic reality, just as fire is.

original: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me ni sreg par byed pa yin yang gzhan dag sreg par byed pa nyid yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, although fire burns, it burns others but does not burn itself.

original: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba yang lta bar byed pa yin yang gzhan dag la lta bar byed pa nyid yin gyi /

original: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes smras pa'i phyogs snga ma de ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba med de /

original: dpe tsam zhig brjod par zad pa'i phyir shin tu snying po ma yin pas de la yan lag ma tshang ba nyid tsam gyi skyon brjod pas tshig  na gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas 'di skad ces khyod kyis lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir
analyzed: dpe tsam zhig brjod par zad pa'i phyir shin tu snying po ma yin pas de la yan lag ma tshang ba nyid tsam gyi skyon brjod pas tshig  na gnas brtan bud dha p'a li tas 'di skad ces khyod kyis lta ba rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir
translated: The elder Buddhapalita says that if you say, ‚ÄúThe example of fire that you cite in order to prove seeing

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ces gsungs so //

analyzed: de lta bas na me'i dpes nus pa ma yin no zhes phyogs snga ma des 'gog pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //

translated: The eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.

translated: The eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.

original: 'di na sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ste /üîΩder gang ji skad bstan pa de ni de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /

translated: The eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling.üîΩThe eye has the action of seeing, because it is called ‚Äúthe seer,‚Äù like a potter is called ‚Äúthe wheeler‚Äù because of the action of wheeling

original: 'di na brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos las byed pa po gang yin pa la bya ba byed pa'i tshig gi rkyen lhas byin las byed pas byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba dang / mig gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba po yin no zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di na brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos las byed pa po gang yin pa la bya ba byed pa'i tshig gi rkyen lhas byin las byed pas byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba dang / mig gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba po yin no zhes brjod pa /
translated: The agent of the action is Devadatta, who is the condition for the word ‚Äúagent.‚ÄùüîΩSince the eye sees form, it is the seer.

original: des na mig gis gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na mig gis gzugs la lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since the eye sees form, it is called seeing.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos des gang ji skad bstan pa de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos des gang ji skad bstan pa de ni de bzhin te /
translated: Since the treatise on grammar teaches this, it is so and not otherwise.

original: gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas de'i phyir lta ba po mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pas de'i phyir lta ba po mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the eye, the seer, definitely has the activity of seeing.

original: dper na byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas thugs su chud par mdzad pa 'am thugs su chud par gyur pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: dper na byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas thugs su chud par mdzad pa 'am thugs su chud par gyur pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: For example, the agent is described as the condition for the action, and the Buddha is described as one who has realized or one who has become enlightened. This is a similar example.

original: dper na sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las byed pa po gang yin pa la bya ba byed pa'i tshig gam rkyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya thams cad thugs su chud par mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas pa dag gi gzhung las byed pa po gang yin pa la bya ba byed pa'i tshig gam rkyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes bya thams cad thugs su chud par mdzad pa'am /
translated: For example, in the scriptures of the Buddhists, the word or phrase ‚Äúthe agent‚Äù is applied to the Bhagavan Buddha, who has comprehended all objects of knowledge.

original: thugs su chud par gyur pas sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa des na sangs rgyas ni padma rang gis rang nyid kha 'byed par byed pas padma la kha 'byed pa'i bya ba yod pa bzhin du nyid kyis shes bya thams cad thugs su chud par mdzad pas sangs rgyas
analyzed: thugs su chud par gyur pas sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa des na sangs rgyas ni padma rang gis rang nyid kha 'byed par byed pas padma la kha 'byed pa'i bya ba yod pa bzhin du nyid kyis shes bya thams cad thugs su chud par mdzad pas sangs rgyas
translated: Since he is called ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù because he has comprehended all objects of knowledge, he is like a lotus that opens by itself, and the lotus has the action of opening.

original: @22a * // bcom ldan 'das shes bya thugs su chud par mdzad pa'i bya ba mnga' ba de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs la lta bar byed pas mig la yang lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: @22a * // bcom ldan 'das shes bya thugs su chud par mdzad pa'i bya ba mnga' ba de bzhin du mig kyang gzugs la lta bar byed pas mig la yang lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha has the action of comprehending all objects of knowledge, and likewise, since the eye sees form, the eye also has the action of seeing.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa bsgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i khongs su ni yod mod kyi don dam par ni med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa bsgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i khongs su ni yod mod kyi don dam par ni med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here explains that the proof of seeing is included within conventional truth, but it does not exist ultimately.

original: brda sprod pa pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas /
analyzed: brda sprod pa pa'i tham lag gi rjes su zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered into the palm of the grammarians,

original: mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod par sgrub pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pas don dam par med do //
analyzed: mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod par sgrub pa de kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pas don dam par med do //
translated: the proof that the eye has the activity of seeing is included within conventional truth, but it does not exist ultimately.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: 'di nyid du mig lta ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir lta ba dang bral ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di nyid du mig lta ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir lta ba dang bral ba yin pas /
translated: Because seeing is refuted in this very text, and because its arising is refuted, it is free from seeing.

original: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
translated: When it does not see the slightest thing,

original: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not a seer.

original: gang gi tshe gtan pa'am khri'u 'am cung zad la yang lta bar mi byed pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtan pa'am khri'u 'am cung zad la yang lta bar mi byed pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: When it does not see a wall, a table, or the slightest thing, at that time it is not a seer.

original: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di nyid du mig lta ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rkyen brtag pa dang / 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su lta ba de'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir mig ni lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin pas de ltar gang gi tshe mig lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yul gtan pa 'am khri'u la sogs pa cungüîΩzad la yang lta bar mi byed pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di nyid du mig lta ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rkyen brtag pa dang / 'gro ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su lta ba de'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir mig ni lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin pas de ltar gang gi tshe mig lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yul gtan pa 'am khri'u la sogs pa cung zad la yang lta bar mi byed pa de'i tshe lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because in this chapter on the analysis of the faculties it has been refuted that the eye sees, and because in the chapters on the analysis of conditions and the analysis of going it has been refuted that seeing arises, the eye is devoid of the activity of seeing.üîΩThus, when the eye, devoid of the activity of seeing, does not see even the slightest thing, such as a fixed object or a chair, then it does not see.

original: de'i phyir / lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
translated: Therefore:

original: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be tenableüîΩto say that seeing sees?

original: lta bas lta bar byed ces bya ba de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta bas lta bar byed ces bya ba de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be tenable to say that seeing sees?

original: de ni mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni lta bas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i khongs su ni yod mod kyi don dam par ni med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya bas ni lta bas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i khongs su ni yod mod kyi don dam par ni med do zhes bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúthat is completely unreasonable‚Äù is that the proof ‚Äúseeing sees‚Äù exists in the context of conventional truth, but it does not exist in ultimate reality.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
translated: Seeing does not see.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
translated: When it does not see anything at all,

original: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //üîΩlta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ma yin no // lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
translated: It does not see.

original: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
translated: How could it be tenableüîΩTo say ‚ÄúSeeing sees‚Äù?

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa de'i phyir lta bas lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa de'i phyir lta bas lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the reasoning explained above, seeing does not see.

original: ci ste legs par ma zin pa'i gdon gyis brlams pas lta ba ma yin pas lta bar byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste legs par ma zin pa'i gdon gyis brlams pas lta ba ma yin pas lta bar byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that because of being possessed by a demon that has not been properly exorcized, seeing does not see,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //

original: lta ba'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lta ba'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir //

original: bong @22b ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bong @22b ba la sogs pa bzhin no //

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /

original: lta ba ma yin pa ni bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir der yang lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: lta ba ma yin pa ni bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba'i nus pas stong pa'i phyir der yang lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: Since nonseeing is empty of the capacity to see, like a lump of earth and so on, it does not see.

original: de ni dam bcas pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: des na don dam par sgra'i bstan bcos las lta ba'i sgra dang sangs rgyas kyi sgra bstan pa mi rung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: des na don dam par sgra'i bstan bcos las lta ba'i sgra dang sangs rgyas kyi sgra bstan pa mi rung ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, it is completely untenable that the treatise on grammar teaches the term ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and the term ‚ÄúBuddha,‚Äù

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /

original: de ltar lta ba yang lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba yang lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Thus, seeing does not see, and nonseeing does not see.

original: lta ba ma yin pa yang lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i rigs pa des na phyogs snga ma smra ba dag gis mig lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin te /

original: 'di na sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas mthong bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di na sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas mthong bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the treatise on grammar explains that because the agent is expressed by the grammatical case of the verb, it is called seeing.

original: @23a * // mig de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las /üîΩbyed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ba'am /

translated: In the case of the eye being the seer by nature, the treatise on grammar states:üîΩSince the eye is established as the agent by stating the condition of action in regard to the agent, it is called the seer because it sees.

original: 'on te mig de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes ga la gnyis su brtag pa yin no //

translated: Or, in the case of the eye not being the seer by nature, how could it be the seer because it sees, since the eye is established as the agent by stating the condition of action in regard to the agent?üîΩWhat is the problem with that?

analyzed: gal te de lta ba yin pa la bya ba ni zhes bya ba ni gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na'o //
translated: If the former analysis is accepted, then the eye is the seer.

analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na / gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
translated: What is the problem with that?üîΩWhen it does not see the slightest bit,

original: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the seer.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: lta ba nyid lta bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lta ba nyid lta bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
