original: gang gi tshe mig de cung zad la yang mi lta ba de'i tshe na de lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig de cung zad la yang mi lta ba de'i tshe na de lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: When the eye does not see even the slightest thing, then it is not seeing.

original: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: But how is it that it sees?

original: gang gi tshe lta ba nyid na lta bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lta ba nyid na lta bar byed pa yin no //
translated: When it is seeing, it sees.

original: nges cir 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: nges cir 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: des na mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des na mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the eye sees because the action of seeing arises in it.

original: des na mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod cing lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod cing lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the eye sees because it has the action of seeing and it has the intrinsic reality of seeing.

original: de lta na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: de lta na gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The problem is that the fault of the reason and example still exists.

original: de lta na sngar mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na sngar mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the eye previously had the action of seeing.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos las de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon don dam par sgra'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos las de ltar bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon don dam par sgra'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Because it is taught in the treatise on grammar that it is so.

original: lta ba'i sgra dang sangs rgyas kyi sgra bstan pa mi rung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i sgra dang sangs rgyas kyi sgra bstan pa mi rung ba kho na ste /
translated: The fault of the example is that it is not correct to teach the term ‚Äúview‚Äù and the term ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù in the treatise on grammar,

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad bstan pa de nyid yod pas mi rung ngo //üîΩgal te de lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po na re mig gi dbang po ma gtogs par lta ba'i bya ba gzhan me dpas des na mig de lta ba'i
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro zhes ji skad bstan pa de nyid yod pas mi rung ngo // gal te de lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir lta ba nyid yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po na re mig gi dbang po ma gtogs par lta ba'i bya ba gzhan me dpas des na mig de lta ba'i
translated: because there is no example.üîΩIf you say that it is seeing because it is the agent of the action of seeing,üîΩif the opponent says that since there is no action of seeing other than the eye faculty, therefore the eye is seeing because it is the agent of the action of seeing,

original: bya ba byed pa po yin pa'i phyir mi gnyid lta ba nyid yin no zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa po yin pa'i phyir mi gnyid lta ba nyid yin no zhes zer na'o //
translated: then the response is that it is not tenable that the eye is seeing because it is the agent of the action of seeing.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du de'i tshe de lta ba yin na lta ba'i bya ba don med pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du de'i tshe de lta ba yin na lta ba'i bya ba don med pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it were like that, then seeing would be pointless.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe mig de lta ba yin na de la lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa skye ba don med pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir / lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig de lta ba yin na de la lta ba'i bya ba gnyis pa skye ba don med pa nyid do // de'i phyir / lta bas lta bar byed ces byar //
translated: If at that time the eye were seeing, then a second action of seeing would arise, but that would be pointless.üîΩTherefore:üîΩHow could it be logical to say

original: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar rigs par 'gyur //
translated: That seeing sees?

original: mi rigs pa @23b kho na yin te /üîΩlta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mig de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: mi rigs pa @23b kho na yin te / lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba ni mig de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: It is illogical.üîΩThe meaning of the words is that if the eye has the nature of seeing,

original: snga nas lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir de la lta ba'i bya ba gzhan don med pa nyid de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: snga nas lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir de la lta ba'i bya ba gzhan don med pa nyid de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir
translated: then since it already possesses the action of seeing, another action of seeing would be pointless. Since it has the nature of seeing, the grammatical treatises state that the agent is expressed by the present participle, and it is established as the agent.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not tenable to say that it is seeing‚Äù is that it is not tenable to say that it is seeing.üîΩBut if it is not seeing, then what?

original: ci ste de lta ba ma yin pa la bya na yang zhes bya ba ni ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ste de lta ba ma yin pa la bya na yang zhes bya ba ni ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na yang ngo //
translated: If you assert the latter analysis, then what?

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would be the consequence?

original: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe cung zad mi lta ba //
translated: If it does not see the slightest thing,

original: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not seeing.

original: de'i tshe de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin pas lta ba ma yin pa yang lta bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba yin pas lta ba ma yin pa yang lta bar byed pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If at that time it does not have the intrinsic reality of seeing, then like a clod of earth and so on, it is devoid of the activity of seeing. Therefore, if it is not seeing, then it is not seeing.

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa la sgra'i bstan bcos las byed pa po la bya ba'i rkyen brjod nas byed pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir lta bar byed pas lta ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is not tenable to say that it is seeing‚Äù is that it is not tenable to say that it is seeing, because in the treatise on grammar it is said that the absolutive affix is used to express the condition of the agent, and it is established as the agent.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang lta ba'i bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /üîΩlta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gnyi ga yang lta ba'i bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir / lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
translated: Therefore, since both are devoid of the activity of seeing,üîΩSeeing does not see.

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
translated: That which is not seeing does not see.

original: ces bya ba ni brtag pa snga ma gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni brtag pa snga ma gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of both former analyses and the result of valid knowledge.

original: ci ste dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go bas de'i phyir mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas /
analyzed: ci ste dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go bas de'i phyir mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas /
translated: But if you say that the two negations exist, then the meaning of the context is understood, and therefore you say, ‚ÄúThe eye sees because the activity of seeing has arisen,‚Äù

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //üîΩces bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de la dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go pas 'dir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i skabs kyi don ni lta bas lta ba nyid yin na de'i phyir khyed kyis /
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid // ces bshad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa de la dgag pa gnyis yod na skabs kyi don go pas 'dir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i skabs kyi don ni lta bas lta ba nyid yin na de'i phyir khyed kyis /
translated: That which is not seeing does not see.

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
translated: If you say that the two negations exist in the statement of the root text, ‚ÄúThat which is not seeing does not see,‚Äù then the meaning of the context is understood. Therefore, you say, ‚ÄúThe eye sees because the activity of seeing has arisen.‚Äù

original: ces bshad pa des na mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bas khyed rang gis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa des na mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bas khyed rang gis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer na'o //
translated: Thus, since the arising of the action of seeing is seeing, this contradicts your own assertion.

original: de skad ces zer bde'i lan du de nyid bzang po ma yin te yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen dgag pa bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i byed rgyu nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer bde'i lan du de nyid bzang po ma yin te yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen dgag pa bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i byed rgyu nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that this is not good, because just as the conditions of existent and nonexistent are refuted, the causes of existent and nonexistent are also refuted.

original: klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te ;
analyzed: klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te ;
translated: This objection is not good.

original: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /üîΩmed dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su / med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: Previously, in the chapter on the analysis of conditions, it was explained:üîΩConditions are not tenable

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: For an existent or nonexistent object.

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, what would be a condition?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what would a condition do?

original: zhes bshad pas yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen dgag pa bzhin du 'dir yang lta ba'i bya ba yod pa dang med @24a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas yod pa dang med pa'i rkyen dgag pa bzhin du 'dir yang lta ba'i bya ba yod pa dang med @24a * //
translated: Thus, just as the conditions of existent and nonexistent are refuted, here also the action of seeing that exists or does not exist is refuted.

original: pa gnyi gas lta ba'i byed rgyu nyid bkag pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin pa lta bar mi byed pa nyid do zhes med par dgag pa'i tshul bstan pas lta ba lta bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir
analyzed: pa gnyi gas lta ba'i byed rgyu nyid bkag pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin pa lta bar mi byed pa nyid do zhes med par dgag pa'i tshul bstan pas lta ba lta bar byed pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir
translated: Since this is a teaching on the mode of nonexistence, it does not establish the mode of nonexistence that seeing sees.

original: rang gis khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gis khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it does not undermine what we accept.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas de lta ba yin par rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'di snyam du da ltar lta ba'i ngo bo nyid la lta ba'i bya ba med pas de lta ba ma yin
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas de lta ba yin par rtog na ni zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'di snyam du da ltar lta ba'i ngo bo nyid la lta ba'i bya ba med pas de lta ba ma yin
translated: If you imagine that seeing exists prior to the seer and then conceive that to be seeing, then that is not seeing because it does not see.

original: du zin kyang mig ni phyis gzugs la lta bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur bas des na phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas mig de lta ba yin pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur bas rtog cing de skad zer ba yin no //
analyzed: du zin kyang mig ni phyis gzugs la lta bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur bas des na phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas mig de lta ba yin pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur bas rtog cing de skad zer ba yin no //
translated: But since it is certain that the eye will later see form, therefore, since it is imputed to be seeing in the sense of arising later, it is called seeing.

original: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du tha snyad kyi bden pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer na de'i lan du tha snyad kyi bden pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, it is said that your assertion is undermined because it would completely undermine conventional truth.

original: khyed ni da ltar lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba'i tshul gyis don dam par sgrub pa yin na phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas de lta ba yin par rtog pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i
analyzed: khyed ni da ltar lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba'i tshul gyis don dam par sgrub pa yin na phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba nyid du nye bar brtags nas de lta ba yin par rtog pas ni tha snyad kyi bden pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i
translated: If you assert that the eye is seeing in the sense of seeing form in the present, you would be proving it ultimately in the sense of seeing by way of its essential nature. But since you impute it to be seeing in the sense of arising later and you think that it is seeing, you completely undermine conventional truth.

original: phyir khyed rang gi 'dod pa nyams shing gzhi ma grub pa yin pas de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phyir khyed rang gi 'dod pa nyams shing gzhi ma grub pa yin pas de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore your assertion is undermined and the basis is not established. That is also untenable.

original: yang na pha rol po na re mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed par smra ste /
analyzed: yang na pha rol po na re mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed par smra ste /
translated: Or else, the opponent says that the eye sees because the action of seeing arises,

original: bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the convention of action exists.

original: gang la lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa des ni lta ba'i bya ba byed do zhes mi brjod de dper na rna ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa des ni lta ba'i bya ba byed do zhes mi brjod de dper na rna ba bzhin no //
translated: One does not say that that by which the action of seeing has not arisen sees, like the ear.üîΩThe master says that the opponent

original: mig la ni lta ba'i bya ba yod pas mig gis lta bar byed do zhes tha snyad 'dogs so zhes zer ba la slob dpon gyis bshad pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: mig la ni lta ba'i bya ba yod pas mig gis lta bar byed do zhes tha snyad 'dogs so zhes zer ba la slob dpon gyis bshad pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: says that the eye sees because the action of seeing exists in the eye.üîΩThe first half of the verse

original: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
translated: The eye does not see.

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //üîΩces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i phyed gong ma 'di ni yang na pha rol bo dag na re 'jig rten na mig lta bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i sgo nas dpags na mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pas lta ba gzugs
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid // ces bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa de'i phyed gong ma 'di ni yang na pha rol bo dag na re 'jig rten na mig lta bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i sgo nas dpags na mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pas lta ba gzugs
translated: That which is not seeing does not see.

original: la lta bar byed do zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: la lta bar byed do zhes zer ba la /
translated: The opponent says that the eye sees form because the action of seeing exists in the eye, since the convention the eye sees exists in the world.

original: slob dpon gyis de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes ston to ;
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa yin no zhes ston to ;
translated: The master explains in order to refute that.

original: / pha rol po'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: / pha rol po'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Those words of the opponent are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example that is discordant with the predicate, respectively.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: Thus,

original: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: lta ba lta nyid ma yin te //
translated: seeing is not seeing itself.

original: pha rol pos don dam par lta ba po 'ga' zhig la lta ba'i bya ba @24b skyes par ma bstan pa'i phyir dang lta ba la lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i sngon rol na lta ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes
analyzed: pha rol pos don dam par lta ba po 'ga' zhig la lta ba'i bya ba @24b skyes par ma bstan pa'i phyir dang lta ba la lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i sngon rol na lta ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes
translated: The opponent does not teach that ultimately any seer generates the action of seeing and prior to the generation of the action of seeing seeing does not exist as seeing.

original: bya ba ni pha rol po dag de skad ces zer ba lta na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni pha rol po dag de skad ces zer ba lta na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: If the opponent says that, that also is not tenable.

original: lta bas lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lta bas lta bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Seeing does not see.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: pha rol pos don dam par lta ba pos lhas byin lta bu 'ga' zhig la lta ba'i bya ba skyes par rjes su dpag pa gang gi sgo nas kyang ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i sngon rol na ma skyes ba'i dus na lta ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten na mig lta bar byed do zhes bya bar tha snyad yod pa'i sgo nas dpags na /
analyzed: pha rol pos don dam par lta ba pos lhas byin lta bu 'ga' zhig la lta ba'i bya ba skyes par rjes su dpag pa gang gi sgo nas kyang ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / lta ba la lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i sngon rol na ma skyes ba'i dus na lta ba nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir 'jig rten na mig lta bar byed do zhes bya bar tha snyad yod pa'i sgo nas dpags na /
translated: Because the opponent has not taught by any means that the action of seeing arises in some seer such as Devadatta in reality, and because prior to the arising of the action of seeing in seeing, when it has not yet arisen, seeing itself is not established, the master thinks that if one infers by way of the convention that exists in the world, ‚ÄúThe eye sees,‚Äù

original: mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pas /
analyzed: mig la lta ba'i bya ba yod pas /
translated: the eye has the action of seeing.

original: lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes byar mi rung bar slong dpon gyis dgongs so //
analyzed: lta ba gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes byar mi rung bar slong dpon gyis dgongs so //
translated: Therefore it is not suitable to say, ‚ÄúSeeing sees form.‚Äù

original: sngon lta ba ma yin pa las phyis lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni bstan dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon lta ba ma yin pa las phyis lta ba'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni bstan dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is difficult to teach that which is not seeing previously but later comes to possess the action of seeing,

original: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba min pa mi lta nyid //
translated: It is not seeing that does not see.

original: ces bya ba ni gal te pha rol po na re lta ba lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa'i sngon rol na lta ba ma yin yang phyis lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i dus na lta ba yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gal te pha rol po na re lta ba lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa'i sngon rol na lta ba ma yin yang phyis lta ba'i bya ba skyes pa'i dus na lta ba yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the opponent says that prior to the activity of seeing, the seer is not seeing, but later, when the activity of seeing arises, it becomes the seer,

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa gang gi sgo nas kyang bstan dka' ba'i phyir lta ba ma yin pas kyang lta bar mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa gang gi sgo nas kyang bstan dka' ba'i phyir lta ba ma yin pas kyang lta bar mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: then, since it is difficult to teach this by any inference, it is not the seer, and thus it does not see.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Thus, since the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: don 'gal ba nyid yin pas dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid yin pas dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: or since the meaning of the reason is contradictory, the thesis is undermined. This is the conclusion, and it is the result of the valid knowledge.

original: de ltar dpyad na don dam par sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas pha rol po na re mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed pa
analyzed: de ltar dpyad na don dam par sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pas pha rol po na re mig lta ba'i bya ba skyes pas lta bar byed pa
translated: When analyzed in this way, if the proof is in terms of ultimate reality, the meaning of the reason is not established. If the proof is in terms of conventional reality, the meaning of the reason is contradictory. Therefore, the opponent says that the eye sees because the activity of seeing arises.

original: smras te / bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras te / bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the convention of action exists.

original: gang la lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa des ni lta bar byed do zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: gang la lta ba'i bya ba ma skyes pa des ni lta bar byed do zhes mi brjod de /
translated: One does not say that he sees who has not yet generated the action of seeing.

original: dper na rna ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rna ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the ear.

original: mig la ni lta ba'i bya ba yod pas mig gis lta bar byed do zhes tha snyad 'dogs so zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa nyams so //
analyzed: mig la ni lta ba'i bya ba yod pas mig gis lta bar byed do zhes tha snyad 'dogs so zhes zer ba'i dam bcas pa nyams so //
translated: But the eye has the action of seeing, so the convention is made, ‚ÄúThe eye sees.‚Äù

original: de yan chad kyis ni mig nyid lta ba po yin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs bkag go //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni mig nyid lta ba po yin par 'dod pa dag gi phyogs bkag go //
translated: Up to this point, the position that the eye itself is the seer has been refuted.

original: 'dir grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag lta ba po yin la mig lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dang bye brag pa dag gis smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag lta ba po yin la mig lta ba'i bya ba'i byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and Vai≈õe·π£ika say, ‚ÄúThe self is the seer, and the eye is the instrument of the action of seeing.

original: bdag de mig des gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes zer ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa ston to //üîΩde'i phyir de @25a * //
analyzed: bdag de mig des gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes zer ba dag gi phyogs dgag pa ston to // de'i phyir de @25a * //
translated: The self sees form with that eye.‚Äù This teaches the refutation of their position.

original: dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba ste /
analyzed: dag gi gzhung bstan pa'i phyir 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach their scriptures, ‚ÄúIt is seeing because it sees.

original: byed pa la bya ba'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: byed pa la bya ba'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Because the condition of action is stated in relation to the agent.

original: lta ba po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig 'dis gzugs la lta bar byed pas mig ni lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig 'dis gzugs la lta bar byed pas mig ni lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye is called seeing because it sees form by means of the action of seeing of the self that is the seer.

original: byed pa mig la 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes lta bar byed pa la bya ba'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa mig la 'dis lta bar byed pas lta ba'o zhes lta bar byed pa la bya ba'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition of action is stated in relation to the eye that is the agent, it sees by means of that.

original: byed pa de gang yin pa de ni lta ba po ste de yang des lta bar byed do zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i byed pa mig de byed pa po bdag gang gi yin pa'i bdag de ni lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa de gang yin pa de ni lta ba po ste de yang des lta bar byed do zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i byed pa mig de byed pa po bdag gang gi yin pa'i bdag de ni lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the agent is the seer and that also sees by means of that. The eye that is the agent of seeing is the self that is the agent of seeing. That self is called seeing.

original: lta ba po de yang mig des gzugs la lta bar byed do //
analyzed: lta ba po de yang mig des gzugs la lta bar byed do //
translated: That seer also sees form by means of that eye.

original: dper na gcod pa pos sta res gcad par bya ba shing gcod par byed kyi sta re nyid kyis gcod par mi byed pa bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dper na gcod pa po lhas byin gyis gcod par byed pa'i sta res gcod par bya ba shing gcod
analyzed: dper na gcod pa pos sta res gcad par bya ba shing gcod par byed kyi sta re nyid kyis gcod par mi byed pa bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dper na gcod pa po lhas byin gyis gcod par byed pa'i sta res gcod par bya ba shing gcod
translated: For example, Devadatta, the axe wielder, cuts the object to be cut, a tree, with the axe, the instrument of cutting.üîΩBut the axe itself, the instrument of cutting, does not cut the tree, the object to be cut.

original: par byed kyi gcod pa'i byed pa sta re nyid kyis gcad par bya ba shing gcod par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po bdag gis kyang lta ba'i byed pa mig gis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed kyi lta ba'i byed pa mig
analyzed: par byed kyi gcod pa'i byed pa sta re nyid kyis gcad par bya ba shing gcod par mi byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po bdag gis kyang lta ba'i byed pa mig gis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed kyi lta ba'i byed pa mig
translated: In the same way, the self, the seer, sees visible form, the object seen, with the eye, the instrument of seeing.

original: nyid kyis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyid kyis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed do //
translated: But the eye itself, the instrument of seeing, does not see visible form, the object to be seen.üîΩTherefore, it is established that the eye does not see.

original: des na mig gis lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig des blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed kyi /
analyzed: des na mig gis lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig des blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed kyi /
translated: This is an argument that establishes what is already established.

original: lta ba'i byed pa mig nyid kyis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i rigs pa des na khyed dbu ma pas /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba'i byed pa mig nyid kyis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i rigs pa des na khyed dbu ma pas / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na // de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: The reason that the eye itself, the agent of seeing, does not see form, the object of seeing, is the same reason that you Madhyamaka say:üîΩThe seer does not see itself

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: If it does not see itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: How can it see others?

original: zhes bshad pas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed po zhes bsgrubs pa de ni kho bo cag gi gzhung la yang grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas mig gzugs la lta bar mi byed po zhes bsgrubs pa de ni kho bo cag gi gzhung la yang grub pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no //
translated: Since you have proven that the eye does not see form, you have committed the error of proving what is already established for us.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is a fallacy, he says:

original: byed pa dag la byed pa po yod de byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sta re la sogs pa dag la gcod pa po yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byed pa dag la byed pa po yod de byed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sta re la sogs pa dag la gcod pa po yod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The agent exists in dependence on the action because it is the agent, just as the cutter exists in dependence on the axe and so on.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na gcod pa'i byed pa sta re la sogs pa dag ni gcod pa'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dag la gcod pa'i byed pa po mi yod pas gcod pa'i byed pa po mi de gcod @25b pa'i byed pa sta re la sogs pas gcad par bya
analyzed: dper na gcod pa'i byed pa sta re la sogs pa dag ni gcod pa'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dag la gcod pa'i byed pa po mi yod pas gcod pa'i byed pa po mi de gcod @25b pa'i byed pa sta re la sogs pas gcad par bya
translated: The human being who is the agent of cutting cuts the tree that is the object to be cut by the instrument of cutting, the axe and so on.üîΩIn the same way, since the eye is the instrument of seeing, the self that is the agent of seeing exists in dependence on it.

original: ba shing gcod par byed pa de bzhin du lta ba'i byed pa mig kyang lta ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir de la lta ba'i byed pa po bdag yod pas lta ba'i byed pa po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig gis blta bar bya ba gzugs laüîΩlta bar byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ba shing gcod par byed pa de bzhin du lta ba'i byed pa mig kyang lta ba'i byed pa yin pa'i phyir de la lta ba'i byed pa po bdag yod pas lta ba'i byed pa po bdag de lta ba'i byed pa mig gis blta bar bya ba gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The self that is the agent of seeing sees the form that is the object to be seen by the instrument of seeing, the eye.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: lta ba nyid kyis lta ba po'i rnam par bshad par shes par bya ba ni lan btab par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba nyid kyis lta ba po'i rnam par bshad par shes par bya ba ni lan btab par shes par bya'o //
translated: The response should be understood as the explanation that the seer is seeing itself.

original: gang gis she na lta ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis she na lta ba nyid kyis so //
translated: By what? By seeing itself.

original: gang zhe na lta ba po'i ste lta ba po nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gang zhe na lta ba po'i ste lta ba po nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: What is that? It is the refutation of the view that the seer is the self.

original: sngar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su gtan tshigs dang dpe gang dag bstan pa de dag nyid 'dir lta ba po dgag pa'i skabs su yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sngar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su gtan tshigs dang dpe gang dag bstan pa de dag nyid 'dir lta ba po dgag pa'i skabs su yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the reason and example that were taught in the previous chapter on the refutation of seeing should be applied here in the chapter on the refutation of the seer.üîΩTherefore, just as in the previous chapter on the refutation of seeing, it was said:

original: de'i phyir ji ltar der mig gi chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar der mig gi chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The eye does not see itself.üîΩIn the same way,

original: 'dir bdag gi chos kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag gi chos kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the self‚Äôs attributes also do not see the self.

original: sngar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: sngar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: In the previous chapter on the refutation of seeing, it was said:üîΩThe seer does not see itself.

original: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: It does not see itself.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: When it does not see itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: How can it see others?

original: zhes bshad pas lta ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir lta ba po dgag pa'i skabs su yang /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: zhes bshad pas lta ba gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir lta ba po dgag pa'i skabs su yang / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na // de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: In the same way, in the context of refuting the seer, the following should be applied:üîΩThe seer does not seeüîΩitself.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: When it does not see itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: how can it see others?

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te lta ba po bdag gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te lta ba po bdag gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa'i sgrub pa'i chos kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: The thesis that the seer does not see form is also the thesis that the seer does not see itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bdag rang gi bdag nyid mthong bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag rang gi bdag nyid mthong bar mi 'thad de /
translated: Because it is untenable that the self sees itself,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug par 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to engage itself.

original: phyogs kyi chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de sgrub pa'i don du 'jig pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid gcod par mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa de sgrub pa'i don du 'jig pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar ral gri'i so de nyid kyis ral gri'i so de nyid gcod par mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to prove that the property of the position does not see itself, he gives the example of destruction: ‚ÄúIt is just like the edge of a sword does not cut itself.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag kyang lta ba po ma yin te /üîΩrang gi bdag @26a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag kyang lta ba po ma yin te / rang gi bdag @26a * //
translated: In order to show the measure of that, he says, ‚ÄúIn that way, the inference is: ultimately, the self is not the seer,üîΩbecause it does not see itself,

original: nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na rna ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na rna ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the ear.‚Äù

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the property of the position, the property of the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na rna ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir lta ba po ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rna ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir lta ba po ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, because the ear does not see itself, it is not a seer.

original: bdag kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir lta ba po ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir lta ba po ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not see itself, the self is not a seer.

original: gal te pha rol po na re bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed pa srid pa des na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma
analyzed: gal te pha rol po na re bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed pa srid pa des na khyed kyi gtan tshigs kyi don rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma
translated: If the opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is possible that the self sees itself, so your reason, ‚Äòbecause it does not see itself,‚Äô is not established,‚Äù

original: khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis pha rol pos gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa'i dug gis bslad du yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis pha rol pos gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa'i dug gis bslad du yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the author of the commentary here says, ‚ÄúIt is not suitable to be polluted by the poison of doubt that the reason is not established.‚Äù

original: pha rol po bdag lta ba por smra bas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa dug dang 'dra ba des bslad cing spag tu yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: pha rol po bdag lta ba por smra bas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa dug dang 'dra ba des bslad cing spag tu yang mi rung ngo //
translated: The opponent, who asserts that the self is a seer, is polluted by the poison of doubt that the reason of the Madhyamaka is not established. It is not suitable to be polluted by that.

original: gal te pha rol po na re rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag tu bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes kyang bshad pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa'i dug gis bslad par bya'o zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung
analyzed: gal te pha rol po na re rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' dag tu bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes kyang bshad pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa'i dug gis bslad par bya'o zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung
translated: The opponent might say, Since it is explained in all the philosophies of ourselves and others that the self sees itself, you should be poisoned by the poison of doubt that your reason is not established.

original: ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The author of the commentary responds to this from within the opponent's position.

original: gang la lar bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes bshad pa des ni yid phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gis zhes bya ba'i sgrar sgro btags nas tha snyad du de skad bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang la lar bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes bshad pa des ni yid phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir bdag gis zhes bya ba'i sgrar sgro btags nas tha snyad du de skad bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, In some places it is explained that the self sees itself. This is said conventionally by imputing the term self to the mental faculty that benefits the self.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' gang la lar bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes bshad pa des ni yid ni bdag ces bya ba'i tha snyad la phan 'dogs shing de dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir yid kyis zhes bya ba'i don la
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' gang la lar bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes bshad pa des ni yid ni bdag ces bya ba'i tha snyad la phan 'dogs shing de dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir yid kyis zhes bya ba'i don la
translated: In some of our own and other schools, it is explained that the self sees itself.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúby the mind‚Äù is imputed with the term ‚Äúby the self‚Äù because the mind assists the convention of the term ‚Äúself‚Äù and is in accordance with it.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba'i sgrar sgro btags nas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes de skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba'i sgrar sgro btags nas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du bdag gis bdag la lta bar byed do zhes de skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: In conventional terms, it is said, ‚ÄúThe self sees itself.‚Äù

original: don du na yid kyis bdag med par lta bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don du na yid kyis bdag med par lta bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In fact, it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind sees selflessness.‚Äù

original: 'dir rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúIt does not see itself‚Äù is stated in terms of the mode of the definition.

original: gtan tshigs dngos po nyid dang shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am @26b sgra la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dngos po nyid dang shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag gi phyir rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am @26b sgra la sogs pa bzhin no zhe'am /
translated: and because of being a thing, an object of knowledge, an expression, and so on, like the ear and so on, or like sound and so on, or like the self itself.

original: bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs dang dpe'i rjes su dpag pa dag kyang rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs dang dpe'i rjes su dpag pa dag kyang rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na // de ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: And the inferences based on examples and reasons should be extensively stated.üîΩThe view does not view itself.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: It does not view itself.

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: How could it view others?

original: zhes bya bas lta ba po bdag gzugs lta bar mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: zhes bya bas lta ba po bdag gzugs lta bar mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The reason the self does not view form is because it does not view itself. This is merely an illustration because it is stated in terms of the mode of the term ‚Äúcharacteristic.‚Äù

original: phyogs de'i gtan tshigs ni dngos po nyid dang shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin la /
analyzed: phyogs de'i gtan tshigs ni dngos po nyid dang shes bya nyid dang brjod par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin la /
translated: The reason in that context is also such things as being an entity, being an object of knowledge, and being expressible.üîΩAnd the example is also such things as the ear, sound, and the self of the self.

original: dpe yang rna ba dang sgra dang bdag gi bdag nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin pas gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe yang rna ba dang sgra dang bdag gi bdag nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin pas gtan tshigs dang dpe de dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, those reasons and examples should be extensively stated in the inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa rgyas pa de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rgyas pa de dag nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: In order to teach just those extensive inferences, he says, ‚ÄúThus, ultimately, the self does not see form because of being an entity, like, for example, the ear, etc.

original: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, ultimately, the self does not see form because of being an object of knowledge, like, for example, sound, etc.

original: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed de brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba dag smras te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately the self does not see form because it is expressible, like the self of the self.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: rjes su dpag pa de dag gis ni lta ba po bdag gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de dag gis ni lta ba po bdag gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa nyid bstan to //
translated: These inferences demonstrate that the self, as the seer, does not see form.

original: gzugs la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gzugs lta ba po bdag gi yul ma yin par ston te /üîΩdon dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gzugs lta ba po bdag gi yul ma yin par ston te / don dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe same should be understood in terms of form‚Äù shows that form is not the object of the self, the seer.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du don dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no // de bzhin du don dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, form is not the object of the self because it is a thing, like the ear and so on.

original: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, ultimately form is not the object of the self because it is an object of knowledge, like sound and so on.

original: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par gzugs bdag gi yul ma yin te /
translated: So too, form is not the object of the self ultimately because it is an object of expression, like, for example, the self of the self.

original: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te rjes su dpag pa de dag gis ni gzugs lta ba po'i bdag gi yul @27a * //üîΩma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar te rjes su dpag pa de dag gis ni gzugs lta ba po'i bdag gi yul @27a * // ma yin par bstan to //
translated: These inferences demonstrate that form is not the object of the self that is the seer.

original: gal te pha rol po na re dbu ma pa la don dam par tha snyad med pa'i phyir dang rang la ma grub pa'i bdag phyogs su byas pas phyogs ma grub pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma
analyzed: gal te pha rol po na re dbu ma pa la don dam par tha snyad med pa'i phyir dang rang la ma grub pa'i bdag phyogs su byas pas phyogs ma grub pa'i phyir dang brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma
translated: If the opponent says that the Madhyamaka has no conventions ultimately, that the subject is unestablished for the Madhyamaka because the self is not established for the Madhyamaka, and that the reason is unestablished because it is an object of expression,

original: grub pa'i phyir dang // bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes brjod pa'i dpe'i chos can yang ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos dang dpe ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang med de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir dang // bdag gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes brjod pa'i dpe'i chos can yang ma grub pa'i phyir dbu ma pa'i dam bcas pa dang / phyogs dang phyogs kyi chos dang dpe ma grub pa'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon yang med de tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas
translated: Because it is established, and because the exemplification in the example expressed as ‚Äúlike the self of self‚Äù is also established.üîΩThe author of the commentary, in response to the above, which is the opponent‚Äôs position that is drawn out from within, says that the faults of the thesis and so on do not exist becauseüîΩit is made in terms of conventional truth,

original: pa'i phyir dang / spyis khas blangs pa'i bdag phyogs su byas pa'i phyir dang / de'i chos bstan pa'i phyir dang / dpe nyid du yang de nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / spyis khas blangs pa'i bdag phyogs su byas pa'i phyir dang / de'i chos bstan pa'i phyir dang / dpe nyid du yang de nye bar gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because the self that is accepted in general is taken as the subject, because its attributes are taught, and because it is posited as an example.

original: de ltar na don dam par sta re la sogs pa ma grub pas dpe yang med pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te sngar pha rol pos phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par sta re la sogs pa ma grub pas dpe yang med pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te sngar pha rol pos phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag
translated: Thus, since the axe and so on are not established ultimately, the example is also nonexistent. Therefore, it is not the case that the established is being established. This is the conclusion and the result of valid knowledge.

original: pa'i skabs su dper na gcod pa pos sta res gcad par bya ba shing gcod par byed kyi sta re nyid kyis gcod par mi byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: pa'i skabs su dper na gcod pa pos sta res gcad par bya ba shing gcod par byed kyi sta re nyid kyis gcod par mi byed pa bzhin te /
translated: Previously, when the opponent set forth the objection, he said, ‚ÄúFor example, the wood to be cut is cut by the axe of the cutter, but the axe itself is not cut by the axe.

original: des na mig gis lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes smras pa ste /
analyzed: des na mig gis lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba de ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes smras pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the eye does not see.‚Äù

original: de ltar rigs pas dpyad na don dam par gcod pa po bdag dang gcod pa'i byed pa sta re dang gcad par bya ba shing ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po sum cu pa /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas dpyad na don dam par gcod pa po bdag dang gcod pa'i byed pa sta re dang gcad par bya ba shing ma grub pas khyed kyi dpe med pa'i phyir kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po sum cu pa /
translated: Thus, when analyzed with reasoning, since the cutter, the axe, and the wood to be cut are not established ultimately, your example does not exist. Therefore, it is not the case that the established is being established.

original: 'dir kha cig na re lta ba po lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dag rigs pa can gyi
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re lta ba po lta bar mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dag rigs pa can gyi
translated: Here, some say: ‚ÄúThe statement ‚ÄòThe seer does not see‚Äô is a fault of your thesis because it deprecates that very object.‚ÄùüîΩThis is a sophistry of the proponents of the self, who are logicians.

original: sgyu thabs kyis dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa snga ma de rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: sgyu thabs kyis dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa snga ma de rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar sgrub pa yin te /
translated: It proves that the previous proof of the Madhyamaka is contradictory to your own words.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig na re kho bo'i ma mo gsham yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig na re kho bo'i ma mo gsham yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig de nyid kyis don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if someone says, ‚ÄúMy mother is barren,‚Äù the statement itself deprecates that very object.

original: khyed dbu ma pas lta ba po lta bar mi byed do zhes smras pa'i tshig de nyid kyis kyang don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi dam @27b bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas lta ba po lta bar mi byed do zhes smras pa'i tshig de nyid kyis kyang don de la skur pa btab pa'i phyir rang gi dam @27b bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, the statement ‚ÄúThe seer does not see‚Äù deprecates that very object.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir yang phyir bklags mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir yang phyir bklags mi dgos so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúSince it has already been answered here by saying ‚Äòdependent origination is non-arisen,‚Äô it is unnecessary to repeat it.‚Äù

original: ji ltar kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung la don dam par skye ba med do zhes bshad pa nyid kyis kun rdzob tu lta ba po zhes bya ba don dam par lta bar mi byed par lan btab zin pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir yang phyirüîΩbklags shing lan gdab mi dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung la don dam par skye ba med do zhes bshad pa nyid kyis kun rdzob tu lta ba po zhes bya ba don dam par lta bar mi byed par lan btab zin pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir yang phyir bklags shing lan gdab mi dgos so //
translated: Since it has already been answered by the explanation that dependent origination is arisen conventionally and is non-arisen ultimately, the one who sees conventionally does not see ultimately, there is no fault. Therefore it is unnecessary to repeat it.üîΩMoreover, in this regard, the two analyses ‚ÄúIs the seer the entity of the seer or is the seer not the entity of the seer?‚Äù

original: gzhan yang 'di la lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam 'on te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i brtag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis ni grangs can dag lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam 'on te lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i brtag pa rnam pa gnyis kyis ni grangs can dag lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin par
translated: are analyses that the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert. The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the seer is the entity of the seer.

original: des lta bar byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: des lta bar byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: It is the seer.

original: de ni mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: This is not tenable. Why?

original: de la gal te de'i lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir lta ba med par yang lta ba por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal te de'i lta ba po de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir lta ba med par yang lta ba por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If the seer were the entity of the seer, since the entity is not fabricated, it would be the seer even without seeing.

original: gal te grangs can dag gi lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ci la yang mi ltos pa de bzhin du lta ba
analyzed: gal te grangs can dag gi lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid yin gyi gzhan ci la yang mi ltos pa de bzhin du lta ba
translated: If the entity of the seer of SƒÅ·πÉkhya were the seer, since the entity is not fabricated, just as the heat of fire is hot by its very nature and does not depend on anything else,

original: po yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis lta ba po nyid yin gyi gzhan ci la yang mi ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: po yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis lta ba po nyid yin gyi gzhan ci la yang mi ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: so too the seer would be the seer by its very nature and would not depend on anything else.

original: de lta na lta ba med par yang lta ba por 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na lta ba med par yang lta ba por 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //
translated: In that case, it would be the seer even without seeing, but that is untenable.

original: ci ste gcod pa po de la sta re med na gcod pa po nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du de yang lta ba ma spangs na lta ba po nyid du blta bar bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po na re 'di
analyzed: ci ste gcod pa po de la sta re med na gcod pa po nyid du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du de yang lta ba ma spangs na lta ba po nyid du blta bar bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci ste pha rol po na re 'di
translated: So too, if seeing does not exist, it is untenable that he is a seer.üîΩIf you say: ‚ÄúBut if the axe does not exist, it is untenable that he is an axe wielder.

original: @28a * // skad ces dper na gcod pa po lhas byin ni gcod pa po'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang de la gcod pa'i byed pa sta re med na gcod pa po nyid du mi 'thad kyi sta re yod na gcod pa po nyid du 'thad pa de bzhin
analyzed: @28a * // skad ces dper na gcod pa po lhas byin ni gcod pa po'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang de la gcod pa'i byed pa sta re med na gcod pa po nyid du mi 'thad kyi sta re yod na gcod pa po nyid du 'thad pa de bzhin
translated: But if the axe exists, it is tenable that he is an axe wielder.üîΩSo too, if the seer, the self, exists, it is tenable that he is a seer.

original: du lta ba po bdag de yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang lta ba'i byed pa mig spangs shing med na lta ba po nyid du mi 'thad kyi mig ma spangs shing yod na lta ba po nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes zer na'o
analyzed: du lta ba po bdag de yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang lta ba'i byed pa mig spangs shing med na lta ba po nyid du mi 'thad kyi mig ma spangs shing yod na lta ba po nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes zer na'o
translated: But if seeing does not exist, it is untenable that he is a seer.‚Äù

original: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na bdag lta ba po nyid ni tha snyad pa yin te /
analyzed: // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de lta na bdag lta ba po nyid ni tha snyad pa yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here says, ‚ÄúIn that case, the self that is the seer is conventional.‚Äù

original: gcod pa po tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gcod pa po tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the cutter is conventional.üîΩIf the cutter were ultimate, it would have to be independent of the axe. But because it is dependent, it is conventional.

original: gal te gcod pa po de don dam pa yin na sta re la mi ltos par 'gyur ba'i rigs na ltos pas de tha snyad pa yin pa bzhin du bdag lta ba po de yang don dam pa yin na lta ba la mi ltos par 'gyur ba'i rigs
analyzed: gal te gcod pa po de don dam pa yin na sta re la mi ltos par 'gyur ba'i rigs na ltos pas de tha snyad pa yin pa bzhin du bdag lta ba po de yang don dam pa yin na lta ba la mi ltos par 'gyur ba'i rigs
translated: Similarly, if the self that is the seer were ultimate, it would have to be independent of seeing.

original: na ltos pas de yang tha snyad pa yin no //
analyzed: na ltos pas de yang tha snyad pa yin no //
translated: But because it is dependent, it is conventional.

original: de ltar rtog na /üîΩma spangs lta po yod min te //
analyzed: de ltar rtog na / ma spangs lta po yod min te //
translated: If you think in that way,üîΩThe seer would not exist without abandoning seeing.üîΩThe remainder of the sentence is ‚Äúbecause if seeing is not abandoned, it is accepted that the seer exists.‚Äù

original: lta ba ma spangs na de lta ba po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba la ltos pa de ltar rtog na lta ba po don dam pa ba ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med de
analyzed: lta ba ma spangs na de lta ba po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba la ltos pa de ltar rtog na lta ba po don dam pa ba ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa med de
translated: If you think in that way, that is, that the seer is dependent on seeing, the ultimate seer does not exist inherently.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyod kyis lta ba ma spangs shing yod na de lta ba po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyod kyis lta ba ma spangs shing yod na de lta ba po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you assert that the seer exists without abandoning seeing, then seeing would be the seer.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis lta ba po nyid lta ba la ltos shing brten pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba po yin par ma smras pa'i phyir lta ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis lta ba po nyid lta ba la ltos shing brten pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba po yin par ma smras pa'i phyir lta ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin no //
translated: In that case, the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe seer does not exist‚Äù is that you assert that the seer depends on and relies on seeing, but you do not assert that the seer exists inherently.

original: 'di na lta ba dang ldan pa'i sngon rol dang lta ba dang bral ba'i 'og na lta ba med pas lta ba med na blta bar bya ba la lta ba yang med pa'i phyir lta ba po nyid du mi 'thad pas lta ba po med de /
analyzed: 'di na lta ba dang ldan pa'i sngon rol dang lta ba dang bral ba'i 'og na lta ba med pas lta ba med na blta bar bya ba la lta ba yang med pa'i phyir lta ba po nyid du mi 'thad pas lta ba po med de /
translated: Here, prior to possessing seeing and after being devoid of seeing, since there is no seeing, seeing does not exist in the seer. Therefore it is untenable that the seer exists.

original: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni lta ba po'i bdag lta ba la ltos pa de la ji srid du lta ba dang ldan pa'i sngon rol mi ldan pa'i dus dang / gang gi tshe lta ba dang bral ba'i 'og rol gyi dus de'i tshe na lta ba med do //
analyzed: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba ni lta ba po'i bdag lta ba la ltos pa de la ji srid du lta ba dang ldan pa'i sngon rol mi ldan pa'i dus dang / gang gi tshe lta ba dang bral ba'i 'og rol gyi dus de'i tshe na lta ba med do //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe self is not the seer‚Äù is that the self, as the seer, does not exist prior to seeing, that is, prior to the time when it possesses seeing, and that it does not exist after seeing, that is, after the time when it is devoid of seeing.

original: lta ba med na blta bar bya ba'i dmigs pas gzugs la lta ba yang med pa'i phyir lta ba po'i bdag yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pas lta ba po med de /
analyzed: lta ba med na blta bar bya ba'i dmigs pas gzugs la lta ba yang med pa'i phyir lta ba po'i bdag yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pas lta ba po med de /
translated: Since there is no seeing, there is no seeing of form, that is, no object of seeing. Therefore, since it is untenable that the self exists as the seer, the seer does not exist.

original: bdag lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: bdag lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe self is not the seer‚Äù is that the self is not the seer by its very essence.

original: 'on kyang yang pha rol po dag na re dper na me ni sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang bud shing la ma ltos par sreg par mi byed kyi de la ltos nas sreg par byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang @28b lta ba po'i ngo
analyzed: 'on kyang yang pha rol po dag na re dper na me ni sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang bud shing la ma ltos par sreg par mi byed kyi de la ltos nas sreg par byed pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang @28b lta ba po'i ngo
translated: However, the opponent might say that, for example, fire, although it has the essence of burning, does not burn without depending on fuel, but rather burns in dependence on it. In the same way, the seer also does not see without depending on seeing.

original: bo nyid yin yang lta ba la ma ltos par lta bar mi byed kyi de la ltos nas lta bar byed do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis me bzhin du yang de mi 'grub ste
analyzed: bo nyid yin yang lta ba la ma ltos par lta bar mi byed kyi de la ltos nas lta bar byed do zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis me bzhin du yang de mi 'grub ste
translated: The response is that just like fire, it is not established.

original: / bud shing med par me mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: / bud shing med par me mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because fire is not established without fuel.

original: gang gi phyir me yang bud shing la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa med pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang lta ba la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du grub paüîΩmed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir me yang bud shing la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis sreg pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa med pa de bzhin du lta ba po yang lta ba la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du grub paüîΩmed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fire is not established by its own intrinsic reality without depending on fuel, in the same way, the seer is not established by its own intrinsic reality as a seer without depending on seeing.

original: yang na gal te lta ba yod na lta ba po yin no zhe na yang grangs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i lta ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma de nyid kyis rnam grangs bshad pa
analyzed: yang na gal te lta ba yod na lta ba po yin no zhe na yang grangs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i lta ba po med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma de nyid kyis rnam grangs bshad pa
translated: Or if you think that if seeing exists, then the seer exists, then the remainder of the sentence is that the seer imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not exist.

original: du ma rnam par brtag pa ste /
analyzed: du ma rnam par brtag pa ste /
translated: This is an explanation of the previous sentence.

original: yang na gal te lta ba'i byed pa yod na lta ba po yin no zhes bya bar brtags na yang grangs can dag gis skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba lta bur yongs su brtags pa'i lta ba po med do
analyzed: yang na gal te lta ba'i byed pa yod na lta ba po yin no zhes bya bar brtags na yang grangs can dag gis skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ni shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba lta bur yongs su brtags pa'i lta ba po med do
translated: Or if you think that if the action of seeing exists, then the seer exists, then the remainder of the sentence is that the seer imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the sentence.

original: grangs can dag ni lta ba po ngo bo nyid kyis grub par 'dod de gal te lta ba po ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa yin na lta ba med par yang ngo bo nyid kyis 'grub pa'i rigs na ni mi 'grub pas grangs can dag gis yongs su

translated: The so-called agent is the collection of primary elements and derivative form, such as the eye and form, and so on, that possess those conditions. It is merely designated as the seer.

translated: But the seer imputed by other snow-mountains is not found.üîΩIf the seer imputed by others existed, it would be like the form that is not observed in the continuum of a blind person.

original: 'on kyang phyogs su lhung ba'i dbang du byas te lhas byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rkyen de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags pa de las gzhan pa grangs can dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i lta ba po ngo

translated: If the seer imputed by others does not exist in that way, still, from the perspective of partiality, the collection called Devadatta, which possesses those conditions, such as the eye and form, is designated as the seer. The seer imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is not found in that collection.

original: bo nyid kyis yod pa nyid gcig yod du zin na yang long ba'i rgyud la bdag gi dngos pos gzugs dmigs pa med pa'i phyir lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid med do //

translated: Even if the eye itself existed, since form is not observed in the continuum of a blind person due to the absence of the eye, the seer does not exist.

original: gal te 'dir pha rol po dag na re 'di la lta ba po med na khyed la lta ba po zhes bya ba byed pa po'i tha snyad ji ltar yod par 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed
