translated: Here, the opponent may say, ‚ÄúIf there is no seer here, how could the convention ‚Äòseer‚Äô exist for you?‚Äù The response to this is drawn from the root text.

original: pa nyid kyis rgyu dag la byed pa por tha snyad gdags te mar me bzhin du rigs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis rgyu dag la byed pa por tha snyad gdags te mar me bzhin du rigs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúIt is reasonable to impute the convention of agent to causes, just as in the case of a lamp.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na byed pa po zhes brjod pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa dag la byed pa po zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na byed pa po zhes brjod pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa dag la byed pa po zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags te /
translated: In the world, when one says ‚Äúagent,‚Äù the convention ‚Äúagent‚Äù is imputed to the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: dper na mar me snang ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de la snang bar byed pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa bzhin du byed pa po nyid med kyang byed pa'i rgyu dag la byed pa por tha snyad gdags pa rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me snang ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de la snang bar byed pa zhes tha snyad gdags pa bzhin du byed pa po nyid med kyang byed pa'i rgyu dag la byed pa por tha snyad gdags pa rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: For example, since a lamp is the active cause of illumination, it is designated as the illuminator.

original: gal te byed pa po ni shes pa yod pa nyid yin pas mar me shes pa med pa nyid ni de'i dper mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po ni shes pa yod pa nyid yin pas mar me shes pa med pa nyid ni de'i dper mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the lamp is not a suitable example because it is not a conscious being,

original: de'i lan du dper na mar me la sems pa med kyang snang ba'i byed pa'i yin pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba bzhin te zhes zer ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du dper na mar me la sems pa med kyang snang ba'i byed pa'i yin pa'i phyir snang bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba bzhin te zhes zer ba smras te /
translated: then the response is that, for example, although the lamp is not conscious, it is the active cause of illumination, so it is called the illuminator.üîΩFor example, although the lamp is conscious, worldly people say that it is the illuminator because it is the active cause of illumination.

original: dper na mar me shes pa nyid yin yang snang ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag na re @29b snang bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs
analyzed: dper na mar me shes pa nyid yin yang snang ba'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag na re @29b snang bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs
translated: In the same way, the collection of the eye, form, and so on, the elements and the derivative of the elements, is the active cause of seeing, so it is called the seer.

original: dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi gzugs dmigs pa'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag na re lta bar byed pa yin no zhes zer bas ci'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa byed pa po nyidüîΩdu mi brjod /
analyzed: dag kyang shes pa yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi gzugs dmigs pa'i byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa dag na re lta bar byed pa yin no zhes zer bas ci'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa byed pa po nyid du mi brjod /
translated: Why don‚Äôt you say that the nonexistence of the seer is the agent?üîΩTherefore, it is said that it does not exist even conventionally.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang de med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang la yang byed pa po nyid du brjod pa de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa de med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du yang de med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang la yang byed pa po nyid du brjod pa de'i phyir kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa de med de /
translated: Since the seer is not the agent of any cause, therefore, even in conventional terms, the seer does not exist as an entity.

original: de ltar re zhig lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid gzugs la lta bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid gzugs la lta bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, first, it is untenable that the seer sees form.

original: ci ste lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: But if the seer does not see,

original: ji ltar bye brag pa dag na re bzhi'i sbyor ba las gzugs shes pa skyes pa na lta bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya bas ni gal te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na de yang mi rung bar ston to //üîΩde la lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rkyen rnams la ltos nas lta ba po nyid du 'dod pa ste de yang bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las gang gi tshe bdag yul la longs spyod
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag pa dag na re bzhi'i sbyor ba las gzugs shes pa skyes pa na lta bar byed do zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe na zhes bya bas ni gal te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na de yang mi rung bar ston to // de la lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rkyen rnams la ltos nas lta ba po nyid du 'dod pa ste de yang bye brag pa dag gi gzhung las gang gi tshe bdag yul la longs spyod
translated: If you accept the latter, then that also is unacceptable.

original: par 'dod pa de'i tshe na phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi dbang gis bdag de yid dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: par 'dod pa de'i tshe na phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don gyi dbang gis bdag de yid dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnot the nature of the seer‚Äù means that the seer is asserted to depend on conditions such as the eye and form. The Vai≈õe·π£ika text says, ‚ÄúWhen the self wishes to enjoy an object, it connects the self with the mind through the meaning of the word contact.

original: de nas yid kyi dbang po rnams gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas yid kyi dbang po rnams gtong bar byed do //
translated: Then it sends out the sense faculties.

original: de nas dbang po rnams kyis yul rnams la longs spyod par byed pas de ltar bdag dang yid dang dbang po dang yul bzhi'i sbyor ba las dmigs pa'i shes pa skyes pa na lta ba po de gzugs la lta bar byed pas rkyen gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir
analyzed: de nas dbang po rnams kyis yul rnams la longs spyod par byed pas de ltar bdag dang yid dang dbang po dang yul bzhi'i sbyor ba las dmigs pa'i shes pa skyes pa na lta ba po de gzugs la lta bar byed pas rkyen gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir
translated: Then the sense faculties enjoy objects. Thus, when the consciousness that observes form arises from the union of the four‚Äîthe self, the mental faculty, the sense faculty, and the object‚Äîthe seer sees form.

original: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lta bar byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lta bar byed do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Since it depends on other conditions, it is not the seer by itself.

original: de yang mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: This is also untenable. Why?üîΩBecause the error just mentioned still exists. It is untenable to impute the seer to that which is not renowned as the seer.

original: de lta na yang skyon de nyid yod de ma grags pa'i yod pa nyid la der brtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te de lta na yang sngar 'di la gzugs dmigs shing lta bar byed pas lta ba po'i zhes rjes su dpag pa
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon de nyid yod de ma grags pa'i yod pa nyid la der brtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te de lta na yang sngar 'di la gzugs dmigs shing lta bar byed pas lta ba po'i zhes rjes su dpag pa
translated: Since it is not renowned as the seer, it is untenable to impute the seer to that which is not renowned as the seer.

original: yin na gzugs dmigs pa de yang mig dang gzugs dang sna ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag yod na yin pas de'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags kyi de las gzhan ni med
analyzed: yin na gzugs dmigs pa de yang mig dang gzugs dang sna ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag yod na yin pas de'i phyir lhas byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags kyi de las gzhan ni med
translated: If it did, then seeing would exist if form, the eye, space, mental activity, and so on existed. Therefore, the designation ‚Äúthe seer‚Äù is imputed to the collection of the eye, form, and so on, which is called ‚ÄúDevadatta.‚Äù

original: do zhes ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de nyid yod de /
analyzed: do zhes ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de nyid yod de /
translated: The error that has been explained would exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lhas byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen @30a * //
analyzed: lhas byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen @30a * //
translated: The designation ‚Äúthe seer‚Äù is imputed to the collection of the eye, form, and so on, which is called ‚ÄúDevadatta.‚Äù

original: de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags pa de las gzhan pa bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i bdag lta ba po zhig yod do zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' gzhan la ma grags
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags pa de las gzhan pa bye brag pa dag gis yongs su brtags pa lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i bdag lta ba po zhig yod do zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' gzhan la ma grags
translated: The existence of a seer that is different from that, which is not the entity of the seer imputed by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, and which is not renowned in other philosophical systems, is untenable.

original: pa'i yod pa nyid de la lta ba po zhes bya ba der brtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i yod pa nyid de la lta ba po zhes bya ba der brtag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable to impute the name ‚Äúseer‚Äù to that existence.

original: des na lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de don dam par gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de don dam par gzugs la lta bar byed do zhes bya ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the seer, which is not the nature of form, ultimately sees form.

original: thun mong du khas blangs nas de yod do zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong du khas blangs nas de yod do zhe na /
translated: If you accept this in common, then it exists.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni gal te bye brag pa dag 'di skad ces 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du lta ba po yod par grags pa der spyir thun mong du khas blangs nas lta ba dang gzugs la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang lta ba po bdag
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni gal te bye brag pa dag 'di skad ces 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du lta ba po yod par grags pa der spyir thun mong du khas blangs nas lta ba dang gzugs la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang lta ba po bdag
translated: ‚Äú Again‚Äù means that if the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say, ‚ÄúThe seer is renowned to exist in everyday life,‚Äù then in general, accepting this in common, the self would be the seer without depending on seeing and form, etc.

original: de yod do zhes zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de yod do zhes zer na de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt exists,‚Äù then in response to that, the author of the commentary explains this:

original: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even if seeing were to cease, it would exist.

original: zhes bya ba smras te lta ba dang gzugs la sogs pa spangs shing de dag la ma ltos na yang lta ba po bdag med do zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te lta ba dang gzugs la sogs pa spangs shing de dag la ma ltos na yang lta ba po bdag med do zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: This shows that even if seeing and form, etc., were to cease and not depend on them, the self would not be the seer.

original: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What?

original: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even if seeing were to cease, it would exist.

original: zhes smras pa de'i tshig gi don ci zhig ce na zhes 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa de'i tshig gi don ci zhig ce na zhes 'dri ba yin no //
translated: What is the meaning of the words of that statement?

original: de'i lan du /üîΩlta po yod min te zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te zhes bya ba smras te tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po las /
analyzed: de'i lan du / lta po yod min te zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te zhes bya ba smras te tshig le'ur byas pa'i rtsa ba dang po las /
translated: In response, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe context is ‚Äòthe seer does not exist.‚Äô‚Äù

original: ma spangs lta po yod min te //
analyzed: ma spangs lta po yod min te //
translated: The context of the statement in the root text, ‚ÄúThe seer does not exist,‚Äù

original: zhes smos pa'i skabs nas lta po yod min te zhes bshad pa de nyid kyi skabs yin te /
analyzed: zhes smos pa'i skabs nas lta po yod min te zhes bshad pa de nyid kyi skabs yin te /
translated: is the context of the statement, ‚ÄúThe seer does not exist without abandoning seeing.‚Äù

original: ji ltar lta ba ma spangs kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba spangs par gyur kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar lta ba ma spangs kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du lta ba spangs par gyur kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the seer does not exist without abandoning seeing, so the seer does not exist even when seeing has been abandoned.üîΩWhy does the seer not exist even when seeing has been abandoned?

original: ci'i phyir lta ba spangs par gyur kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin zhe na de'i phyir lta ba'i nus pa spangs par gyur pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lta ba spangs par gyur kyang lta ba po yod pa ma yin zhe na de'i phyir lta ba'i nus pa spangs par gyur pa de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause the seer has the nature of the abandonment of the capacity for seeing.‚Äù

original: lta ba'i nus pa spangs shing med par gyur na de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i nus pa spangs shing med par gyur na de lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the seer were to abandon or lose the capacity to see, then it would not be the entity of the seer.

original: de'i phyir don dam par de gzugs la lta bar byed pa mi 'thad de mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par de gzugs la lta bar byed pa mi 'thad de mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bas de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, it is untenable that it sees form because it is different from the eye, like a pot. This teaches the inference.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na bum pa ni mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta @30b bar byed par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i bdag de yang mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta bar byed par mi 'thad do
analyzed: dper na bum pa ni mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta @30b bar byed par mi 'thad pa de bzhin du lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i bdag de yang mig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta bar byed par mi 'thad do
translated: For example, just as it is untenable that a pot sees form because it is different from the eye, so it is untenable that the self, which is not the entity of the seer, sees form because it is different from the eye.

original: // de ltar phyogs gnyi gar yang lta ba po nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: // de ltar phyogs gnyi gar yang lta ba po nyid ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyi ga'i mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Thus, in both cases, the seer itself is not established. This is the conclusion of both positions and the result of valid cognition.

original: grangs can dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid lta bar byed pa ma grub la /
analyzed: grangs can dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid lta bar byed pa ma grub la /
translated: In the SƒÅ·πÉkhya position, the seer‚Äôs own nature as a seer is not established.

original: bye brag pa byed pa dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lta bar byed pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: bye brag pa byed pa dag gi phyogs la yang lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lta bar byed pa ma grub bo //
translated: In the Vai≈õe·π£ika position of the creator, the nonseer‚Äôs own nature as a seer is not established.

original: yang na lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags na yang /
analyzed: yang na lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags na yang /
translated: Moreover, if the seer is imagined to be the seer‚Äôs own nature,

original: ma spangs lta po yod min te //
analyzed: ma spangs lta po yod min te //
translated: The seer does not exist without seeing.

original: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo //üîΩlta ba dang bcas sam lta ba med kyang rung ste lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni yang na bdag lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags na yang de lta ba dang ldan na yang gzugs
analyzed: lta ba spangs par gyur kyang ngo // lta ba dang bcas sam lta ba med kyang rung ste lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni yang na bdag lta ba po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags na yang de lta ba dang ldan na yang gzugs
translated: Even if seeing has ceased,üîΩwhether he has seeing or does not have seeing, the seer does not exist as the seer‚Äôs own nature.üîΩIf the self is imagined to be the seer‚Äôs own nature, then if he has seeing, he does not see form.

original: la lta bar mi byed la /
analyzed: la lta bar mi byed la /
translated: If he does not have seeing, he does not see form.

original: lta ba dang mi ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lta ba dang mi ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The s≈´tra‚Äôs author intended to teach that if the seer does not possess seeing, then he does not see form.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te re zhig lta ba po de mig yod na lta ba byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na de ltar na gzugs dmigs pa 'grub pa ni mig yod na yod pa'i phyir me yod na sreg pa nyid bzhin pas ltaüîΩba po nyid tha snyad pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gal te re zhig lta ba po de mig yod na lta ba byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod na de ltar na gzugs dmigs pa 'grub pa ni mig yod na yod pa'i phyir me yod na sreg pa nyid bzhin pas lta ba po nyid tha snyad pa ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, if you assert that the seer sees form when the eye exists, then in that case, since the observation of form is established when the eye exists, the seer is designated as the seer, just as burning is designated as the fire when it exists.

original: mig nyid yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: mig nyid yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: The eye itself is asserted to be the seer.

original: ci ste lta ba med kyang lta ba po yin no zhes byar ni long ba'i rgyud la gzugs dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de lta ba po nyid yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci ste lta ba med kyang lta ba po yin no zhes byar ni long ba'i rgyud la gzugs dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de lta ba po nyid yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if you say that the seer is the seer even without seeing, then it is not logical that the seer is the seer in the continuum of a blind person because the observation of form does not exist.

original: bdag de lta ba dang ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed la lta ba dang mi ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag de lta ba dang ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed la lta ba dang mi ldan na yang gzugs la lta bar mi byed do zhes bya bar go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Even though the self possesses seeing, it does not see form, and even though it does not possess seeing, it does not see form.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas na lta ba smra ba dag lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid kyi sgo nas lta ba po yod par sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas na lta ba smra ba dag lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid kyi sgo nas lta ba po yod par sgrub pa ston to //
translated: Here, the statement ‚ÄúHere, someone says‚Äù and so on teaches that the proponents of seeing argue that the seer exists by virtue of the existence of the action of seeing.

original: lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid ni lta ba po yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid ni lta ba po yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: The existence of the action of seeing is to be understood as the seer.

original: de la byed pa dang las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la byed pa dang las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the subject, the probandum, and the probative property are to be applied in order.

original: 'di na gang la chags par bya ba med pa de ni byed pa dang las med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs @31a * //
analyzed: 'di na gang la chags par bya ba med pa de ni byed pa dang las med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs @31a * //
translated: Here, someone says: That which does not have an object of attachment does not have an action and an agent, like a sky flower.

original: kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: kyi dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar class.

original: lta ba po de la ni byed pa lta ba dang las blta bar bya ba yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba po de la ni byed pa lta ba dang las blta bar bya ba yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause for that seer, there is seeing as the act of seeing and the seen as the object of seeing‚Äù is the application of the analogy.

original: de'i phyir lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid ni lta ba po yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya bar ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba'i bya ba yod pa nyid ni lta ba po yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya bar ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe seer should be understood to exist because the act of seeing exists‚Äù is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa don dam par lta ba rnam pa thams cad bkag pa'i phyir lta ba med na lta ba po yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa don dam par lta ba rnam pa thams cad bkag pa'i phyir lta ba med na lta ba po yang mi 'thad de /
translated: In response to this statement, the author of the commentary explains here: ‚ÄúIf seeing does not exist, the seer is untenable because seeing is completely refuted in an ultimate sense.

original: lta po med na khyed kyi ni //
analyzed: lta po med na khyed kyi ni //
translated: If there is no seer,

original: blta bya lta ba ga la yod //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba ga la yod //
translated: how could there be the seen and seeing?

original: gang gis kyang lta bar mi byed pa la blta bar bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / 'dis lta bar byed pa'i lta ba po med pa kho na'i phyir byed pa dang yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩ'di skad bstan te khyed ni blta bar bya ba lta ba yod pas lta ba po nyid sgrub par byed na kho bos don dam par lta ba de yang yul phrad pa 'dzin pa dang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad
analyzed: gang gis kyang lta bar mi byed pa la blta bar bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / 'dis lta bar byed pa'i lta ba po med pa kho na'i phyir byed pa dang yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so // 'di skad bstan te khyed ni blta bar bya ba lta ba yod pas lta ba po nyid sgrub par byed na kho bos don dam par lta ba de yang yul phrad pa 'dzin pa dang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad
translated: Because it is illogical that that which is not seen by anything is the object seen, and because it is illogical that that which is the seer is the agent, since the seer does not exist at all.

original: kyis lta bar byed pa ma yin pa dang gzugs kyang de'i gzung ba ma yin par bkag pa'i phyir de ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med pa'i phyir lta ba po yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: kyis lta bar byed pa ma yin pa dang gzugs kyang de'i gzung ba ma yin par bkag pa'i phyir de ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med pa'i phyir lta ba po yang mi 'thad do //
translated: This is explained as follows: You prove the seer exists because the object seen exists. But we refute that seeing exists in any way, such as by apprehending an object that makes contact with it or that does not make contact with it, and that form is not its object. Thus, because the object seen and seeing do not exist, the seer is also untenable.

original: lta ba po med na khyod kyi blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lta ba po med na khyod kyi blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang mi rigs so zhes bya bar mdo mdzad pas dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The s≈´tra intends to show that if there is no seer, then your seen and seeing are also untenable.

original: de na khyed kyi byed pa dang las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don dam ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de na khyed kyi byed pa dang las yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don dam ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, since your reason ‚Äúbecause the action and agent exist‚Äù is not established in the ultimate, or because its meaning is contradictory, this is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: don dam par sgrub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam par sgrub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid la kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the proof is in the ultimate, the meaning of the reason is not established. If the proof is in the conventional, the meaning is contradictory.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba dang g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdo sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba dang g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin
translated: Some of our own schools say that all formations arise from the power of other causes and conditions and are characterized by movement.

original: pas de dag la dbu ma pas byed pa med pa dang bdag med par bstan pa mi rigs kyi blta bar bya ba gzugs dang lta ba mig med do zhes zer ba ni mi rigs so zhes sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: pas de dag la dbu ma pas byed pa med pa dang bdag med par bstan pa mi rigs kyi blta bar bya ba gzugs dang lta ba mig med do zhes zer ba ni mi rigs so zhes sgrub pa ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct for the Madhyamika to teach that they are without activity and without self.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe object seen, form, and the seeing, the eye, do not exist‚Äù is not correct.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe eye does not see conditioned states that are powerless and devoid of movement due to other causes and conditions‚Äù and ‚ÄúThere is no self that is different from that which sees‚Äù is correct.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang dang g-yo ba med pa'i 'du byed dag la mig lta bar mi byed do zhes @31b bya ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bdag lta ba po med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rigs kyi zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba bdag med pa dang g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas byed
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang dang g-yo ba med pa'i 'du byed dag la mig lta bar mi byed do zhes @31b bya ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i bdag lta ba po med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rigs kyi zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba bdag med pa dang g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas byed
translated: All conditioned states arise from other causes and conditions, and they are characterized as being without self and devoid of movement.

original: pa med pa'i phyir de dag la dbu ma pas mig lta bar mi byed do zhes byed pa med pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i bdag lta ba po med do zhes bdag med par bstan pa ni rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩblta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag med do zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod de de dag gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni blta bar bya ba gzugs dang lta ba mig med
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir de dag la dbu ma pas mig lta bar mi byed do zhes byed pa med pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i bdag lta ba po med do zhes bdag med par bstan pa ni rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag med do zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod de de dag gi 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni blta bar bya ba gzugs dang lta ba mig med
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that the Madhyamika does not say that the eye sees, because it is without activity, and that he teaches the nonexistence of the self, because there is no self other than that which sees.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe object seen and seeing do not exist‚Äù is not accepted, because the four, such as consciousness, which are their effects, exist.

original: do zhes zer ba ni mi rigs so zhes sgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: do zhes zer ba ni mi rigs so zhes sgrub pa ston te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not correct to say that the object seen, form, and seeing, the eye, do not exist‚Äù teaches the proof.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The object seen, form, and seeing, the eye, are the subject, the property to be established, and the establishing property, respectively.

original: gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa zhes bya ba bdag med de dper na dmus long gi mig bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa zhes bya ba bdag med de dper na dmus long gi mig bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: That which does not exist has no effect, such as consciousness, contact, feeling, and craving, just like the eye of a man born blind. This is the example of the dissimilar class.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag la ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag la ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Since the object seen and seeing have the four effects, such as consciousness, this is the application of the analogy.

original: de'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag yod do zhes zer ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dag yod do zhes zer ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object seen and seeing exist. This is the conclusion and the effect of the valid cognition.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya ba dang lta ba rab tu ma grub par bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya ba dang lta ba rab tu ma grub par bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is shown that the object seen and seeing are not established in the manner presented,

original: blta bya lta ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: then because there is no object seen and no seeing,

original: rnam par shes la sogs pa bzhi //
analyzed: rnam par shes la sogs pa bzhi //
translated: The four such as consciousness do not exist

original: yod min rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩlung dang rigs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya ba dang lta ba ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / yul dang yul can nyid bkag pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang rab tu ma grub par bstan pa de'i tshe blta bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: yod min rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te / lung dang rigs pa sngar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis blta bar bya ba dang lta ba ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / yul dang yul can nyid bkag pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba dang rab tu ma grub par bstan pa de'i tshe blta bar bya ba dang /
translated: because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.

original: lta ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa ma yin te rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dgongs te /üîΩrgyu med na 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dag ma @32a * //
analyzed: lta ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi yod pa ma yin te rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dgongs te / rgyu med na 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro // de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dag ma @32a * //
translated: The four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.

original: grub pas ma grub na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang 'grub par mi rigs te dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grub pas ma grub na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang 'grub par mi rigs te dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.üîΩThe four such as consciousness do not exist because they lack conditions.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba de dag ma grub pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi ma grub bo //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba de dag ma grub pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi ma grub bo //
translated: Since the object seen and seeing are not established, the four such as consciousness are not established.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi ma grub na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang grub par mi rigs te /üîΩrgyu med na 'bras bu mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhi ma grub na blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang grub par mi rigs te / rgyu med na 'bras bu mi 'grub la /
translated: If the four such as consciousness are not established, it is not tenable that the object seen and seeing are established.üîΩBecause if the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist,

original: 'bras bu med na yang rgyu 'grub par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di skad bstan te khyod rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu la blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pas kho bos rgyu blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med pas 'bras bu rnam par shes
analyzed: 'bras bu med na yang rgyu 'grub par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // 'di skad bstan te khyod rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rgyu la blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pas kho bos rgyu blta bar bya ba dang lta ba med pas 'bras bu rnam par shes
translated: and if the effect does not exist, the cause does not exist.üîΩThis is explained as follows: You prove that the cause of the effect, such as consciousness, exists in terms of the object seen and seeing.

original: pa la sogs pa mi 'grub pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pas rgyu blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang mi 'grub par bstan to //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa mi 'grub pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pas rgyu blta bar bya ba dang lta ba yang mi 'grub par bstan to //
translated: I demonstrate that since the cause, the object seen and seeing, does not exist, the effect, such as consciousness, is not established, and since the effect, such as consciousness, does not exist, the cause, the object seen and seeing, is not established.

original: khyod kyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dmus long gi mig med pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba las bzlog na mig yod pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod par sgrub pa yangüîΩmi rung ste /
analyzed: khyod kyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dmus long gi mig med pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba las bzlog na mig yod pa la 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yod par sgrub pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: The opposite of that is, ‚ÄúJust as the existence of eyes is the cause of consciousness and so on, so too the existence of eyes is the cause of consciousness and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThat is illogical because it is a position that takes the object seen and the seer as the two things that are the opposite of each other.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta bdag phyogs su byas pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta bdag phyogs su byas pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang dag 'di skad ces /
translated: The meaning of that is, ‚ÄúConsciousness and so on do not exist as effects of the existence of eyes.‚Äù

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid de de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid de de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Those who say, ‚ÄúConsciousness and so on exist ultimately because their effects, such as appropriation, exist,‚Äù should be addressed as follows:

original: nye bar len pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: nye bar len pa la sogs pa //
translated: How could appropriation and so on

original: ci lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: exist?

original: de dag kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa gang dag don dam par rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa gang dag don dam par rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid de /
translated: and they are not established like consciousness and so on.üîΩThis is the intention.üîΩThis is explained to those who assert that ultimately consciousness and so on exist because their results such as appropriation exist.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med na de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag ci ltar yod par 'gyurüîΩzhes bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de dag la yang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med na de dag gi 'bras bu nye bar len pa la sogs pa dag ci ltar yod par 'gyur zhes bshad par bya ste /
translated: If consciousness and so on do not exist, how could their results such as appropriation exist?

original: nye bar len pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'grel pa mdzad pas dgongs @32b so ;
analyzed: nye bar len pa la sogs pa de dag kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'grel pa mdzad pas dgongs @32b so ;
translated: The Commentary explains that appropriation and so on are not established like consciousness and so on.

original: /'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu sred pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu len pa yang med de lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu sred pa zhes bya ba med pa'i phyir 'bras bu len pa yang med de lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The condition of craving is called grasping because the result of grasping does not exist without the cause called craving. The remaining links should be inferred in the same way, as appropriate.

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dag ste /üîΩ'dod pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bdag tu smra ba dang lta ba zhes bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni sred pa la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyis 'bras bu'i tshul
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dag ste / 'dod pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bdag tu smra ba dang lta ba zhes bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni sred pa la sogs pa rkyen rnams kyis 'bras bu'i tshul
translated: Grasping is that which is to be grasped.üîΩThe four kinds of grasping are grasping at desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and asceticism, and grasping at the doctrine of self.üîΩThe meaning of the term grasping is that which is to be grasped as a result by the conditions of craving and so on.

original: du nye bar blangs bar bya ba dag yin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya ste 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang /
analyzed: du nye bar blangs bar bya ba dag yin pas nye bar len pa zhes bya ste 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa dang /
translated: Grasping at desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and asceticism, and grasping at the doctrine of self are the four kinds of grasping.

original: lta ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: lta ba nye bar len pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The view is called appropriating.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the order in which the members are presented is the same as the order in which they are mentioned in the s≈´tra.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por de dag bstan pa ste zhes bya ba ni srid pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por nye bar len pa la sogs pa de dag bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi dang por de dag bstan pa ste zhes bya ba ni srid pa la sogs pa gang dag gi dang por nye bar len pa la sogs pa de dag bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe first of which is grasping‚Äù indicates that the first of the members that are mentioned in the s≈´tra is grasping.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthose members that begin with becoming‚Äù indicates that the members that begin with becoming are the members that are mentioned in the s≈´tra.

original: de dag kyang srid pa dang skye ba dang rga shi dag go zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi zhes bya ba de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang srid pa dang skye ba dang rga shi dag go zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi zhes bya ba de dag kyang gang zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose members that begin with becoming are becoming, birth, and aging and death‚Äù indicates that the members that begin with becoming are becoming, birth, and aging and death.üîΩTherefore, the fault that you have ascribed to us is actually your own fault.

original: de'i phyir khyod la skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshang ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod la skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshang ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This is the conclusion and the culmination of the refutation.

original: de'i phyir sngar 'di la gzugs dmigs shing lta bar byed pas lta ba po'o zhes rjes su dpag pa yin na gzugs dmigs pa de yang mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag yod na yod pa yin pas de'i phyir lhas
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar 'di la gzugs dmigs shing lta bar byed pas lta ba po'o zhes rjes su dpag pa yin na gzugs dmigs pa de yang mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa dag yod na yod pa yin pas de'i phyir lhas
translated: Therefore, if you infer that the seer is the one who sees visible form because he perceives visible form, then the perception of visible form exists when the eye, visible form, light, space, and attention exist. Therefore, the seer is not a real entity.

original: byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags kyi ;
analyzed: byin zhes bya ba'i tshogs de dag dang ldan pa la lta ba po zhes gdags kyi ;
translated: The one who possesses the assembly of those called ‚Äúfaculties‚Äù is designated as the ‚Äúseer,‚ÄùüîΩbut apart from that, there is no seer.

original: de las gzhan ni med do zhes ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de nyid khyod la yod pas khyod kyi lta ba po dang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba dag ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni med do zhes ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de nyid khyod la yod pas khyod kyi lta ba po dang lta ba dang blta bar bya ba dag ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since you have the faults that have been explained, your seer, seeing, and the seen are not established.

original: da ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por nyen pa la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa dag ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por nyen pa la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa dag ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dra bar bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the examples of the first chapter, such as the traveler, and sound, and so on, are similar in the same way that was explained,üîΩthe root text says:

original: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
analyzed: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
translated: Seeing, hearing, smelling, Tasting, touching, and mental cognition,

original: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
translated: The hearer, the heard, and so on,

original: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni da 'di man chad ni pha rol pos skye ba yod pa dang 'gro @33a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bya ba ni da 'di man chad ni pha rol pos skye ba yod pa dang 'gro @33a * //
translated: The following is the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: ba yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to prove that the internal sense bases exist, in the first chapter of this treatise on the analysis of the sense bases, the opponent‚Äôs position is presented as follows: ‚ÄúThe internal sense bases are only apprehended as arisen ultimately, because their objects are determined.‚Äù

original: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang skye ba med pa de la ni yul so sor nges pa med de dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i skye mched rnams la yul so sor nges pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which is not arisen does not have a determined object, just as the sense bases of the son of a barren woman do not have a determined object.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta bu yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni yul so sor nges pa 'di lta bu yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal sense bases have a determined object in the following way.

original: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lta dang nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed pa dang reg par byed pa dang yid rnams kyi yul gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos rnams yin par go rims bzhin no //
translated: The objects of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are, respectively, form, sound, smell, taste, tangible objects, and phenomena.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras pas skye ba dang 'gro ba yod pa de'i dper gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang lta ba la sogsüîΩpa dbang po rnams nye bar gzhag pa las lta ba dang gzugs ci ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras pas skye ba dang 'gro ba yod pa de'i dper gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang lta ba la sogs pa dbang po rnams nye bar gzhag pa las lta ba dang gzugs ci ltar mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, since the reason is stated in that way, one should apprehend that internal bases are only produced and one should understand that going exists because it is the effect of action, like seeing form and so on.üîΩThe master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna composed this treatise in order to explain that just as it is untenable to say that seeing and form exist in the way they are posited, that is, as the object and the sense faculty,

original: nyan pa la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa dag kyang lta ba dang gzugs mi 'thad par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dra bar bzhed nas slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs pas skye mched lhag ma rnams
analyzed: nyan pa la sogs pa dang sgra la sogs pa dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag pa dag kyang lta ba dang gzugs mi 'thad par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'dra bar bzhed nas slob dpon gyis tshig le'ur byas pa 'di gsungs pas skye mched lhag ma rnams
translated: so too it is similar to the way seeing and form are untenable, that is, that listening and so on and sound and so on are also posited as examples.

original: kyang mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kyang mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: But this is untenable.

original: nyan pa dang snom pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / yid dang / nyan pa po dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa dag gi lan kyang btab par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pa dang snom pa dang / myong bar byed pa dang / reg par byed pa dang / yid dang / nyan pa po dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa dag gi lan kyang btab par shes par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, mental activity, the hearer, the heard, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?üîΩBy the refutation of seeing. The refutation of hearing, etc., should be understood in the same way, as is appropriate, in detail, with elaboration.

original: lta ba nyid kyis te lta ba dgag pa bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dag dgag pa yang ci rigs par rjes su dpag pa rgyas par spros pa dang bcas te bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ltar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su /üîΩlta ba rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩda ni de la mi lta nyid //
analyzed: lta ba nyid kyis te lta ba dgag pa bzhin du nyan pa la sogs pa dag dgag pa yang ci rigs par rjes su dpag pa rgyas par spros pa dang bcas te bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci ltar lta ba dgag pa'i skabs su / lta ba rang gi bdag nyid na // da ni de la mi lta nyid //
translated: As it was said in the section on the refutation of seeing:üîΩThe seer does not see itself

original: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi lta ba //
translated: If it does not see itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar lta //
translated: How can it see others?

original: zhes bya bar don dam par mig gi dbang po ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya bar don dam par mig gi dbang po ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, ultimately, the eye faculty does not see form.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir @33b dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la lta bar mi byed pa'i phyir @33b dper na rna ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang don dam par gzugs mig gi dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na mig gi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes
translated: And, ultimately, form is not the object of the eye faculty because it is a composite, like the nature of the eye faculty itself.

original: bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis lta ba dang lta ba po dang blta bar bya ba bkag pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis lta ba dang lta ba po dang blta bar bya ba bkag pa bzhin du /
translated: In response to these arguments, the seeing, the seer, and the object seen are refuted.

original: 'dir yang / nyan pa rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: 'dir yang / nyan pa rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: Similarly, here it is said:

original: de ni de la mi nyan nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi nyan nyid //
translated: The ear does not hearüîΩitself.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi nyan pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi nyan pa //
translated: When it does not hear itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ci ltar nyan //üîΩzhes bya bas don dam par rna ba'i dbang po ni sgra nyan par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ci ltar nyan // zhes bya bas don dam par rna ba'i dbang po ni sgra nyan par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: how can it hear others?üîΩUltimately, the ear faculty does not hear sound because it does not hear itself, like the nose and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la nyan par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par sgra rna ba'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la nyan par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na sna la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par sgra rna ba'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: And, ultimately, sound is not the object of the ear faculty because it is a composite, like the nature of the ear faculty itself.

original: bsags pa'i phyir dper na rna ba'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis nyan pa dang nyan pa po dang mnyan par bya ba dgag par bya'o //üîΩsnom pa rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi snom nyid //
analyzed: bsags pa'i phyir dper na rna ba'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis nyan pa dang nyan pa po dang mnyan par bya ba dgag par bya'o // snom pa rang gi bdag nyid na // de ni de la mi snom nyid //
translated: The refutation of smelling, the smeller, and smell is as follows:üîΩThe smeller does not smellüîΩits own self.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi snom pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi snom pa //
translated: When it does not smell itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar snom //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar snom //
translated: how does it smell another?üîΩUltimately, the nose sense faculty does not smell odors because it does not smell its own self, like the tongue sense faculty and so on.üîΩUltimately, odors are not the objects of the nose sense faculty because they are accumulations, like the nature of the nose sense faculty itself.üîΩThe refutation of tasting, the taster, and taste is as follows:üîΩThe taster does not taste

original: zhes bya bas don dam par sna'i dbang po ni dri snom par mi byed pa nyid de rang gi bdag nyid la snom par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na lce la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par dri sna'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na sna'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis snom pa dang snom pa po dang bsnam par bya ba dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas don dam par sna'i dbang po ni dri snom par mi byed pa nyid de rang gi bdag nyid la snom par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na lce la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par dri sna'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na sna'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis snom pa dang snom pa po dang bsnam par bya ba dgag par bya'o //
translated: its own self.üîΩWhen it does not taste itself,üîΩhow does it taste another?

original: myong byed rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: myong byed rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: If the tongue itself is not experienced,

original: de ni de la mi myang nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi myang nyid //
translated: it does not experience other things.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi myang ba //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi myang ba //
translated: If it does not experience itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar myang //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar myang //
translated: how can it experience other things?üîΩThis means that ultimately the tongue faculty does not experience taste, because it does not experience itself, like the body and so on. And ultimately taste is not the object of the tongue faculty, because it is an aggregation, like the nature of the tongue faculty itself.

original: zhes bya bas don dam par lce'i dbang po ni ro myong bar mi byed pa nyid de rang gi bdag nyid la myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na lus la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par ro lce'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na lce'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis myong bar byed pa dang myang ba po dang myang bar bya ba dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas don dam par lce'i dbang po ni ro myong bar mi byed pa nyid de rang gi bdag nyid la myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dper na lus la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par ro lce'i dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na lce'i dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis myong bar byed pa dang myang ba po dang myang bar bya ba dgag par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of the experiencer, the experience, and that which is to be experienced is completed by these arguments and their responses.

original: reg byed rang gi bdag nyid na //
analyzed: reg byed rang gi bdag nyid na //
translated: If the body itself is not touched,

original: de ni de la mi reg nyid //
analyzed: de ni de la mi reg nyid //
translated: it does not touch other things.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi reg pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi reg pa //
translated: If it does not touch itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar reg //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar reg //
translated: how can it touch other things?

original: ces bya bas don dam par lus kyi dbang po ni reg bya la reg par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: ces bya bas don dam par lus kyi dbang po ni reg bya la reg par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: This means that ultimately the body faculty does not contact tactile objects,

original: rang gi bdag nyid la @34a * //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la @34a * //
translated: because it does not contact itself,üîΩlike the mental faculty and so on.

original: reg par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na yid la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par reg bya lus kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis reg par byed pa dang /
analyzed: reg par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na yid la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par reg bya lus kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin te bsags pa'i phyir dper na lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis reg par byed pa dang /
translated: And ultimately tactile objects are not objects of the body faculty, because they are aggregates, like the body faculty itself.

original: reg pa po dang / reg par bya ba dgag par bya'o //üîΩsems byed rang gi bdag nyid na //üîΩde ni de la mi sems nyid //
analyzed: reg pa po dang / reg par bya ba dgag par bya'o // sems byed rang gi bdag nyid na // de ni de la mi sems nyid //
translated: Thus the refutation of contact, the toucher, and the tactile object should be understood.üîΩThe mind does not think about itself.

original: gang tshe bdag la mi sems pa //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag la mi sems pa //
translated: When it does not think about itself,

original: de gzhan dag la ji ltar sems //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la ji ltar sems //
translated: how does it think about others?

original: zhes bya ba don dam par yid kyi dbang po ni chos sems par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba don dam par yid kyi dbang po ni chos sems par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: This means that ultimately the mental faculty does not think about mental objects,üîΩbecause it does not think about itself, like the body faculty and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la sems par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par chos yid kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la sems par mi byed pa'i phyir dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par chos yid kyi dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: and, ultimately, the object of the mental faculty is not an object of the mental faculty,üîΩbecause it is an object, like the nature of the mental faculty itself.

original: chos yin pa'i phyir dper na yid kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis yid dang shes pa yod pa nyid dang chos dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: chos yin pa'i phyir dper na yid kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba brgal ba'i lan dang bcas pa dag gis yid dang shes pa yod pa nyid dang chos dgag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the existence of the mental faculty and consciousness and the refutation of the object should be understood through these arguments and responses.

original: des na rab tu byed pa rtsom pa nas rnam par rtog par byed pa'i skye ba yang ma grub la 'gro ba yang ma grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rab tu byed pa rtsom pa nas rnam par rtog par byed pa'i skye ba yang ma grub la 'gro ba yang ma grub po zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, from the beginning of the chapter on the elements, the arising of the thinker is not established and going is not established is the conclusion.

original: 'di skad bstan te ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa des na skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po rtsom pa nas pha rol po dag skye ba yod pa dag 'gro ba yod par rnam par rtog par byed pa'i skye ba yang ma grub la 'gro
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa des na skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po rtsom pa nas pha rol po dag skye ba yod pa dag 'gro ba yod par rnam par rtog par byed pa'i skye ba yang ma grub la 'gro
translated: This is explained as follows: By the reasoning explained above, from the beginning of the chapter on the elements, the arising of the opponent‚Äôs thought that arising exists and going exists is not established and going is not established.

original: ba yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: ba yang ma grub ste /
translated: The second reason also is not established.

original: pha rol pos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol pos don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The opponent says: The internal sources are only apprehended as ultimately arisen,üîΩbecause they are ascertained as objects.

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i yul so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir skye ba ma grub la /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de'i yul so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir skye ba ma grub la /
translated: Since the ascertainment of the object does not exist, arising is not established.

original: 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The opponent says: One should understand that going exists,üîΩbecause it is the effect of action, like seeing form and so on.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pa de'i gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang ma grub bo //
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pa de'i gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang ma grub bo //
translated: Since seeing form and so on does not exist, going is not established.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is that the sources are taught to be empty by stating the faults of the proof that the opponent asserts. This is the effect of the valid knowledge.

original: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad med pa'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos skye ba dang 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzungüîΩbar bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad med pa'i 'bras bur lta ba ni pha rol pos skye ba dang 'gro ba bsgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In this third chapter, the analysis of the sense bases, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: The counterparts‚Äô thesis that birth and transmigration exist ultimately is to be taken as the position that the inner sense sources are only born.üîΩThey say that birth exists because the object is ascertained individually and that transmigration exists because it is the result of action, like seeing form and so on.

original: @34b yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis smras pa dag gi sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin
analyzed: @34b yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / 'gro ba yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis smras pa dag gi sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin
translated: The chapter demonstrates that the sense sources are empty by stating the faults in the counterparts‚Äô proofs.

original: no // skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches ba'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: no // skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches ba'i lung gi khungs kyis kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: What is the benefit of teaching the emptiness of the sense bases?

analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa tshangs pa khyad par sems kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: To demonstrate this, the treatise states:üîΩThe sense bases are taught to be empty.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab dang ye shes kyis gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su dbyer med pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab dang ye shes kyis gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su dbyer med pa dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The sense bases are taught to be empty.

original: mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the scripture is established by that authoritative scriptural source which is believed, namely, ‚ÄúHe is fully enlightened without any characteristic.‚Äù By that, the sense bases are established as emptiness.

original: de la nang gi sa'i khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: de la nang gi sa'i khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams so //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúwhatever internal earth element there is‚Äù refers to the internal sense bases such as the eyes, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams so //üîΩgnyis su med pa dang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dbang po rnams kyang med la yul rnams kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams so // gnyis su med pa dang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dbang po rnams kyang med la yul rnams kyang med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever external earth element there is‚Äù refers to the external sense bases such as form, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúNon-dual‚Äù means that by its very nature, the sense faculties do not exist and the sense objects do not exist.

original: gnyis su dbyer med pa dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams la yang 'dzin pa nyid med la yul rnams la yang gzung ba nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med pa dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams la yang 'dzin pa nyid med la yul rnams la yang gzung ba nyid med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndivisible‚Äù means that the sense faculties are not apprehended as such and the sense objects are not apprehended as such.

original: de ltar dbang po rnams dang yul rnams la ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par du dbye ba med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po rnams dang yul rnams la ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par du dbye ba med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the faculties and the objects are said to be ‚Äúof one mark‚Äù because they are not inherently different from each other, and because there is no difference in their character as subject and object.

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs pa de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs pa de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of this ‚Äúone mark‚Äù?üîΩTherefore, it says, ‚ÄúIt is thus: it is without mark.‚Äù It says ‚Äúone mark‚Äù in order to eliminate the extreme of difference.

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te tha dad pa nyid kyi mtha' bsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs la /üîΩgcig pa nyid kyi mtha' bsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te /üîΩgcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid kyi mtha' @35a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te tha dad pa nyid kyi mtha' bsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes gsungs la / gcig pa nyid kyi mtha' bsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te / gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid kyi mtha' @35a * //
translated: It says ‚Äúwithout mark‚Äù in order to eliminate the extreme of identity.üîΩThe non-apprehension of the two extremes of identity and difference

original: gnyis dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩSimilarly, the noble A·πÖgulimƒÅla S≈´tra says:üîΩThe girl asked,

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las bu mo khams dag ci ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par rol pa'i mdo las bu mo khams dag ci ltar blta bar bya /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen?‚Äù

original: bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: bu mos smras pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ replied,üîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as they really are.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as they really are?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither existent nor non-existent.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither existent nor non-existent?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither the same nor different.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither the same nor different?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither coming nor going.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither coming nor going?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither produced nor stopped.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither produced nor stopped?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither pure nor impure.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither pure nor impure?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither defiled nor purified.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither defiled nor purified?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither afflicted nor purified.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither afflicted nor purified?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúGirl, the elements should be seen as neither increased nor decreased.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how should the elements be seen as neither increased nor decreased?‚Äù

original: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is like this:üîΩfor example, when the three worlds are burned by the conflagration at the end of the eon, not even ashes remain.

original: dper na 'jig rten gsum bskal bas bsregs pa na thal ba yang med pa ltar ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten gsum bskal bas bsregs pa na thal ba yang med pa ltar ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this scriptural passage is established. That scriptural source, which is to be trusted, also proves that the sense spheres are emptiness.

original: dper na mes 'jig pa'i bskal pa byung ba na sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi thal ba yang dmigs su med pa de bzhin du nang dang phyi rol gyi khams rnams la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi phaüîΩrol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mes 'jig pa'i bskal pa byung ba na sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi thal ba yang dmigs su med pa de bzhin du nang dang phyi rol gyi khams rnams la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For example, when the eon of destruction by fire occurs, not even the ashes of the sentient beings and the physical cosmos can be found. In the same way, the perfection of wisdom is the non-apprehension of anything whatsoever in the internal and external elements.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
