translated: Similarly, the noble S≈´tra on the Transference of Existence says:

original: mig ni gzugs la mi lta zhing //
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la mi lta zhing //
translated: The eye does not see forms,

original: yid ni chos rnams mi shes te //
analyzed: yid ni chos rnams mi shes te //
translated: and the mind does not know mental factors.

original: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten mi 'jug pa //
translated: Where the world does not engage,

original: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: that is the highest truth.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'i lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: This scripture proves that the sense bases are emptiness, and this scripture is authoritative and reliable.

original: mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa la lta bar mi byed pa 'jig rten gyis mi rtog pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa la lta bar mi byed pa 'jig rten gyis mi rtog pa'i don dam pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the ultimate that is not conceived by the world, that the eye, etc. do not see form, etc.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las chos thams cad ni shes par mi byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde'i mtha' gzhan dag las chos thams cad ni shes par mi byed /
translated: Similarly, other s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not to be known,üîΩnot to be seen, and the one who speaks of phenomena should not attend to them, should not think of them, should not imagine them.‚Äù

original: lta bar mi byed de de ni chos smra ba la yang dmigs par mi byed sems par mi byed rlom par mi byed do zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan dag las sring mo mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed rnam par shes par mi byed de /
analyzed: lta bar mi byed de de ni chos smra ba la yang dmigs par mi byed sems par mi byed rlom par mi byed do zhes bya ba gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan dag las sring mo mig ni gzugs la lta bar mi byed rnam par shes par mi byed de /
translated: Similarly, other MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúSister, the eye does not see forms and does not cognize them.

original: byang chub kyang mig dang gzugs dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyang mig dang gzugs dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Awakening is free from the eye and form.‚Äù

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang chos rnams 'dzin par mi byed rnam par shes par mi byed de byang chub kyang yid dang chos dang bral ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i lung gi don de dag kyang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs de dag gis
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang chos rnams 'dzin par mi byed rnam par shes par mi byed de byang chub kyang yid dang chos dang bral ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i lung gi don de dag kyang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs de dag gis
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind do not apprehend or cognize phenomena. Even enlightenment is free from the mind and phenomena.

original: kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: These scriptural passages prove that the sense-spheres are emptiness.

original: skye mched rnams la byed pa dang bya ba med par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la byed pa dang bya ba med par bstan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the teaching that the sense-spheres are devoid of action and agent.

original: de bzhin du bcom @35b ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom @35b ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, in the Perfection of Wisdom in 150 Lines, the Blessed Lady says:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs ni gzugs kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is not the domain of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no ;
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no ;
translated: Feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness are not the domain of consciousness.

original: / rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: / rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa spyod yul zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyis gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Subh≈´ti, the domain is that form does not know or see form, and that feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness do not know or see consciousness.üîΩThat form does not know or see form, and that feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness do not know or see consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThis is established.

original: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs
analyzed: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi don de yang grub cing yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs
translated: This also establishes the meaning of the scriptures, and is a source of trustworthy scriptures.

original: des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: des kyang skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: This also establishes the emptiness of the sense sources.

original: yul dang yul can gyi dngos po dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyi dngos po dgag pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the negation of the entities of subject and object.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i yon tan yin te /
translated: The benefit of teaching the emptiness of the sense bases is that one can establish the authority of the scriptures that one trusts.

original: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos rang gi bsam pas rtog ge skam po tsam gyis skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I have not taught the sense bases to be natureless by mere dry reasoning of my own thought.

original: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung de dag kyang yod do // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: It is because these scriptures exist.üîΩThe Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way composed by the master BhƒÅviveka.

original: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba las skye mched brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gsum pa rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba las skye mched brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa gsum pa rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the sense bases, called ‚ÄúExamination of the Sense Bases,‚Äù from the commentary on the third chapter of the Root Verses of the Middle Way composed by the master Avalokitavrata is complete.

original: // / da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra'i
analyzed: // / da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra'i
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of the aggregates by refuting the special discordant factors of the existence of the sense-spheres, the fourth chapter is begun.

original: sbyor ba skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù should be understood in this context as having the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis, and the meaning of application to the text that follows.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engagement in the thesis,

original: da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras @36a * //
analyzed: da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras @36a * //
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the essencelessness of the aggregates by refuting the special discordant factors of the existence of the sense-spheres, it is said.

original: te ; bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas
analyzed: te ; bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas 'dir rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas sngar bstan bcos mdzad pas
translated: Since the treatise author, in the first chapter of the examination of conditions, made the assertion that all things are unarisen, here, in the fourth chapter, the author of the commentary states that he will now refute the specific counterposition that the sense bases exist.

original: ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ci ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the reason for engaging in that assertion,

original: da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, the specific counterposition that the sense bases exist is refuted.

original: skye mched ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis po dag go //üîΩde dag gi yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni sngar rang gi sde pa dag gis don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched bcu gnyis po dag go // de dag gi yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni sngar rang gi sde pa dag gis don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams skye ba kho nar gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The sense bases are the twelve sense bases such as the eyes.

original: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes dam bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro zhes dam bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sense bases exist was asserted by our schools earlier, when they said, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate truth, the internal sense bases are only arisen because objects are ascertained individually.‚Äù

original: skye mched yod pa nyid du dam bcas pa de nyid dbu ma pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du ston pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas skye mched rnams yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched yod pa nyid du dam bcas pa de nyid dbu ma pas skye mched rnams stong pa nyid du ston pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas skye mched rnams yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The assertion that the sense spheres exist is itself the opponent of the Madhyamaka‚Äôs demonstration that the sense spheres are emptiness. Therefore the existence of the sense spheres is called ‚Äúthe opponent.‚Äù

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag gis 'og nas don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin no
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag gis 'og nas don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa 'byung ba dag yin no
translated: The ‚Äúdistinctions‚Äù are the positions that will be presented below by our own schools, such as ‚ÄúThe sense spheres definitely exist ultimately because they are included in the aggregates.‚Äù

original: // de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: // de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The ‚Äúrefutation of those‚Äù is the refutation of the distinctions of the opponent, the existence of the sense spheres. The fourth chapter is composed from the perspective of that refutation.

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsams na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, if one composes the fourth chapter in order to refute the specific counter position that the sense bases exist, then the intended purpose will be accomplished.üîΩIn terms of the meaning of the passage that will appear below, it is said that the fourth chapter is composed in order to demonstrate the meaning of the teaching that the aggregates lack entityness.

original: phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi ba'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: phung po brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi ba'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas /
translated: The meaning of the passage that will appear below in the fourth chapter on the aggregates is the teaching that the aggregates lack entityness.

original: 'dir rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhiüîΩpa @36b brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byed pa bzhi pa brtsam pa'i skabs su yang 'grel pa byed pas gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don de'i dbang du byas nas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bzhi pa @36b brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In consideration of the meaning of the title, ‚ÄúTeaching the essencelessness of the aggregates,‚Äù the fourth chapter is composed.

original: skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The refutation of the special case of the existence of the sense bases is the effect of the teaching of the essencelessness of the aggregates.

original: skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bstan ma thag pa'i mjug tu /
analyzed: skye mched yod pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa bstan ma thag pa'i mjug tu /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, the commentator says, ‚ÄúThe special case of the existence of the sense bases,‚Äù and immediately after the presentation of the chapter he says:

original: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
analyzed: lta bas nyan dang snom pa dang // myong bar byed dang reg byed yid //
translated: Seeing, hearing, smelling, Tasting, touching, and mental processing,

original: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
analyzed: nyan pa po dang mnyan la sogs //
translated: The hearer, the heard, and so forth,

original: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam par bshad par shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood as explained.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because it was explained previously.üîΩBecause it was explained previously in the immediately preceding chapter on the analysis of the faculties,

original: sngar skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa bstan ma thag pa'i mjug tu de skad bshad pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis de mi bzod pas de'i phyir rang gi sde pa dag na re 'di skad ces zer
analyzed: sngar skye mched brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa bstan ma thag pa'i mjug tu de skad bshad pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gis de mi bzod pas de'i phyir rang gi sde pa dag na re 'di skad ces zer
translated: our own schools and the Vaibhasikas cannot accept that,

original: ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: so they say this.

original: de'i phyir don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore the faculties definitely exist ultimately,üîΩbecause they are included in the aggregates.

original: phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The subject, the predicate of the proposition, and the reason are to be applied in order.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pos ma bsdus te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pos ma bsdus te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not included in the aggregates of form and so on.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: For example, like a sky flower. This is an example of a dissimilar class.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni phung pos bsdus pa yod de /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni phung pos bsdus pa yod de /
translated: The internal sense bases are included in the aggregates.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
translated: the ten physical sense bases are included in the form aggregate.

original: chos kyi skye mched ni phung po gsum dang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni phung po gsum dang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus /
translated: The sense base of mental objects is included in three aggregates and one part of the form aggregate.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus so zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus so zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The sense base of the mental faculty is included in the consciousness aggregate. This is the application of the analogy.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of the reason stated, the internal sense bases definitely exist ultimately. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: 'di ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa gang dag phung pos ma bsdus pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi skye mched rnams ni phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa gang dag phung pos ma bsdus pa de dag ni don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi skye mched rnams ni phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Those not included in the aggregates, such as the sky flower, do not ultimately exist, but the sense bases do ultimately exist because they are included in the aggregates.

original: skye mched gzugs can dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ste bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
analyzed: skye mched gzugs can dbang po lnga dang yul lnga ste bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
translated: The ten physical sense bases, the five sense faculties and five objects, are included in the form aggregate.

original: chos kyi skye mched ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po @37a * //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi phung po @37a * //
translated: The phenomena base is included in the three aggregates of feeling, discernment and formation.

original: gsum dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i nang nas phyogs gcig po rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyis bsdus /
analyzed: gsum dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i nang nas phyogs gcig po rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyis bsdus /
translated: One part of the form aggregate, nonindicative form, is included in the phenomena base.üîΩThe mental base is included in the consciousness aggregate.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus pas de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus pas de dag ni don dam par yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they definitely exist ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this assertion, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: 'di la gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //üîΩdus la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so // dus la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: All of these are included in the aggregate of form.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos la'o //
translated: Here means in the treatise on Abhidharma.üîΩForm is twofold: color and shape.üîΩOr, it is twofold: resistant and unresisting.üîΩOr, it is twofold: visible and invisible.üîΩOr, it is twofold: basic and derivative.

original: gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi bdag nyid dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid dam bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa'o zhes kyang 'byung mod kyi /üîΩde dag kyang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su 'dus pas de'i phyir 'dir 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba gnyis smos so //
analyzed: gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi bdag nyid dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid dam bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa'o zhes kyang 'byung mod kyi /üîΩde dag kyang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su 'dus pas de'i phyir 'dir 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba gnyis smos so //
translated: Or, it is twofold: primary and secondary.üîΩOr, it is twofold: manifest and unmanifest.üîΩOr, it is twofold: wholesome and unwholesome.üîΩOr, it is twofold: contaminated and uncontaminated.üîΩOr, it is twofold: conditioned and unconditioned.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.üîΩOr, it is twofold: form and non-form.

original: de dag kyang rgyas par dbye na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa mang du yod de mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par dbye ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyas par dbye na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa mang du yod de mdor bsdus pa dang / rgyas par dbye ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, if they are classified in detail, they are many, different by way of the classification of past, future, present, and so on.üîΩThe brief and the detailed classifications are all included in one, and are called the form aggregate.

original: de la re zhig pha rol po'i gtan tshigs nyid du mig la sogs pas bsdus par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / bstan sla ba'i phyir gzugs las brtsams te bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga dag las dang por re zhig gzugs kyi phung po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig pha rol po'i gtan tshigs nyid du mig la sogs pas bsdus par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / bstan sla ba'i phyir gzugs las brtsams te bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga dag las dang por re zhig gzugs kyi phung po ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, one should reflect on form, because it is asserted to be included in the eye and so on, and because it is easy to teach.

original: pha rol po skye mched yod pa nyid du smra ba dag gis sngar phyogs snga ma nyid nye bar bzhag pa'i skabs su skye mched rnams yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su skye mched mig la sogs pa gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus par 'dod
analyzed: pha rol po skye mched yod pa nyid du smra ba dag gis sngar phyogs snga ma nyid nye bar bzhag pa'i skabs su skye mched rnams yod pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su skye mched mig la sogs pa gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus par 'dod
translated: Since they assert that the ten physical sense bases, such as the eyes, are included in the form aggregate,

original: pa'i phyir dang / phung po lnga po dag rtsing rim gyis bzhag pa dang snod la sogs pa'i dpe'i rim pas bzhag pa las gzugs kyi phung po bstan sla ba'i phyir dang por gzugs las brtsams te bsam par bya'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / phung po lnga po dag rtsing rim gyis bzhag pa dang snod la sogs pa'i dpe'i rim pas bzhag pa las gzugs kyi phung po bstan sla ba'i phyir dang por gzugs las brtsams te bsam par bya'o zhes smos so //
translated: since the five aggregates are posited in a coarse order and since form is easier to teach than the other aggregates, it is said that form should be contemplated first.

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan na tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi ngo bo @37b nyid med pa nyid du 'grub cing /
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan na tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi ngo bo @37b nyid med pa nyid du 'grub cing /
translated: If form is taught to be essenceless, the essencelessness of the remaining aggregates such as feeling will be established.

original: de ltar phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na pha rol po dag gi skye mched rnams yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de ma grub pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du
analyzed: de ltar phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na pha rol po dag gi skye mched rnams yod par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs su phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de ma grub pas skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du
translated: Thus, if the aggregates are essenceless, then the reason that the opponent gives to prove that the sense bases exist, ‚Äúbecause they are included in the aggregates,‚Äù is not established.

original: grub bo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: grub bo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, the sense bases are established as essenceless.

original: gzugs kyi phung po 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the argument for the cessation of the form aggregate?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: form is not apprehended.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byar rung ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byar rung ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Form is that which can be resisted, that is, that which can be struck and that which has impact.

original: de'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi rgyu ste ;
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi rgyu ste ;
translated: Its cause is the cause of form.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dag yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dag yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of derived form is the form of the great elements.

original: de dag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni de dag bsal na'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu de dag bsal na'o //
analyzed: de dag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni de dag bsal na'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu de dag bsal na'o //
translated: Except for those, i.e., except for the great elements.

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Form is not perceived, i.e., ultimately.

original: 'o na ci zhe na tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag la brten nas gzugs so zhes 'dogs par byed ngo zhes bya ba ni dper na nags tshal zhes bya ba rdzas su grub pa med du zin kyang seng ldeng
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag la brten nas gzugs so zhes 'dogs par byed ngo zhes bya ba ni dper na nags tshal zhes bya ba rdzas su grub pa med du zin kyang seng ldeng
translated: But, conventionally, form is designated in dependence on the four great elements that are the cause of form, just as a forest is designated in dependence on trees.

original: dang ni ma pa dang pa nas la sogs pa'i tshogs la brten nas nags tshal zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi rgyu la brten nas gzugs zhes gdags pa tsam du zad kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyi grub pa med do //
analyzed: dang ni ma pa dang pa nas la sogs pa'i tshogs la brten nas nags tshal zhes 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi rgyu la brten nas gzugs zhes gdags pa tsam du zad kyi gzugs zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyi grub pa med do //
translated: Just as a forest is imputed in dependence on a collection of trees, in the same way, form is imputed in dependence on the causes of form. There is no intrinsically real entity called ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'dis gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang / gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang / gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa bstan to zhes bya ba ni / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Thus, this shows that the object of affirmation, the mere collection of form and so on, and the affirming property, form, are not apprehended without their causes.üîΩForm is not observed

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: apart from its causes.

original: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: The first half of this verse shows the object of affirmation, the lack of intrinsic existence of form derived from the elements, and the affirming property.

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the property to be established is that form does not substantially exist.

original: sa la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The example is the mere assembly of earth and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i chos ni gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs su med @38a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ni gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs su med @38a * //
translated: The proving property is that form is not observed apart from the cause of form,

original: pa ste rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩdpe ni de'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: pa ste rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba yin no // dpe ni de'i dbang gis te /
translated: for if its cause is not apprehended, the cognition of it does not exist.üîΩThe example is taught by the power of that.üîΩAn army, a forest and so on are examples.

original: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bstan dgos te /
analyzed: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bstan dgos te /
translated: The example of a property common to the similar class is taught by the power of the property to be established and the proving property.

original: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba yod pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa zhes bya ba yod pa dag yin no //
translated: Those which are not substantially existent as the object to be established, such as an army, a forest, etc., and those which are not substantially existent as the means of establishing, such as the cognition of that, when its cause is not apprehended, are existent.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: Here, the inference is: Form is not substantially existent ultimately,

original: rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: because the cognition of that does not exist when its cause is not apprehended. These are the subject, the property to be established, and the means of establishing, respectively.

original: 'di na gang rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist as a substance when its cause is not apprehended, does not exist as a substance.

original: dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin no //
translated: For example, like an army, etc. This is the example of the similar class.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyus la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te /üîΩdper na dmag la sogs pa ni rang gi rgyud phung rnam bzhi la sogs pa dag ma bzung na ni dmag gi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyus la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyus la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin te / dper na dmag la sogs pa ni rang gi rgyud phung rnam bzhi la sogs pa dag ma bzung na ni dmag gi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyus la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo
translated: So too, if form is not apprehended by its causes and so on, then the cognition of form does not exist and it does not substantially exist. This is the application of the analogy.üîΩFor example, if an army and so on is not apprehended by its members, then the cognition of an army does not exist and it does not substantially exist.

original: med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: So too, if form is not apprehended by its causes and so on, then the cognition of form does not exist and it does not substantially exist.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lan gzhan yang med de /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lan gzhan yang med de /
translated: Or else, there is another reply to the objection.

original: don dam par gzugs kyi blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyi blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of form does not have an object that is a substantially existent thing.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo ni blo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo ni blo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the consciousness of a forest and so on is not a consciousness that has as its object a substantially existent thing because it is a consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi blo yang blo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo yang blo yin pa'i phyir dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the consciousness of form is not a consciousness that has as its object a substantially existent thing because it is a consciousness.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Or, there is another syllogistic form: The word form does not refer to a substantially existent object because it is a conventional expression.

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba @38b dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bya ba @38b dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proving property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra ni sgra yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don rjes su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra ni sgra yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don rjes su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the sound of an army, etc., is not a sound that has a referent that is a collection of words because it is a sound.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra yang sgra yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra yang sgra yin pa'i phyir tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the sound called ‚Äúform‚Äù is not a sound that has a referent that is a substantial entity because it is a sound.

original: 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag sems dang sems las byung ba dag rdzas su yod par 'dod pas de'i phyir de dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chos mngon pa pa dag sems dang sems las byung ba dag rdzas su yod par 'dod pas de'i phyir de dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Here, because the ƒÄbhidharmikas assert that mind and mental factors are substantially existent, they say that the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason, ‚Äúbecause it is a sound,‚Äù is not established.

original: ci re zhig sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci re zhig sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does it follow that it is not a subject that has a substantially existent object because it is sound, like the sound of an army and so on?üîΩOr does it follow that it is a subject that has a substantially existent object because it is sound, like the sound of minds and mental factors?

original: 'on te sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi sgra bzhin du tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i phyir yul can yin par 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid
analyzed: 'on te sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi sgra bzhin du tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i phyir yul can yin par 'gyur zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid
translated: In response to this former opponent‚Äôs position, the author of the commentary here

original: kyis rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kyis rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: says, ‚ÄúBecause consciousness and mental factors are similar to the object of affirmation, they are also to be refuted in the same way. Therefore the reason is not indeterminate.‚Äù

original: ji ltar kho bo gzugs 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang 'gog par byed pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid gyi  skyon med do //
analyzed: ji ltar kho bo gzugs 'gog par byed pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dag kyang 'gog par byed pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid gyi  skyon med do //
translated: Just as we refute form, so we also refute mind and mental factors. Therefore, your error of the uncertainty of the reason is not committed.

original: gal te gzugs ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
translated: Form exists ultimately,

original: de zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it is destroyed, the cognition of it is not destroyed.

original: 'di na gang zhig na de'i blo 'jig pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang zhig na de'i blo 'jig pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin te /
translated: Here, that which is destroyed is conventionally existent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //üîΩgzugs sngon po la sogs pa dag ni zhig kyang de'i blo de ltar mi 'jig pas de'i phyir gzugs ni rdzas su yod pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag nyid dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no // gzugs sngon po la sogs pa dag ni zhig kyang de'i blo de ltar mi 'jig pas de'i phyir gzugs ni rdzas su yod pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag nyid dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i
translated: like a pot, for example.üîΩThe cognition of blue and so on is not destroyed in that way even though it is destroyed. Therefore form is substantially existent.

original: gnod pa yod do zhes skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa yod do zhes skyon 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the error of the Svatantrikas, who are not free from the fault of the uncertainty of the reason.

original: de dag gi gzhung las bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gang zhig par gyur na de la bum pa'i blo mi skye ba de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin gyi sa la sogs pa'i gzugs gang zhig par gyur kyang de la gzugs kyi blo skye ba
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung las bum pa la sogs pa dngos po gang zhig par gyur na de la bum pa'i blo mi skye ba de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin gyi sa la sogs pa'i gzugs gang zhig par gyur kyang de la gzugs kyi blo skye ba
translated: In their texts, they say that if a thing such as a pot is destroyed, the cognition of a pot does not arise, and that is conventional existence. But if a form such as earth is destroyed, the cognition of form arises

original: de ni don dam par yod pa yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la @39a * //
analyzed: de ni don dam par yod pa yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la @39a * //
translated: even in that, and that is ultimate existence. Therefore, for a Madhyamaka reason, if its cause is not grasped, there is no cognition of it.

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that there is a contradiction that cannot be mistaken.

original: de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Those statements of their syllogism are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, an example of the discordant class, the application of the syllogism, and the conclusion, to be applied in order.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is not good, because it is not a universal.

original: rang gi sde pa dag la dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag la dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: The Madhyamikas do not commit the error of contradiction in their arguments, so it is not good to fault them for that.üîΩThus, the imagined form that is derivative has already been investigated.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtags zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar 'di la gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtags zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar 'di la gzugs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In the above, form is briefly of two kinds:üîΩthe form of the elements and derivative form.

original: 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes smos pa las de yan chad du 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brtags zin to /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gzugs dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes smos pa las de yan chad du 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brtags zin to /
translated: Up to this point, derivative form has already been investigated as lacking entityness.

original: // / bam po sum cu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu gcig pa /
translated: The Investigation of the Faculties

original: da ni 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi dbang du byas te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: da ni 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi dbang du byas te bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston to //
translated: Now, it is said, ‚ÄúI will explain from the perspective of the form of the elements,‚Äù and so on, demonstrating that the form of the elements is essenceless.

original: 'dir phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs snga ma nye bar bzhag pa ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the opponent‚Äôs position is set out as follows: Derivative form does exist,

original: de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its causes exist.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni rgyu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni rgyu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: For that which does not exist, a cause cannot be apprehended, just as, for example, a sky flower cannot.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la ni rgyus la sogs pa de dag yod pas de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la ni rgyus la sogs pa de dag yod pas de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: But the causes of derivative form, such as threads, do exist. Therefore, derivative form does exist.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, the example of the similar class, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary explains:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
translated: The cause of form is not tenable.

original: 'di la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa dag kyang mi snang zhing gzung du med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa dag kyang mi snang zhing gzung du med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, apart from the characteristics of form that is derivative form, such as form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, the cause of form and so on do not appear and are not apprehended.

original: @39b gzugs ma gtogs par yang 'di ni gzugs kyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: @39b gzugs ma gtogs par yang 'di ni gzugs kyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: Apart from form, the statement ‚ÄúThis is the cause of form‚Äù does not appear.

original: gzugs ni mi 'thad par bshad zin te de ltar gzugs mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzugs ni mi 'thad par bshad zin te de ltar gzugs mi 'thad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Form is untenable, as has been explained. Since form is untenable in that way, the cause of form is also untenable.

original: 'dir yang 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang sgrub pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi snang bar bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'dir /üîΩgzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang sgrub pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi snang bar bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'dir / gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Here, the object of the elements, form and so on, is merely a composite and the establishing factor is form and so on, which do not appear. If they do not appear, earth and so on do not appear.üîΩApart from what is called form,üîΩ

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Here also, the mere collection of the phenomena of form, etc., which are the things to be established as the form of the elements, and the phenomena that establish them, are taught to be not apparent when form, etc., are not apparent, and that the elements, earth, etc., are also not apparent.üîΩThe second half of the verse

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis kyang 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis kyang 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba chos ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: teaches that the phenomena to be established as the essencelessness of the form of the elements are not substantially existent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid yin par bstan la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid yin par bstan la /
translated: It teaches that they are the mere collection of form, etc.

original: sgrub pa'i chos ni de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba ste gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi snang ba zhes bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ni de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba ste gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de dag kyang mi snang ba zhes bya ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The phenomena that establish them are taught to be not apparent when their cause is not apparent, and that the elements, earth, etc., are also not apparent when form, etc., are not apparent.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang gis dpe yang mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang gis dpe yang mngon no zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe yang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la bsgrub par bya ba chos rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the example is also evident by the power of that.üîΩThe example that is similar to the probandum in the proof of the essencelessness of primary elements is also evident by the power of that probandum and that proving property.

original: sgrub pa'i chos de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba zhes bya ba yod pa dag yin par mngon no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba zhes bya ba yod pa dag yin par mngon no //
translated: The army, forest, and so on are evident by the power of that probandum and that proving property, in which the probandum is not substantially existent and the proving property is not evident.üîΩHere, first, the words of the syllogism with respect to earth should be stated.

original: de la 'dir re zhig sa'i dbang du byas te sbyor ba'i tshig bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgag pas lhag ma rnams kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig sa'i dbang du byas te sbyor ba'i tshig bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgag pas lhag ma rnams kyang dgag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The remainder should be supplied by the negation of earth.

original: 'dir yang pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas don dam par gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya bar khas blangs la /
analyzed: 'dir yang pha rol po dag na re khyed dbu ma pas don dam par gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya bar khas blangs la /
translated: Here, the opponents say, you MƒÅdhyamikas accept that ultimately form is not produced.

original: da 'dir ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid du sgrub par byed pas rang gi khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ;
analyzed: da 'dir ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid du sgrub par byed pas rang gi khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ;
translated: Here, since it is established that it is a mere aggregation of form and so on, it is said that the former opponent‚Äôs position is undermined.

original: 'dus pa tsam nyid kyang don dam par mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam nyid kyang don dam par mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says, ‚ÄúBecause a mere aggregation is not taught ultimately.‚Äù

original: kho bo kun rdzob tu 'dus pa tsam nyid du sgrub kyi don dam par mi ston pa'i phyir rang gi khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo kun rdzob tu 'dus pa tsam nyid du sgrub kyi don dam par mi ston pa'i phyir rang gi khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do //
translated: We establish that it is a mere aggregation conventionally, but since we do not teach that ultimately, our position is not undermined.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is said that if it is taught that it is a mere aggregation conventionally, what is the benefit of that?
Here,

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa kho na bstan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa kho na bstan te /
translated: the author of the treatise says, ‚ÄúBy teaching that it is a mere aggregation, he teaches only the refutation of substantial existence.

original: de dgag pa ni don che ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dgag pa ni don che ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the refutation of that is of great purpose.‚Äù

original: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kun rdzob tu 'byung ba'i gzugs dag gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa kho na bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pa slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kun rdzob tu 'byung ba'i gzugs dag gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas de dag don dam par rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa kho na bstan te /
translated: Here, the treatise author, the venerable Nagarjuna, has taught that the forms that arise conventionally are merely the collection of form and so on. He has taught only the refutation of their substantial existence ultimately.

original: de dag dgag pa ni mdzad pa po nyid kyi bzhed pa mchog yin pas don che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dgag pa ni mdzad pa po nyid kyi bzhed pa mchog yin pas don che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that refutation is the supreme intention of the author, it is of great import.

original: ji ltar de don che ba nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces 'dri na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de don che ba nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag de skad ces 'dri na'o //
translated: If the opponent asks, ‚ÄúHow is it of great import?‚Äù

original: de'i lan du 'dir tha snyad du brten nas 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir tha snyad du brten nas 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause it is established that what is dependently imputed conventionally does not arise ultimately, since it does not substantially exist, it is essenceless.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzhi gang la brten nas dngos po gang 'dogs pa dang rnam par 'jog pa dang ston par byed pa de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du gzhi gang la brten nas dngos po gang 'dogs pa dang rnam par 'jog pa dang ston par byed pa de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is dependently imputed, posited, and taught as a thing in dependence on a basis is ultimately not substantially existent.

original: skye ba med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa de ni don che ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir 'dus pa tsam nyid du bstan pas rdzas su yod pa nyid dgag pa de ni don che ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is established that it is essenceless because it is unarisen, the teaching that it is a mere collection is of great significance in that it refutes its substantial existence.

original: gal te 'dus pa tsam nyid bstan pa'i yon tan de ga las shes she na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa tsam nyid bstan pa'i yon tan de ga las shes she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow do we know that the teaching that it is a mere collection is a good quality?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble S≈´tra on Entering Lanka says:

original: gang phyir 'dus pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gang phyir 'dus pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Because apart from a mere collection

original: blo yis dngos po gzung du med //
analyzed: blo yis dngos po gzung du med //
translated: The mind does not apprehend things,

original: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // rang bzhin med par nga smra'o //
analyzed: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // rang bzhin med par nga smra'o //
translated: Therefore I say that it is empty, unarisen, And essenceless.

original: 'di la rkyen gyis cung zad kyang //üîΩskye ba dang ni 'gag pa med //
analyzed: 'di la rkyen gyis cung zad kyang // skye ba dang ni 'gag pa med //
translated: Here there is not the slightest thingüîΩThat arises or ceases.

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa yang //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa yang //
translated: Arising and cessation

original: rkyen rnams kho na 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kho na 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Only conditions are so.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus pa dang tshoms dang tshogs las ma gtogs par dngos po rdzas su gyur pa gzung du med pa de'i phyir dngos po rdzas su grub pa nyid med pas don dam par stong pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med par nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus pa dang tshoms dang tshogs las ma gtogs par dngos po rdzas su gyur pa gzung du med pa de'i phyir dngos po rdzas su grub pa nyid med pas don dam par stong pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin med par nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since no substantial entity is apprehended apart from the collection, the assembly, and the accumulation, therefore, since substantial establishment does not exist, I say that ultimately it is empty, unborn, and essenceless.

original: 'di la rkyen rnams kyi dngos po rdzas su yod pa gzhan cung zad kyang skye ba dang 'gag par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di la rkyen rnams kyi dngos po rdzas su yod pa gzhan cung zad kyang skye ba dang 'gag par mi byed de /
translated: Here, conditions do not cause the production or cessation of any other substantial entity.

original: tha snyad du skye ba dang 'gag par brjod pa yang rkyen @40b rnams kho nar zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du skye ba dang 'gag par brjod pa yang rkyen @40b rnams kho nar zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Also, conventionally, production and cessation are said to be conditions alone.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par sa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par sa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here is the statement of the proof: Earth should be known not to be substantially existent ultimately.

original: de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If its cause does not appear, it does not appear.

original: gang rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: That which does not appear if its cause does not appear does not ultimately exist substantially,üîΩlike an army, etc.

original: dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na dmag pa sogs pa dag ni rgyud bung rnam bzhi la sogs pa dag mi snang na de dag kyang mi snang bas don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa yang de'i rgyu kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyis bsdus
analyzed: dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na dmag pa sogs pa dag ni rgyud bung rnam bzhi la sogs pa dag mi snang na de dag kyang mi snang bas don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sa yang de'i rgyu kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyis bsdus
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example of the similar class, respectively.üîΩFor example, an army, etc., do not appear if the four divisions, etc., do not appear, and therefore do not ultimately exist substantially.

original: pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dag mi snang na nge yang mi snang ba'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam dag mi snang na nge yang mi snang ba'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, earth does not ultimately exist substantially, because it does not appear if the mere collection of form, sound, etc., included in its cause, which is the nature of color and shape, does not appear.

original: de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i phyogs la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du yang sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo dang sgra'i phyogs la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du yang sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
translated: So too, one should state the appropriate in regard to the side of awareness and terms.

original: don dam par sa'i blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i glo bzhin no //üîΩyang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: don dam par sa'i blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i glo bzhin no // yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
translated: Here, as before, there is another syllogism: ultimately, the awareness of earth is not a consciousness that has as its object a substantial thing, because it is an awareness, like the awareness of a forest, and so on.

original: don dam par sa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Or, there is another syllogism: ultimately, the term earth is not a term that has as its object a substantial thing,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: because it is a term, like the term army, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes ci rigs par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: And since consciousness and mental factors are also to be refuted in the same way by the reason of having the same nature as what is to be established, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: yang na gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa de dag ma gtogs par de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dmigs su med de rang gi rgyus bzung na de gzung du med pa ni gzugs kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu
analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa de dag ma gtogs par de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dmigs su med de rang gi rgyus bzung na de gzung du med pa ni gzugs kyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni yang na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu
translated: Or, apart from those causes of form and so on, no other form is observed, for if it is apprehended by its cause, it is not apprehended as form.üîΩOr, apart from those causes of form, such as earth and so on, no other derivative form is observed.

original: sa la sogs pa de dag ma gtogs par sa la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dmigs su med de zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di'i sgo nas kyang 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par @41a * //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de dag ma gtogs par sa la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dmigs su med de zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di'i sgo nas kyang 'byung ba'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan par @41a * //
translated: From this perspective, the essencelessness of primary elements should be taught.

original: bya'o ; / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o ; / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de gzung du med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de gzung du med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if the elements such as earth that are the cause of derivative form are not apprehended, derivative form is not apprehended.

original: de ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba sgrub pa'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the property to be established that proves the essencelessness of derivative form.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Here the statement of the proof is: Ultimately, form is not different from its own parts,

original: de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims su sbyar te /
analyzed: de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang dpe yin par go rims su sbyar te /
translated: because if it is not apprehended, the cognition of it does not exist, just like the self of earth and so on. These are the subject, the property to be established, the property that establishes it, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid dag ma bzung na sa la sogs pa de dag gi blo med pa'i phyir rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa
analyzed: dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid dag ma bzung na sa la sogs pa de dag gi blo med pa'i phyir rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa
translated: For example, the nature of earth and so on is not different from its component parts, such as color and shape, because if they are not apprehended, the cognition of earth and so on does not occur.

original: de bzhin du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de'i blo med pa'i phyir rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de'i blo med pa'i phyir rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, derived form is not different from its component parts, such as earth and so on, because if they are not apprehended, the cognition of derived form does not occur.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re 'dir khyed dbu ma pas gzugs phyogs su byas pas de la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa nyid med pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re 'dir khyed dbu ma pas gzugs phyogs su byas pas de la ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa nyid med pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste /
