translated: Here, others say that since you MƒÅdhyamikas take form as the subject, since it is devoid of conceptuality, it is not apprehended, and therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause the cognition of that does not occur if it is not apprehended,‚Äù is not established.

original: dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: For example, sound is impermanent.

original: mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de mi 'grub pa de bzhin du khyed kyi gtan tshigs gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes byar yang rung ba zhig na de yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de mi 'grub pa de bzhin du khyed kyi gtan tshigs gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes byar yang rung ba zhig na de yang mi 'grub po //
translated: Likewise, your reason ‚Äúform is not different from its own parts‚Äù is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩma bzung na zhes bya ba ni blo'i chos yin pas gal te 'dir blo phyogs su byas na ni blo des gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / ma bzung na zhes bya ba ni blo'i chos yin pas gal te 'dir blo phyogs su byas na ni blo des gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes
translated: Why?üîΩIf the mind does not apprehend the cause of form, then the mind of form does not exist.üîΩIf form is not apprehended, then the mind of form does not exist.üîΩIf the mind does not apprehend the cause of form, then the mind of form does not exist.

original: byar yang rung ba zhig na ma bzung na zhes bya ba gzugs kyi chos ma yin la 'dir gzugs phyogs su byas nas gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin
analyzed: byar yang rung ba zhig na ma bzung na zhes bya ba gzugs kyi chos ma yin la 'dir gzugs phyogs su byas nas gzugs kyi rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin
translated: If form is not apprehended, then the mind of form does not exist.

original: te zhes bya ba'i @41b gtan tshigs de'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: te zhes bya ba'i @41b gtan tshigs de'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: 'dir bya ba las la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: 'dir bya ba las la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Since it is thought that the action abides in the object, it is not the case that the meaning of the reason is not established because it is a property of the mind.

original: 'di ltar bya ba ni gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba ni gnyis la gnas te /
translated: Thus action abides in two things.

original: dper na gcad pa'i bya ba gcod pa po la gnas pa dang bcad pa la gnas pa de bzhin du ma bzung ba'i bya ba yang byed pa po'i blo la gnas pa dang / las gzugs la gnas pa dag las skabs 'dir ma bzung ba'i bya ba de las gzugs la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de ni las gzugs kyi chos ma yin gyi byed pa po'i blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs
analyzed: dper na gcad pa'i bya ba gcod pa po la gnas pa dang bcad pa la gnas pa de bzhin du ma bzung ba'i bya ba yang byed pa po'i blo la gnas pa dang / las gzugs la gnas pa dag las skabs 'dir ma bzung ba'i bya ba de las gzugs la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de ni las gzugs kyi chos ma yin gyi byed pa po'i blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs
translated: Here, the action of not apprehending is considered to be based on the object form. Therefore, since what is called not apprehending is not a phenomenon of the object form but a phenomenon of the mind of the agent, my reason

original: kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: is not unestablished.

original: 'di skad bstan te pha rol po zer ba ltar ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de las gzugs kyi chos yin na ni gzugs kyis rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de mi 'grub par yang 'gyurüîΩba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te pha rol po zer ba ltar ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de las gzugs kyi chos yin na ni gzugs kyis rang gi rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de mi 'grub par yang 'gyurüîΩba zhig na /
translated: This is explained as follows: If what is called not apprehending were a phenomenon of the object form, as the opponent says, then the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause if form does not apprehend its cause, there would be no cognition of form‚Äù would not be established.

original: 'dir kho bos ma bzung ba zhes bya ba'i bya ba de las gzugs la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de byed pa po blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir blos gzugs kyi rgyu de ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo de med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'dir kho bos ma bzung ba zhes bya ba'i bya ba de las gzugs la gnas pa yin par bsams pas ma bzung ba zhes bya ba de byed pa po blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir blos gzugs kyi rgyu de ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo de med pa'i phyir
translated: Here, since the action called ‚Äúnot apprehending‚Äù is thought to be the basis of form, that which is called ‚Äúnot apprehending‚Äù is a quality of the mind, the agent. Therefore, if the mind does not apprehend the cause of form, the mind of form does not exist.

original: gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Here, since the action called not apprehended is thought to be the basis of form, the meaning of the reason form is not different from its own collection of parts is not unestablished because the so-called not apprehended is a quality of the agent mind and if the mind does not apprehend the cause of form, the mind of form does not exist.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say: Since earth and so on are not different from form and so on, that reason is not established.

original: grangs can dag na re gzugs la sogs pa dag las sa la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pas de ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re gzugs la sogs pa dag las sa la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pas de ni grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grangs can dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say: In our scriptures it says:

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Since sattva, rajas, and tamas are permanent and all-pervading, all things are not different.

original: gcig pa nyid yin par grub pas khyed dbu ma pa gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes sgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no zhes zer ba yin no //üîΩde skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis don bzang po ma yin te gzhan nyid @42a * //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid yin par grub pas khyed dbu ma pa gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes sgrub pa de ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin no zhes zer ba yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis don bzang po ma yin te gzhan nyid @42a * //
translated: Since it is established that they are the same, your argument, ‚ÄúForm is not different from its own components,‚Äù is a fault of proving what is already established.

original: dgag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po 'dod pa'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po 'dod pa'i gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThat is not good because the refutation of difference does not teach nondifference and because the nondifference that the opponent asserts is not accepted.‚Äù

original: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste gzhan nyid dgag pas byas pa ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du gzhan ma yin pa nyid ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / khyod snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bos med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste gzhan nyid dgag pas byas pa ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du gzhan ma yin pa nyid ston par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / khyod snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Because we do not refute nondifference by refuting difference through the method of absolute negation, and because you assert that all things are not different,

original: gcig pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'dod pa de kho bos khas ma blangs pa'i phyir kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pas khyod kyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'dod pa de kho bos khas ma blangs pa'i phyir kho bo grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin pas khyod kyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: but are the same, because they are permanent and all-pervading by nature, consisting of sattva, rajas and tamas, and we do not accept that, we are not establishing what is already established. Therefore your objection is not good.

original: bye brag pa dag gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du rgol bar byed de /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas argue that the reason is not established.

original: mar me ma bzung yang de las gzhan pa yod na bum pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las tshig gi don drug po dag ni lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du
analyzed: mar me ma bzung yang de las gzhan pa yod na bum pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa dag na re kho bo cag gi gzhung las tshig gi don drug po dag ni lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du
translated: the Vaiseikas say that in our scriptures the six categories are different from each other, like an iron and a gold smith.

original: gzhan nyid yin pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa na re gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin pas de'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa na re gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, you Madhyamikas say that form is not different from its own components becauseüîΩif one does not apprehend it, one would not apprehend its light, for example, like the self of earth and so on.

original: de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir dper na sa la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning of your reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar mar me ni bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir mar me med kyang mar me de las gzhan pa nor bu dang / 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu yod na bum pa gsal bar byed cing bum pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma bzung na de'i blo med
analyzed: 'di ltar mar me ni bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir mar me med kyang mar me de las gzhan pa nor bu dang / 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu yod na bum pa gsal bar byed cing bum pa la de'i blo yod pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de ma bzung na de'i blo med
translated: Thus because the butterlamp is the cause that illuminates the vase, therefore even without the butterlamp, if there is a cause that illuminates the vase, such as a jewel, light rays, medicine, the moon, the sun, and so on, then the vase is illuminated and the cognition of the vase exists.

original: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore your reason, ‚Äúbecause the cognition of that does not exist,‚Äù is not established.

original: ci re zhig gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa de dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ram 'on te bum pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu
analyzed: ci re zhig gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa de dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ram 'on te bum pa'i gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu
translated: If, on the other hand, you say that because the cognition of form does not exist when the parts of its collection, such as earth, are not apprehended, then form is not different from the parts of its collection, or if you say that because the cognition of the vase does not exist when the cause that illuminates the vase, such as a lamp, is not apprehended, then the vase is not different from the cause that illuminates the vase, such as the lamp, then you have accepted our position.

original: mar me ma bzung yang gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na bum pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro @42b zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: mar me ma bzung yang gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na bum pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir gzugs rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa'i phyir ro @42b zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: If the mind that perceives a vase exists even without apprehending a lamp, then form would be different from the parts of its collection because another cause of illumination exists.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.üîΩBecause it is certain that the mind that perceives a lamp does not exist.

original: de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na de'i blo yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir
analyzed: de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dang mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na de'i blo yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir
translated: Even without a lamp, if the light of a jewel, light rays, medicine, the moon, or the sun exists, the mind that perceives it exists.

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is not uncertain because the property of the countering example does not exist.

original: kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi klan ka de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi klan ka de yang bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because our reason is not indefinite, your criticism is not good.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /üîΩgal te gzugs kyi rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa de dag bzung na yang gzugs kyi blo yod la /
analyzed: de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin te / gal te gzugs kyi rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa de dag bzung na yang gzugs kyi blo yod la /
translated: Because it is ascertained that the cognition of form does not exist when they are not apprehended, it is not indefinite.üîΩIf the cognition of form exists when the components of its collection, such as earth, are apprehended, and the cognition of form exists when they are not apprehended, then it would be indefinite.

original: de dag ma bzung na yang gzugs kyi blo yod na ni des na ma nges par 'gyur ba dang / dper na snam bu'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag rgyu spun dag bzung na yang bum pa'i blo med la de dag ma bzung na yang bum pa'i blo med pa lta bu yin na yang ma nges pa nyid yin gyi kho bos ni gzugs kyi rang gi tshogs
analyzed: de dag ma bzung na yang gzugs kyi blo yod na ni des na ma nges par 'gyur ba dang / dper na snam bu'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag rgyu spun dag bzung na yang bum pa'i blo med la de dag ma bzung na yang bum pa'i blo med pa lta bu yin na yang ma nges pa nyid yin gyi kho bos ni gzugs kyi rang gi tshogs
translated: For example, if the components of its collection, such as thread, are apprehended, there is no cognition of a cloth, and if they are not apprehended, there is no cognition of a cloth.üîΩBut it is indefinite.

original: pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa kho na'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa kho na'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because if the parts such as earth are not apprehended, there is no cognition of form, and because it is definitely stated that form is not different from its own parts, my reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di la pha rol po dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa'i chos de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba de med pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: 'di la pha rol po dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa'i chos de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba de med pa'i phyir yang /
translated: Here, in the opponent's position that the Madhyamika's reason is unestablished, because the Madhyamika's probandum is not apprehended, there is definitely no cognition of it.

original: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na de'i blo yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na de'i blo yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sgrub pa'i chos med pa'i phyir
translated: In order to show that the Madhyamika's reason is not unestablished, it is said that even without a butter lamp, if there is the light of a jewel, a ray, a medicine, the moon, or the sun, there is a cognition of it. Therefore, because the probandum does not exist in the discordant class,

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But it is not indeterminate.

original: khyed bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la ni bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na bum pa'i blo yod par 'dod pas des ni dbu ma pa'i
analyzed: khyed bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la ni bum pa gsal bar byed pa'i byed pa'i rgyu mar me med kyang nor bu dang 'od zer dang sman dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba yod na bum pa'i blo yod par 'dod pas des ni dbu ma pa'i
translated: In your Vaise~ika position, even though the illuminating cause, the lamp, does not exist, the pot is apprehended when the gem, the light ray, the medicine, the moon, and the sun are present.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la yang dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gzugs kyi @43a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag pa dag gi phyogs la yang dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa'i chos gzugs kyi @43a * //
translated: Therefore, even in the Vaise~ika position, which is contrary to the Madhyamaka position, the property of the probandum of the Madhyamaka is established.üîΩThis is because, if the collection of the parts of form, such as the earth element, are not apprehended, then the cognition of form does not exist.

original: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba de med pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba de med pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya
translated: Since this is certain, the meaning of our Madhyamaka reason is not indeterminate.

original: ba de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ba de ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is because, if that is not apprehended, the cognition of that does not exist.

original: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kho bos gzugs ni byed pa'i rgyu dag lasüîΩgzhan ma yin te /üîΩbyed pa'i rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir zhes khyad par med pa'i dam bcas pa nye bar ma bzung gi 'di ltar gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kho bos gzugs ni byed pa'i rgyu dag las gzhan ma yin te / byed pa'i rgyu ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir zhes khyad par med pa'i dam bcas pa nye bar ma bzung gi 'di ltar gzugs ni rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the light is not a part of the collection of the vase because the special thesis ‚Äúit is not different from its own parts‚Äù is stated.üîΩWe do not state the special thesis ‚Äúform is not different from its causes of form‚ÄùüîΩbecause if the causes of form are not apprehended, the cognition of form does not exist.üîΩWe state the special thesis ‚Äúform is not different from its own parts‚Äù

original: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi skyed pa'i rgyu tshogs pa'i yan lag dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir rang
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir ro zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir gzugs ni rang gi skyed pa'i rgyu tshogs pa'i yan lag dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pa'i phyir rang
translated: because if its own parts are not apprehended, the cognition of form does not exist.

original: gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par bsgrubs pas des na mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par bsgrubs pas des na mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Since it is established that the lamp is not different from the collection of its parts, the lamp is not a part of the collection of the pot‚Äôs own parts.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause that illuminates it.

original: des na bum pa yang rang gi skyed pa'i rgyu 'jim pa dang 'khor lo la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par grub bo //
analyzed: des na bum pa yang rang gi skyed pa'i rgyu 'jim pa dang 'khor lo la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin par grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the pot is established as not different from the collection of its own parts, such as the clay and the wheel that give rise to it.

original: 'o na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu dag las bum pa gzhan nyid yin pas de lta na yang dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu dag las bum pa gzhan nyid yin pas de lta na yang dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But since the pot is different from the causes that illuminate it, in that case the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason is not established.

original: de'i lan du 'og nas /üîΩgang dang gang yang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'og nas / gang dang gang yang lhan cig tu //
translated: In response to that, Candrakƒ´rti teaches below:üîΩIt is not tenable

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: for anything to be different from anything else.

original: zhes ston pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir don dam par mar me las bum pa gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes ston pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir don dam par mar me las bum pa gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since there is no counterexample, he says that because the pot is not established ultimately as different from the lamp, the reason is not unestablished.

original: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid ma yin
analyzed: rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa khyad par can nye bar gzung ba'i phyir mar me ni bum pa'i rang gi tshogs pa'i yan lag ma yin pas dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid ma yin
translated: Since the special thesis is stated, the butterlamp is not a part of the assembly of the pot, and therefore the meaning of the Madhyamaka reason is not indeterminate.

original: pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only that,üîΩbecause later, in the chapter on the examination of contact,

original: 'di ltar 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs nas kyang /üîΩgang dang @43b gang yang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs nas kyang / gang dang @43b gang yang lhan cig tu //
translated: it will be shown thatüîΩIt is not tenable for anything

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: to be different from anything else.

original: zhes ston par 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan nyid ces bya ba med pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes ston par 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan nyid ces bya ba med pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because the discordant position called ‚Äúdifference‚Äù does not exist, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: don dam par mar me dang bum pa gnyi ga ma skyes bas mar me la bum pa gzhan pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par mar me dang bum pa gnyi ga ma skyes bas mar me la bum pa gzhan pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Also, because ultimately both the butterlamp and the pot are unarisen, the butterlamp is not established as different from the pot, and therefore the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gal te dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag la rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par rab tu sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gi dpe ma grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: gal te dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag la rtsom pa yod pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par rab tu sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gi dpe ma grub bo zhe na zhes bya ba ni
translated: If you say that the examples of the inferences that prove that earth and so on do not exist substantially are not established because such things as armies that are wholes exist,

original: pha rol po dag na re sngar dbu ma pas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi blo dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin par bsgrub pa'i dpe dmag la sogs pa las blangs pa gang yin pa de ni ma grub par rgol ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re sngar dbu ma pas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs kyi blo dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin pa dang / gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin par bsgrub pa'i dpe dmag la sogs pa las blangs pa gang yin pa de ni ma grub par rgol ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: then you are saying that the examples that the Madhyamaka previously used to prove that form that is an element or an element derivative does not exist substantially, that the cognition of form does not have a substantially existent object, and that the word form does not have a substantially existent object are not established.

original: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa dang / seng ldeng dang nim pa la sogs pa dag yod pa de dag ni dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa gang dag la yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa dang / seng ldeng dang nim pa la sogs pa dag yod pa de dag ni dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag ces bya ste /
translated: An army, a forest, and so on are called substances that possess parts because they have parts such as horses and elephants and parts such as acacia trees and neem trees.

original: de dag la rtsom pa'i yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa seng ldeng dang nim pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pas dbu ma pas sa
analyzed: de dag la rtsom pa'i yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa seng ldeng dang nim pa la sogs pa dag yod pa'i phyir dmag la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas dag ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin pas dbu ma pas sa
translated: The Madhyamaka say that since the substances that possess parts, such as an army, have parts such as horses and elephants and parts such as acacia trees and neem trees, they are ultimately substantially existent.

original: la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dag dang / gzugs kyi blo dang gzugs kyi sgra rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gi dpe dmag la sogs pa las blangs pa de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dag dang / gzugs kyi blo dang gzugs kyi sgra rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag gi dpe dmag la sogs pa las blangs pa de ma grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the examples of the inferences that prove that form derived from the elements and form derived from the great elements and the words and thoughts of form are not substantially existent are not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dmag gi yan lag dag ni dmag ces bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis dmag gi yan lag dag ni dmag ces bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of this commentary says: The army‚Äôs divisions are not the substantial entity of the army, the possessor of the parts, because they are parts.

original: yan lag yin pa'i phyir dper na shing gi yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yan lag yin pa'i phyir dper na shing gi yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa dag bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, the parts of a tree, such as the roots, trunk, branches, twigs, and so on.

original: 'di la rigs pa can dag gis smras pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za ba'i @44a * //üîΩsgrub pa ni yang sgrub pa la ltos par bya'o zhes bya ba yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa can dag gis smras pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za ba'i @44a * // sgrub pa ni yang sgrub pa la ltos par bya'o zhes bya ba yod pas /
translated: Here, the reason is not established in any of the characteristics stated by the NaiyƒÅyikas, and the proof is doubtful.

original: de'i phyir kho bos dpe snga ma de nyid yang sgrub pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bos dpe snga ma de nyid yang sgrub pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the author of this commentary says that the former example should be proven by another proof.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the property to be proven, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na shing gi yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa dag ni kun rdzob tu yan lag yin pa'i phyir don dam par shing zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa
analyzed: dper na shing gi yan lag rtsa ba dang sdong po dang yal ga dang yal ga phra mo la sogs pa dag ni kun rdzob tu yan lag yin pa'i phyir don dam par shing zhes bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa
translated: For example, the parts of a tree, such as the roots, trunk, branches, twigs and so on, are not ultimately the substantial basis of the whole tree, because they are parts conventionally.

original: de bzhin du dmag gi yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa dag kyang kun rdzob tu yan lag yin pa'i phyir don dam par dmag ces bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas dpe ma grub pa ma yin no
analyzed: de bzhin du dmag gi yan lag rta dang glang po che la sogs pa dag kyang kun rdzob tu yan lag yin pa'i phyir don dam par dmag ces bya ba yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas dpe ma grub pa ma yin no
translated: Similarly, the parts of an army, such as horses, elephants and so on, are not ultimately the substantial basis of the whole army, because they are parts conventionally. Therefore the example is not unestablished.

original: // yang na glang po che dag la yongs su rdzogs pa de'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: // yang na glang po che dag la yongs su rdzogs pa de'i yan lag gang yin pa de ni shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag rtsom par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, the parts of a complete elephant are not the substantial basis of a chariot, horse and so on,

original: de la med pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin pas dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de la med pa'i phyir dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa bzhin pas dpe med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan yin te /
translated: because they do not exist in them, like the threads and so on that are their causes. Therefore the example is not nonexistent. This is another inference.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa ni shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir de dag shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rgyu spun la sogs pa ni shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir de dag shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag rtsom par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, since the causes such as the threads do not exist in the chariot and horse, etc., they do not compose the chariot and horse, etc.

original: glang po che dag la yongs su rdzogs par yod pa glang po che'i yan lag sna dang mche ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shing rta dang rta la sogs pa de dag la med pa'i phyir shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag
analyzed: glang po che dag la yongs su rdzogs par yod pa glang po che'i yan lag sna dang mche ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang shing rta dang rta la sogs pa de dag la med pa'i phyir shing rta dang rta la sogs pa dag
translated: Likewise, since the parts of an elephant, such as the trunk and tusk, which exist completely in an elephant, do not exist in the chariot and horse, etc.,

original: rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not compose the chariot and horse, etc. Therefore my example is not nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du /üîΩgzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Similarly,üîΩapart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi rung ngo //
translated: the cause of form is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag nye bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos dag nye bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar /
translated: Here, as before, one should state the proof and the probandum and the inferential evidence in detail, as follows:

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: form is not observed.

original: zhes bya bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtag pa'i skabs su de ltar @44b na 'dis gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos sa la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang / gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs brtag pa'i skabs su de ltar @44b na 'dis gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos sa la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang / gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med par bstan to //
translated: In the context of the analysis of derivative form, it was said that ‚Äúapart from the cause of form, form is not observed.‚Äù This shows that the probandum of form is the mere collection of the elements, earth, and so on, and that the probandum of form is its own cause, because without apprehending its cause, the cognition of form does not occur.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis te dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis te dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: The examples are the army, the forest, and so on.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inference is as follows: Ultimately, form does not exist substantially.

original: rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without apprehending its cause, the cognition of form does not occur.

original: 'di na gang rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang rang gi rgyu ma bzung na de'i blo med pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te dper na dmag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Here, that which does not have the cognition of it when its cause is not apprehended does not substantially exist, like an army, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyang rang gi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ma bzung na gzugs kyi blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, form also does not substantially exist, because when its causes, earth, etc., are not apprehended, the cognition of form does not exist.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs kyi blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs kyi blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Or, there is another syllogistic reason: ultimately, the cognition of form does not have an object that is a substantially existent thing,

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is a cognition, like the cognition of a forest, etc.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par gzugs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Or, there is another syllogistic reason: ultimately, the word ‚Äúform‚Äù does not have an object that is a substantially existent thing,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: because it is a word, like the word ‚Äúarmy,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag nye
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag nye
translated: And since consciousness and mental factors are also to be refuted in the same way by the reason of the homogeneity of the object to be established, the reason is not indeterminate.üîΩHaving applied the object to be established and the establishing property, the extensive explanation of inference is just like that.

original: bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir /
analyzed: bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir /
translated: In the same way, here:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: The cause of form is not seen.

original: zhes bya bas 'byung ba'i gzugs brtag pa'i skabs su de ltar na 'dis 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'byung ba'i gzugs brtag pa'i skabs su de ltar na 'dis 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi bsgrub par bya ba chos gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam nyid dang 'byung ba'i gzugs kyi sgrub pa'i chos gzugs la sogs pa mi snang na sa la sogs pa de
translated: In the context of investigating the form of the elements, thus, this shows that if the form of the elements, the object to be established, is merely the aggregation of form and so on, and the establishing property of the form of the elements is the nonappearance of form and so on, then those elements such as earth

original: dag kyang mi snang bar bstan to //
analyzed: dag kyang mi snang bar bstan to //
translated: would also not appear.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis te /
translated: The example is by the power of that.

original: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: army, forest, etc.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Here is the syllogism: Earth should be understood not to exist as a substance ultimately,

original: de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause does not appear when it does not appear.

original: gang rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyu mi snang na de mi snang ba de ni don dam par rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not appear when its cause does not appear does not exist as a substance ultimately,

original: dper na dmag la @45a * //üîΩsogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dmag la @45a * // sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like an army, etc.

original: de bzhin dus yang rang gi rgyu la dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag ma bzung na sa'i blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin dus yang rang gi rgyu la dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dag ma bzung na sa'i blo med pas rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, time also does not exist as a substance, because the idea of earth does not exist when its cause, shape, etc., are not apprehended.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
translated: Or, there is another syllogism:

original: don dam par sa'i blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te ;
analyzed: don dam par sa'i blo ni dngos po rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te ;
translated: The idea of earth does not have as its object a thing that exists as a substance ultimately,

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na nags tshal la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is an idea, like the idea of an army, etc.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par sa zhes bya ba'i sgra de ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de don dam par sa zhes bya ba'i sgra de ni tshig gi don rdzas su yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Or else, there is another path of proof: ultimately, the word ‚Äúearth‚Äù does not signify a substance that is the object of a word,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir dper na dmag la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: because it is a word, like the word ‚Äúarmy‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag nye
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang sems las byung ba dag kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos dag nye
translated: Consciousness and mental factors are to be refuted in the same way, because they are similar to what is to be established. Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bar sbyar nas rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Having thus applied the property of the probandum and the property of the logical reason, inference should be stated extensively.üîΩJust as form and so on are not different, earth and so on are not different from form.

original: ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sa la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ci ltar rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sa la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes
translated: Just as derivative form is not different from earth and so on,

original: med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste bshad pas sa la sogs pa dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag dang gcig pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du ma bstan pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dang rgyur byas
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste bshad pas sa la sogs pa dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag dang gcig pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du ma bstan pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dang rgyur byas
translated: Since it is explained by the method of nonassertion, it is not taught by the method of negation, ‚ÄúEarth and so on are the same as form derived from the elements.‚Äù

original: pa'i gzugs las gzhan ma yin no zhes med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste bshad pas sa la sogs pa dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang gcig pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: pa'i gzugs las gzhan ma yin no zhes med par dgag pa'i tshul yongs su bzung ste bshad pas sa la sogs pa dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang gcig pa nyid yin no zhes ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul du bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: Likewise, since it is explained by the method of nonassertion, ‚ÄúEarth and so on are not different from form derived from the elements,‚Äù it is not taught by the method of negation, ‚ÄúEarth and so on are the same as form derived from the elements.‚Äù

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin par bshad pas gcig pa nyid du bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan ma yin par bshad pas gcig pa nyid du bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it taught that they are the same by explaining that they are not different?

original: de'i phyir 'og nas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang 'gog pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang 'gog pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To answer that, the text says, ‚ÄúBecause nondifference is also refuted.‚Äù

original: 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs nas gcig pa nyid kyang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og nas phrad pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs nas gcig pa nyid kyang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because later, in the chapter on the examination of contact, we will refute identity.

original: gal te gzhan ma yin par bshad pas gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan ma yin par bshad pas gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na ci nyes she na /
translated: If it is asked what is wrong if it is explained that they are not different and are identical,

original: de'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis 'o ma yang zho nyid du 'gyur ba 'am zho yang 'o ma @45b nyid du 'gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis 'o ma yang zho nyid du 'gyur ba 'am zho yang 'o ma @45b nyid du 'gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is unacceptable that milk would be yogurt or yogurt would be milk.‚Äù

original: gal te gcig pa nyid du 'don na 'o ma yang zho dang gcig pa nyid dang zho yang 'o ma dang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon du gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid du 'don na 'o ma yang zho dang gcig pa nyid dang zho yang 'o ma dang gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i skyon du gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: If it is asserted that they are identical, then the error would occur that milk would be identical to yogurt and yogurt would be identical to milk.

original: de ltar na mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa bkag pas gcig pa nyid du bsgrubs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'dod pas de'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa bkag pas gcig pa nyid du bsgrubs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that is unacceptable, therefore nondifference is not established by refuting difference.

original: de ltar gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin la gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de nyid kyis ci grub ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan pa nyid kyang ma yin la gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de nyid kyis ci grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked what is established by the fact that they are neither different nor identical,

original: de'i phyir / gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the noble La·πÖkƒÅkƒÅra S≈´tra says:üîΩ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of thingsüîΩAs either the same or different,

original: ci ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: ci ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: As either produced or destroyed,üîΩOr as either existent or nonexistent.‚Äù

original: dngos po gzhan ma yin pa dang // tshogs las gzhan pa gang na'ang med //üîΩces gsungs pa de grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan ma yin pa dang // tshogs las gzhan pa gang na'ang med // ces gsungs pa de grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of things as either the same or different‚Äù is established.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las de skad ces gsungs pa de grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las de skad ces gsungs pa de grub pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of things as either the same or different‚Äù is established because it is stated in the noble S≈´tra on Entering La·πÖka in this way.üîΩ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of things as either the same or different‚Äù is established because it is stated in the noble S≈´tra on Entering La·πÖka in this way.üîΩ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of things as either the same or different‚Äù is established because it is stated in the noble S≈´tra on Entering La·πÖka in this way.

original: ci ltar byis pa grangs can dag gis gcig pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa dang / byis pa bye brag pa dag gis gzhan pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa de ltar dngos po gcig pa nyid kyang med la rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa gzhan yang rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' gang na yang med doüîΩzhes gsungs pa de grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar byis pa grangs can dag gis gcig pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa dang / byis pa bye brag pa dag gis gzhan pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa de ltar dngos po gcig pa nyid kyang med la rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las logs shig na rdzas su grub pa gzhan yang rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' gang na yang med doüîΩzhes gsungs pa de grub pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not conceive of things as either the same or different‚Äù is established because it is stated in the noble S≈´tra on Entering La·πÖka in this way.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye mched rnams rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye mched rnams rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: The cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: The cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //
translated: The cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas ci ltar brtags pa de'i phyir ni sngar rang gi sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas ci ltar brtags pa de'i phyir ni sngar rang gi sde pa dag na re /
translated: The reason is stated as follows:

original: don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin te phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.üîΩThe cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.üîΩThe reason is stated as follows:üîΩForm is not observed apart from the cause of form.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pos ma bsdus te dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung pos ma bsdus te dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: The cause of form is not seen apart from what is called form.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni phung pos bsdus pa yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la ni phung pos bsdus pa yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal sense bases are included in the aggregates because:

original: gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus la /
translated: the ten physical sense bases are included in the form aggregate,

original: chos kyi skye mched ni phung po gsum dang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus /üîΩyid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni phung po gsum dang gzugs kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus / yid kyi skye mched ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos bsdus so //
translated: the phenomena sense base is included in three aggregates and part of the form aggregate,
and the mind sense base is included in the consciousness aggregate.üîΩThe reason you stated that the internal sense bases exist ultimately is not established.

original: gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de don dam par sgrub na ni don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you prove that reason ultimately, it is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If you prove it conventionally, it is contradictory.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par yang gzugs yod do zhes shes par byar mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par yang gzugs yod do zhes shes par byar mi nus te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You cannot know that form exists apart from the cause of form.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi skyed pa'i rgyu sa la sogs pa dag med pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang med de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi skyed pa'i rgyu sa la sogs pa dag med pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang med de /
translated: Since the cause that generates derivative form, such as earth, does not exist, derivative form does not exist.

original: don dam par rgyur byas pa ni gzugs yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam par rgyur byas pa ni gzugs yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no reason to establish that form exists ultimately as a cause.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa med par yang gzugs yod par rnam par rtog na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa med par yang gzugs yod par rnam par rtog na'o //
translated: But if one imagines that form exists without a cause such as earth,üîΩif one imagines that, that is also not tenable.

original: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas de bsal ba'i phyir /üîΩgzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de ltar rtog na de yang mi rung ste 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas de bsal ba'i phyir / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: In this context, the treatise-writer states the following in order to refute that:üîΩApart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par //
analyzed: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par //
translated: form would be without a cause in form.

original: thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It follows that

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ste /
translated: the cause of form is the cause of the existence of form.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa'i phyir me'i rgyu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na me'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni me nyid me'i rgyu ma yin gyi me'i yod pa nyid kyi rgyu bud shing la sogs pa gzhan yin pa las yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa'i phyir me'i rgyu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na me'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni me nyid me'i rgyu ma yin gyi me'i yod pa nyid kyi rgyu bud shing la sogs pa gzhan yin pa las yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya
translated: Because the middle term existence is elided, it is called the cause of fire.

original: ba'i bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir me'i rgyu zhes brjod pa bzhin du gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba yang gzugs nyid gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin gyi gzugs kyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa gzhan yin pa las /
analyzed: ba'i bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir me'i rgyu zhes brjod pa bzhin du gzugs kyi rgyu zhes bya ba yang gzugs nyid gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin gyi gzugs kyi yod pa nyid kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa gzhan yin pa las /
translated: Similarly, the cause of form is not form itself, but rather the cause of the existence of form, which is another thing, such as earth.

original: yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the middle term existence is elided, it is called the cause of form.

original: de ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par te /
analyzed: de ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par te /
translated: Except for that means except for the cause of form.

original: gzugs yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rgyu med par zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis gzugs yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzugs na zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam las rnam pa de lta bu de 'dod na'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par dam bcas pa tsam las gzugs rnam pa de lta bu de yod par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rgyu med par zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis gzugs yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzugs na zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa tsam las rnam pa de lta bu de 'dod na'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par dam bcas pa tsam las gzugs rnam pa de lta bu de yod par 'dod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a cause for demonstrating the existence of form‚Äù means without a cause for establishing the existence of form.üîΩ‚ÄúIn the form realm‚Äù means if you assert that form exists in that way, merely on the basis of a thesis.

original: gzugs ni rgyu med par /
analyzed: gzugs ni rgyu med par /
translated: ‚ÄúForm would be without a cause‚Äù means without a reason.

original: thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa med par zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'thad pa med par zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt follows‚Äù means without a proof.

original: gal te gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs @46b par gzugs yod pa nyid du 'dod na gzugs 'thad pa'i rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs @46b par gzugs yod pa nyid du 'dod na gzugs 'thad pa'i rgyu med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: If you assert that form exists merely on the basis of a thesis without a cause for form, the error arises that form is without a cause for its existence.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par smra bar 'gyur ba de yang mi 'dod pas te 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag kyang dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par smra bar 'gyur ba de yang mi 'dod pas te 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag kyang dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar mi 'dod la /
translated: ‚ÄúNor is that acceptable‚Äù means that it is not acceptable to advocate that things arise without a cause, because Buddhists do not accept that things arise without a cause,

original: 'jig rten pa dag kyang dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag kyang dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye bar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and worldly people do not accept that things arise without a cause.

original: ci skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam 'gal ba nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rgyu yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam 'gal ba nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe fault that has been stated cannot be averted‚Äù means that the meaning of the reason proving that the cause of form exists remains unestablished or contradictory.

original: rgyu med par smra ba gang dag dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba gang dag dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who advocate that things arise without a cause accept that all things arise only without a cause.

original: gzugs 'grub pa yang de dag dang 'dra'o zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la sogs pa gang dag rgyu med par smra ba dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag la ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do /
analyzed: gzugs 'grub pa yang de dag dang 'dra'o zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la sogs pa gang dag rgyu med par smra ba dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag la ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa med do /
translated: then the Lokayatas and so on who advocate causelessness would say, We have no fault in our assertion.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skyes par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzugs rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa yang dngos po gzhan dag rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa de dag dang 'dra bas kho
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis ni dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skyes par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzugs rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa yang dngos po gzhan dag rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa de dag dang 'dra bas kho
translated: Because we assert that all things arise from no cause at all, the establishment of form arising from no cause is similar to the establishment of other things arising from no cause.

original: bo cag gi phyogs la ni khyed kyis ci skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: bo cag gi phyogs la ni khyed kyis ci skad smras pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault you mention does not exist in our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la bshad pa /üîΩgal te 'ga' zhig ci skad smras pa'i rnam pa lta bur gyur na ni de yang /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de la bshad pa / gal te 'ga' zhig ci skad smras pa'i rnam pa lta bur gyur na ni de yang /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here explains:üîΩIf something were like the way it is described, it would be suitable.

original: rung ba zhig na don gang yang //
analyzed: rung ba zhig na don gang yang //
translated: But no object

original: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med //
translated: There is no cause whatsoever.

original: des na dpe med pa'i phyir smra ba de yang grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des na dpe med pa'i phyir smra ba de yang grub pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, because there is no example, your statement is not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de la 'di skad ces bshad par bya ste /üîΩgal te khyed na re dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir gzugs 'grub pa yang de dag dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba'i dpe dngos po 'ga' zhig rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar ci skad smras pa'i rnam pa
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de la 'di skad ces bshad par bya ste / gal te khyed na re dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir gzugs 'grub pa yang de dag dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba'i dpe dngos po 'ga' zhig rgyu med pa kho na las skye bar ci skad smras pa'i rnam pa
translated: To that statement, this should be said:üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúBecause we accept that all things arise only without a cause, the establishment of form is similar to that,‚Äù then what is the example of some thing that arises only without a cause?

original: de lta bur gyur na ni gzugs rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa de yang rung ba zhig na khyed kyis dper bya ba'i dngos po phyi dang nang gi don gang yang rgyu med pa kho na las skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'
analyzed: de lta bur gyur na ni gzugs rgyu med pa las skye bar 'grub pa de yang rung ba zhig na khyed kyis dper bya ba'i dngos po phyi dang nang gi don gang yang rgyu med pa kho na las skye ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'
translated: If it were like that, then the establishment of form arising without a cause would be tenable. However, you have not given any example of an external or internal object that arises only without a cause.

original: dang mtho ris dang sa'i steng gang na yang med pa'i phyir rgyu med par smra ba de la yang grub pa med do //
analyzed: dang mtho ris dang sa'i steng gang na yang med pa'i phyir rgyu med par smra ba de la yang grub pa med do //
translated: Because it does not exist anywhere in the higher realms or on the earth, the theory of causeless arising is also unestablished.

original: kho bos dang po nyid @47a * //
analyzed: kho bos dang po nyid @47a * //
translated: We have already refuted the theory of causeless arisingüîΩat the outset. Therefore, it is not a real thing.

original: du yang rgyu med par smra ba dag bsal zin pas de ni dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs dag gcig yod du zin na ni des na kho bos 'dir de dag dgag par yang bya dgos pa zhig
analyzed: du yang rgyu med par smra ba dag bsal zin pas de ni dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs dag gcig yod du zin na ni des na kho bos 'dir de dag dgag par yang bya dgos pa zhig
translated: If the position of the proponents of causeless arising were to exist, then we would have to refute them here.

original: na kho bos rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: na kho bos rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa'i skabs su /
translated: But we have already refuted them in the chapter on conditions.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,üîΩNowhere do any things

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: ever arise.

original: zhes bya bas dang po nyid du yang rgyu med par smra ba dag bsal zin pas 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs dag nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas des na kho bos 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs med pa de dag
analyzed: zhes bya bas dang po nyid du yang rgyu med par smra ba dag bsal zin pas 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs dag nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod pa ma yin pas des na kho bos 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs med pa de dag
translated: the positions of the proponents of causeless arising do not exist, like a flower in the sky.üîΩTherefore, since there is no position of the proponents of causeless arising that we need to refute,

original: yang dgag mi dgos pas de'i phyir 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs las glengs te smra ba de ni don po ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dgag mi dgos pas de'i phyir 'dir rgyu med par smra ba'i phyogs las glengs te smra ba de ni don po ma yin no //
translated: it is pointless to debate with the proponents of causeless arising.

original: gang dag grangs can gyi tshul la mkhas su re bas 'di skad ces khyod kyis sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes smras pas /
analyzed: gang dag grangs can gyi tshul la mkhas su re bas 'di skad ces khyod kyis sa la sogs pa dag gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes smras pas /
translated: Those who are skilled in the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system say, ‚ÄúYou say that earth and so on are not different from form and so on.

original: de dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pas des na don dam par sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: de dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pas des na don dam par sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus te /
translated: Since you accept that they are not different, you can understand that ultimately earth and so on exist substantially.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi gzhung 'dzin pa gang dag grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' las snying stobs dang rdul dang
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi gzhung 'dzin pa gang dag grangs can gyi grub pa'i mtha' las snying stobs dang rdul dang
translated: If you say that the elements are not different from form and so on, like the intrinsic reality of form and so on,

original: / mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i tshul la mkhas su re bas de dag dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces dbu ma pa khyod sa la sogs pa 'byung ba
analyzed: / mun pa'i rang bzhin ni rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba'i tshul la mkhas su re bas de dag dbu ma pa la 'di skad ces dbu ma pa khyod sa la sogs pa 'byung ba
translated: then you are a SƒÅ·πÉkhya who holds the SƒÅ·πÉkhya treatise, because the SƒÅ·πÉkhya tenets state that since sattva, rajas, and tamas are permanent and all-pervading, all things are the same.

original: chen po bzhi po dag kyang 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag kyang 'dod cing /
analyzed: chen po bzhi po dag kyang 'dod pa gzugs la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dag kyang 'dod cing /
translated: You say that the four great elements such as earth and so on are asserted to be the cause of the form of desire realm gods and so on,

original: khyod kyis sa la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes kyang smras pas /
analyzed: khyod kyis sa la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes kyang smras pas /
translated: and you say that they are not different from earth and so on.

original: des na don gyis go ba las sa la sogs pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa gcig pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pas des na don dam par sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus te
analyzed: des na don gyis go ba las sa la sogs pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa gcig pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin pas des na don dam par sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus te
translated: Therefore, in fact, you accept that earth and so on are not different from form and so on, and that they are the same.

original: / gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba yin te /
analyzed: / gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes zer ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, you should understand that ultimately earth and so on are substantially existent because they are not different from form and so on, just like the intrinsic reality of form and so on.

original: de dag gi sgrub pa de @47b dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa de @47b dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
