translated: You should apply their proof statements to the subject, the predicate, the logical reason and the example, respectively.üîΩFor example, the intrinsic reality of form and so on is substantially existent ultimately because it is not different from form and so on.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan
translated: Likewise, earth and so on are also not different from form and so on.

original: nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nyid ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par rdzas su yod par shes par byar nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is not itself, it is ultimately known to exist substantially.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis ci skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary here states: ‚ÄúBecause nondifference is not established in the manner stated, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dpe yang med de gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dpe yang med de gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is also no example, because the intrinsic reality of form and so on is refuted.‚Äù

original: kho bos sngar ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa dag ma yin te /üîΩ'og nas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang 'gog pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis 'o ma yang zho nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: kho bos sngar ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa dag ma yin te / 'og nas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang 'gog pa'i phyir dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis 'o ma yang zho nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Just as form and so on are not different, earth and so on are not different from form and so on.

original: zho yang 'o ma nyid du 'gyur na ni rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zho yang 'o ma nyid du 'gyur na ni rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nondifference will be refuted later and because if nondifference is correct, then milk would be yogurt or yogurt would be milk.

original: de'i phyir / gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du //
translated: The one and the other

original: ci ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: ci ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: Are not as they are imagined by the childish.üîΩThings are not different, nor is there anything

original: dngos po gzhan pa ma yin dang // tshogs las gzhan pa gang na'ang med //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan pa ma yin dang // tshogs las gzhan pa gang na'ang med //
translated: Apart from the collection.üîΩThis is established in the manner explained above.

original: ces gsungs ba de grub pa yin no zhes ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid bkag pas grangs can gyi gzhan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no
analyzed: ces gsungs ba de grub pa yin no zhes ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid bkag pas grangs can gyi gzhan pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs kyi don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no
translated: Since the one and the other are refuted, the difference of the Samkhyas is not established. Therefore, your reason is not established with regard to any of the three modes.

original: // khyod kyi dpe yang med de don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // khyod kyi dpe yang med de don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Your example does not exist because the intrinsic reality of form and so on is refuted in an ultimate sense.

original: kho bo la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe ma grub pas khyod la dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yang yod //
analyzed: kho bo la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe ma grub pas khyod la dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon yang yod //
translated: Since the example, ‚Äúlike the intrinsic reality of form and so on,‚Äù is not established for us, you have the fault of an unestablished subject in the example.

original: gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Others say: Earth and so on exist in an ultimate sense.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because their effects exist.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Here, if something does not exist, its effect cannot be apprehended, just as a sky flower cannot.

original: sa la sogs pa bdag la ni 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa bdag la ni 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Earth and so on have effects such as form and so on. Therefore,üîΩearth and so on exist.

original: sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'di pha rol po dag @48a * //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'di pha rol po dag @48a * //
translated: This is what the opponent says.

original: 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa'i sgo nas rgyu sa la sogs pa dag yod par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa'i sgo nas rgyu sa la sogs pa dag yod par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: They prove the existence of causes such as earth and so on on the grounds that their effects such as form and so on exist.

original: de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba'i tshig de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The words of their syllogism are as follows: The subject, earth and so on, exist because their effects, such as form and so on, exist. The subject is earth and so on, the predicate to be proven is the property of the subject, the property of the probandum is the property of the proof, the example is the dissimilar class, the application is the application, and the conclusion is the conclusion.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary explains here:

original: gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: If the cause of form exists

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
translated: apart from form,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
translated: then the cause would be without an effect.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: But there is no cause without an effect.

original: kho bo'i phyogs la gal te gzugs ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa zhig yod na ni des na 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: kho bo'i phyogs la gal te gzugs ma gtogs par gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa zhig yod na ni des na 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: In our system, if the cause of form, such as earth, exists apart from form, then that cause would be without an effect.

original: 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause would be without an effect characterized by form and so on.üîΩBecause they are different, like a bamboo and so on.

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir rtsi rkyang la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag dbu ma pa'i phyogs la don dam par 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du grub pas /
translated: In our Madhyamaka system, form that originates from the elements is established as lacking entityness ultimately.

original: gal te khyed gzugs ma gtogs par don dam par gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te khyed gzugs ma gtogs par don dam par gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa dag yod par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the cause of form, such as earth, exists ultimately apart from form,üîΩthen the cause would be without an effect.

original: de lta na gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa de dag gzugs las tha dad par gzhan du gyur pa yin par khas blangs pa des na gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa de dag gzugs las tha dad par gzhan du gyur pa yin par khas blangs pa des na gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa de dag 'bras bu med pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since you accept that the causes of form, such as earth, are different from form, they would be without effect.

original: 'bras bu gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba las gyur pa dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba las gyur pa dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
translated: The characteristics of form, sound, and so on, which arise from the elements, are ultimately essenceless.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa 'byung ba dag ni don dam par yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa 'byung ba dag ni don dam par yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But you assert that the causes of form, such as earth, the elements, ultimately exist.

original: 'on te 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag ni kun rdzob tu yod la /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag ni kun rdzob tu yod la /
translated: But if you assert that the effects, such as form, exist conventionally,

original: rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ni don dam par yod par 'dod na /
analyzed: rgyu sa la sogs pa dag ni don dam par yod par 'dod na /
translated: and that the causes, such as earth, exist ultimately,

original: de lta na yang gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: then in that case, the causes of form would not be earth and so on,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa ni gzugs las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir dper na rtsi rkyang la sogs pa ni gzugs las gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they would be different, just as, for example, a bamboo is different from form.

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam pa yin na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam pa yin na /
translated: Just as the cause of form does not exist, so too earth, etc.

original: gzugs kun rdzob pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kun rdzob pa las gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If they are ultimate, they are not the cause of form because they are different from the conventional form.

original: 'bras bu med par rgyu yod pa ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par rgyu yod pa ni ma mthong ste /
translated: A cause without an effect is not seen.

original: de'i phyir / @48b 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / @48b 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúa cause without an effect does not exist.‚Äù

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This means that the cause of form, etc., is the nature of the aggregation of form, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa'i rgyu de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rgyu de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the cause of earth, etc., is the nature of the aggregation of form, etc., and therefore it is ultimately natureless.

original: de'i phyir rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, like the cause, the effect is also not established.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu sa la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu sa la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason, earth and so on, is also the nature of the aggregation of form and so on.

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin par dgongs pa de'i phyir rgyu sa la sogs pa yang ma grub la 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir sngar gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa yod paüîΩkho yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin par dgongs pa de'i phyir rgyu sa la sogs pa yang ma grub la 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir sngar gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa yod pa kho yin te /
translated: Because it is the intention of the Buddha that ultimately it is without entityness, therefore the reason, earth and so on, is not established and the effect, form and so on, is not ultimately established.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de gang yang rung ba lam grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don de gang yang rung ba lam grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: The error of the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason previously stated, ‚Äúbecause their effects exist,‚Äù still exists.üîΩThe error of the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason previously stated, ‚Äúbecause their effects exist,‚Äù still exists.

original: phyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te gtan tshigs kyi don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa de spang ba'i phyir dbu ma pa dang pha rol po rang
analyzed: phyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te gtan tshigs kyi don gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa de spang ba'i phyir dbu ma pa dang pha rol po rang
translated: If you state what is renowned in the world as a reason, then it is contradictory to your own beliefs.

original: la yang kun rdzob tu sa la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni khyed don dam par sgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: la yang kun rdzob tu sa la sogs pa de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni khyed don dam par sgrub pa dang don 'gal ba nyid yin te /
translated: If you state what is renowned in the world as a reason in order to avoid the fault of not establishing any of the meanings of the reason, then it is contradictory to your own beliefs to ultimately prove that earth and so on are the effects of the elements.

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs de rnam pa de dag gis sun phyung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs de rnam pa de dag gis sun phyung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúyour reason is undermined by these aspects.‚Äù

original: sun dbyung ba'i lan gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i lan gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There is another response to the critique.

original: 'di la gzugs kyi rgyu zhig brtag na gzugs yod pa 'am med pa la brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi rgyu zhig brtag na gzugs yod pa 'am med pa la brtag grang na /
translated: If you investigate the cause of form, you may investigate whether form exists or does not exist.

original: gnyi ga la yang mi 'thad par bshad pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang mi 'thad par bshad pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBoth are untenable‚Äù explains

original: gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i lan gzhan ston to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba'i lan gzhan ston to //
translated: Another response to the critique of the untenability of the cause of form is taught.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //üîΩdon dam par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yod par brtag na /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro // don dam par rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyu sa la sogs pa 'byung ba dag yod par brtag na /
translated: Here means in an ultimate sense.üîΩIf you imagine that the cause of derivative form, the elements such as earth, exist in an ultimate sense,

original: gzugs yod pa'am med pa la rgyu la sogs pa la don dam par yod par brtag grang na /
analyzed: gzugs yod pa'am med pa la rgyu la sogs pa la don dam par yod par brtag grang na /
translated: then you must imagine that the cause of form and so on exists ultimately in the context of form and so on existing or not existing.

original: phyogs gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga yang mi 'thad par bshad pa ston to //
translated: But both positions are untenable. This is taught.

original: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: If form exists,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //üîΩyod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu yod pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid // yod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu yod pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: the cause of form is untenable.

original: gzugs @49a * //
analyzed: gzugs @49a * //
translated: If form exists, the cause of form is untenable, because it exists, like, for example, an existing pot or cloth.üîΩThis shows that

original: yod pa la gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: yod pa la gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa nyid bstan te /
translated: the cause of form is untenable if form exists.

original: gzugs yod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu yod pa la de'i rgyu mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa'i phyir dper na bum pa dang snam bu yod pa la de'i rgyu mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: If form exists, the cause of form is untenable, because it exists, like, for example, the cause of an existing pot or cloth.

original: ci ste med na yang /
analyzed: ci ste med na yang /
translated: But if you imagine that form does not exist,

original: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: then the cause of form is untenable if form does not exist.

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: The cause also would not be tenable.

original: sa la sogs pa 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'dod pa ste //
translated: Earth and so on are asserted as causes,

original: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa nyid bstan te /
translated: but they are not tenable as causes because they do not exist prior to their effect, like something else.

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: The cause also would not be tenable.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ci zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gi don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the words?

original: sa la sogs pa rgyur 'dod pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rgyur 'dod pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin pa ste /
translated: Earth and so on are asserted as causes, but they are not tenable as causes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzugs skye ba'i sngon rol ma skyes pa'i dus na gzugs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs skye ba'i sngon rol ma skyes pa'i dus na gzugs med pa'i phyir /
translated: Why?

original: dper na gzugs med pa de las gzhan pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la rgyu yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na gzugs med pa de las gzhan pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la rgyu yod par mi 'thad pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because form does not exist prior to the arising of form, like something else, such as a sky flower, which does not exist prior to the arising of form.

original: 'dir skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i sun dbyung ba rjes su bzlas pas sun dbyung bar brjod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par bstan pa'i sun dbyung ba rjes su bzlas pas sun dbyung bar brjod par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the refutation taught in the chapter on nonarising should be repeated as a refutation.

original: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: If form exists,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: The cause of form is not tenable.

original: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: If form does not exist,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //üîΩces bshad pa'i skabs 'dir sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par /
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid // ces bshad pa'i skabs 'dir sngar rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed par /
translated: The cause of form is not tenable.

original: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i don la yang //
translated: In this context, the refutation taught in the chapter on conditions should be repeated as a refutation.

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //üîΩmed na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: A condition is not tenableüîΩFor a nonexistent or existent object.üîΩIf it does not exist, what would be a condition?

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what would a condition do?

original: zhes bstan pa'i sun dbyung ba rjes su bzlas pas /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i sun dbyung ba rjes su bzlas pas /
translated: The refutation should be repeated as follows:üîΩA cause is not tenable

original: med dam yod pa'i gzugs la yang //üîΩrgyu ni 'thad pa ma yin te //üîΩmed na gang gi rgyur yang 'gyur //
analyzed: med dam yod pa'i gzugs la yang // rgyu ni 'thad pa ma yin te // med na gang gi rgyur yang 'gyur //
translated: For a nonexistent or existent form.üîΩIf it does not exist, what would be a cause?

original: yod na rgyu yis ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes sun dbyung ba brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yod na rgyu yis ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes sun dbyung ba brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: If it exists, what would a cause do?

original: rgyu med par smra ba dag rgyu med pa kho na'o zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba dag rgyu med pa kho na'o zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Because those who advocate causelessness say, ‚ÄúThings arise only without cause,‚Äù this is explained for their sake.

original: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
translated: Form that lacks a cause

original: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
analyzed: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
translated: is untenable, and not tenable.

original: rkun rdzob tu yang de khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la sogs pa rgyu med par smra ba dag na re dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bas /
analyzed: rkun rdzob tu yang de khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la sogs pa rgyu med par smra ba dag na re dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa kho na las skye bas /
translated: The master‚Äôs intention is that because the LokƒÅyatas and so on, who advocate causelessness, say, ‚ÄúAll things arise only without cause,

original: gzugs kyang rgyu med pa kho na las skye'o zhes zer bas de dag dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis @49b tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyang rgyu med pa kho na las skye'o zhes zer bas de dag dgag pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis @49b tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
translated: and form also arises without cause,‚Äù this first half of the verse is explained in order to refute them.

original: rgyu med pa can gyi phyogs de ni kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs nas /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can gyi phyogs de ni kun rdzob tu yang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs nas /
translated: The master‚Äôs intention is that because the position of causelessness is not accepted even conventionally,

original: de ni tha chad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin no zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
analyzed: de ni tha chad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin no zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
translated: Because it is utterly vile, it is not tenable and is not suitable.

original: yang na bye brag tu smra ba dag ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs kyang yod do zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang na bye brag tu smra ba dag ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs kyang yod do zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Or, because Vaibhasikas say that future form exists, this is explained for them.

original: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
translated: Form without a cause

original: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
analyzed: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
translated: is not tenable and is not suitable.üîΩBecause it is not established that form that has not obtained its own nature without taking up the cause of future arising exists even conventionally.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa ni tha snyad du yang yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes zer ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba thams cad yod par smra ba
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa ni tha snyad du yang yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes zer ba ni nyan thos bye brag tu smra ba thams cad yod par smra ba
translated: This is the assertion of all sravaka Vaibhasikas who assert that all exists.

original: dag na re dngos po thams cad ni dus thams cad du yod pa yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer bas de'i phyir de dag kyang rgyu med par smra ba dag dang mtshungs pa dag kho na yin pas de dag
analyzed: dag na re dngos po thams cad ni dus thams cad du yod pa yin pas ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer bas de'i phyir de dag kyang rgyu med par smra ba dag dang mtshungs pa dag kho na yin pas de dag
translated: Therefore they are similar to those who advocate causeless arising.

original: dgag pa'i phyir yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyir gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyir gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
translated: In order to refute them, the master's statement is explained here:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gang gis rang gi skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs shing rang gi skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa de ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang gtan med pa yin pas yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gang gis rang gi skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs shing rang gi skye ba'i rgyu ma blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi dngos po ma thob pa de ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du yang gtan med pa yin pas yod par mi 'grub pa'i phyir
translated: Since future form does not obtain its own entity because it does not obtain the cause of its arising, it is utterly nonexistent even conventionally and it is not established as existent.

original: ro zhes bya bar dgongs nas /
analyzed: ro zhes bya bar dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking this,

original: de yang tha chad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
analyzed: de yang tha chad kho na yin pa'i phyir 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de rung ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes yang dang yang du nges par bzung ste bshad do //
translated: Since that is the case, it is not tenable, it is not suitable, to say that form is the nature of the primary elements and derivative form.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa /
translated: Since form that is the nature of the primary elements and derivative form is untenable in every way,

original: de phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog /'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
analyzed: de phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog /'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
translated: therefore you should not conceive of any conception of form.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa dang / rgyu med pa'i gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs kyi rgyu ma gtogs par gzugs dmigs par mi 'gyur ba dang / gzugs yod pa dang med pa la yang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa dang / rgyu med pa'i gzugs ni 'thad par mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: Since form is not observed apart from the cause of form, and since the cause of form is untenable whether form exists or does not exist, and since form that lacks a cause is not suitable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang rnam par brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'ga' yang rnam par brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: therefore you should not conceive of any conception of form.

original: 'di ltar gnas med pa la brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas med pa la brtag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to investigate what is not a basis.

original: gang zag ci lta bus gzugs kyi rnam par brtag par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ci lta bus gzugs kyi rnam par brtag par mi bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of person should not investigate form?

original: de la re zhig gang zag ci lta bus rnam par brtag par mi bya ba @50a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang zag ci lta bus rnam par brtag par mi bya ba @50a * //
translated: To explain what kind of person should not investigate, it says:

original: bstan pa'i phyir mkhas pa chos kyi de kho na rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs par 'dod pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gang chos kyi de kho na rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs par 'dod pa dmigs pa med pa'i don yang dag par yul la dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas rnam par
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir mkhas pa chos kyi de kho na rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs par 'dod pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas zhes bya ba smras te / byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gang chos kyi de kho na rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs par 'dod pa dmigs pa med pa'i don yang dag par yul la dmigs pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas rnam par
translated: Even a wise person who desires to realize the reality of phenomena, free from conceptualization, by opening the eye of right knowledge,

original: brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: should not investigate with the eye of knowledge that is opened by the correct view, the object of which is the meaning of non-apprehension, in the manner of non-apprehension of the object.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang dag la rnam par brtag par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa gang dag la rnam par brtag par mi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the conceptualizations of form that should not be investigated, it says:

original: gzugs rdzas su yod pa dang / rgyu las gzhan pa dang / rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa dang / de dag la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye ba la sogs pa yul gyi rnam par rtog pa mang po zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzugs rdzas su yod pa dang / rgyu las gzhan pa dang / rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa dang / de dag la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye ba la sogs pa yul gyi rnam par rtog pa mang po zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The many conceptual thoughts about objects are called the various conceptual thoughts about form, such as form existing as a substance, being different from its cause, not being different from its cause, and so on, as well as the various conceptual thoughts about color and shape.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang ci lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang ci lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what those conceptual thoughts about form are like, it is said:

original: bu ma btsas pa'i rmi lam na bu'i gzugs dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul dag mthong nas sad pa lta bu zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bu ma btsas pa'i rmi lam na bu'i gzugs dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul dag mthong nas sad pa lta bu zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They are like seeing the form of a son in a dream before he is born and seeing his behavior and so on.

original: dper na mo gsham dmus long ma bu btsas ma myong ba dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul mthong ma myong ba'i rmi lam na rang gi bu btsas pa dang mig mthong ba rmis nas rang gi bu kha dog dang dbyibs mtha' yas
analyzed: dper na mo gsham dmus long ma bu btsas ma myong ba dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul mthong ma myong ba'i rmi lam na rang gi bu btsas pa dang mig mthong ba rmis nas rang gi bu kha dog dang dbyibs mtha' yas
translated: For example, it is like a barren woman or a blind person who has never given birth to a son and has never seen the color, shape, behavior, and so on of a son seeing in a dream that she has given birth to a son and seeing his color and shape.

original: pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa la rnam par brtags pa dang / spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul la longs spyod pa mang po la rnam par brtags nas gnyid sad pa'i dus na rang gi bu btsas pa yang med mig gis mthong ba yang med rnam par brtags pa yang med par shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa la rnam par brtags pa dang / spyod pa la sogs pa'i yul la longs spyod pa mang po la rnam par brtags nas gnyid sad pa'i dus na rang gi bu btsas pa yang med mig gis mthong ba yang med rnam par brtags pa yang med par shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: Having imagined the form of a son and having imagined the many enjoyments of the object of conduct and so forth, when one awakens from sleep, one knows that one has no son, one has not seen with one's eyes, and one has not imagined.

original: byis pa 'khor ba na phyin ci log gis ba slang pa'i blo la gzugs rdzas su yod pa dang rgyu las gzhan pa dang / rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dag mthong ba las gang gi tshe chos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs shing yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas mi
analyzed: byis pa 'khor ba na phyin ci log gis ba slang pa'i blo la gzugs rdzas su yod pa dang rgyu las gzhan pa dang / rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dag mthong ba las gang gi tshe chos kyi de kho na nyid rnam par rtog pa dang legs par bral ba rtogs shing yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig yang dag par bye bas mi
translated: In the same way, in cyclic existence, the childish, due to the power of error, see the object, form, as substantially existent, as other than the cause, as not other than the cause, and so forth. When one realizes the reality of phenomena, which is free from such imagination, and when one opens the eye of correct knowledge, one sees that all objects are like a son in a dream.

original: skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa de'i tshe na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin med par mthong bas de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa de'i tshe na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin med par mthong bas de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: When one obtains forbearance for the dharma of non-production, at that time one sees that the conceptual thoughts of form and so on are essenceless. Therefore, one should not conceptualize such conceptual thoughts.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas 'khor ba'i gnyid las sad pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa'i yul la dmigs pa @50b med pas de la rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas 'khor ba'i gnyid las sad pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa'i yul la dmigs pa @50b med pas de la rnam par brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since one obtains forbearance for the dharma of non-production, one awakens from the sleep of cyclic existence. Therefore, one should not conceptualize the objects of observation in the state of cyclic existence, because one is free from observing them. This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúone should not conceptualize them.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ci skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ci skad smras pa'i skyon dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the cause of form is untenable in this way, one is not free from the faults stated above. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid so na gnas pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po sum cu gnyis pa /
analyzed: sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid so na gnas pa yin no /üîΩ// / bam po sum cu gnyis pa /
translated: The meaning of the previously stated reason is not established, and the meaning is contradictory.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di na rgyu'i yon tan snga na yod pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu la yang yon tan mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gang dag 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di na rgyu'i yon tan snga na yod pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu la yang yon tan mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gang dag 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, here, since the qualities of the cause exist prior to the effect, the qualities of the effect are seen in sequence.üîΩBut it is not tenable to state,

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes //üîΩbya ba 'thad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes // bya ba 'thad pa ma yin te //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is similar to the cause.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe effect is similar to the cause.‚ÄùüîΩThe cause itself is not the effect.

original: rgyu de 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa'i sgo nas gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bu yin par mi 'thad pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang gzugs kyi rgyu mi 'thad pa'i sgo nas gzugs 'byung ba rnams kyi 'bras bu yin par mi 'thad pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This and other such statements demonstrate that it is not tenable that the elements are the effect of form, since the cause of form is not tenable.

original: de yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi yon tan sra ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang tsha ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dag snga na yod pa'i rim gyis phyi'i 'bras bu rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag yod par mthong bar mtshan nyid kyis rang gi sde pa dang /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'di na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi yon tan sra ba nyid dang gsher ba nyid dang tsha ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid dag snga na yod pa'i rim gyis phyi'i 'bras bu rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'byung ba'i yon tan de dag yod par mthong bar mtshan nyid kyis rang gi sde pa dang /
translated: The qualities of the elements exist in external derived form, such as earth, water, fire and air, which are seen to arise in sequence.

original: phyi rol pa gang dag 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra bas gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa dag kyang yod la gzugs kyang de dag gi 'bras bu yin pas don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas
analyzed: phyi rol pa gang dag 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra bas gzugs kyi rgyus la sogs pa dag kyang yod la gzugs kyang de dag gi 'bras bu yin pas don dam par rdzas su yod pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa'i phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas
translated: Some Buddhist schools and non Buddhists say: The cause and effect are similar because the causes of form such as earth exist and form is their effect, therefore they ultimately exist substantially.üîΩTo refute that, the treatise states:

original: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains the first half of the verse.

original: gal te rgyu'i yon tan dag 'bras bu la yang yod pa yin na des na rgyu nyid 'bras bu yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta bu yang ma yin pas de'i phyir rgyu de nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i yon tan dag 'bras bu la yang yod pa yin na des na rgyu nyid 'bras bu yin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta bu yang ma yin pas de'i phyir rgyu de nyid 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: If the qualities of the cause also exist in the effect, then the cause itself would be the effect. But since that is not so, therefore the cause itself is not the effect.üîΩHere, the thesis is the quality that is asserted to be the cause, and the quality that proves it is taught to be similar. This is the explanation of the first half of the verse.üîΩHere, the thesis is the quality that is to be proven.üîΩThe opponent asserts that the elements such as earth are the cause of form.üîΩThe quality that proves it is taught to be similar.

original: // 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang sgrub pa'i chos 'dra bar bstan pa nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa'i skabs 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos ni
analyzed: // 'dir ni bsgrub par bya ba chos smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang sgrub pa'i chos 'dra bar bstan pa nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'di bshad pa'i skabs 'dir bsgrub par bya ba chos ni
translated: The thesis is the quality that is to be proven.üîΩThe opponent asserts that the elements such as earth are the cause of form.üîΩThe quality that proves it is taught to be similar.üîΩThe thesis is the quality that is to be proven.üîΩThe opponent asserts that the elements such as earth are the cause of form.

original: pha rol po gzugs kyi rgyur smra bar 'dod pas la sogs par 'byung ba dag gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol po gzugs kyi rgyur smra bar 'dod pas la sogs par 'byung ba dag gzugs kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The quality that proves it is taught to be similar.üîΩThe thesis is the quality that is to be proven.

translated: When the opponent wishes to speak, at that time, the blue cloth of Devadatta, which is other than the cause of the blue cloth of Devadatta, is not the cause of the blue cloth of Devadatta.üîΩThat itself is established as the example for us.

original: grub pa ma yin no //

translated: Therefore my example is not established.

analyzed: kho bos rab tu byed pa'i gnas skabs thams cad du dgag pa bstan to cog ni med par dgag pa'i don yin gyi ma yin par dgag pa'i don ma yin pas 'dir don dam par smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu rgyu spun sngon po ni la ba sngon po'i

analyzed: des na skad cig ma snga ma mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba las skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba la ltos nas dper na mar me dang chu'i rgyun la sogs pa dag la ni rgyu'i skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba yin no // skad cig ma snga ma mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba las skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba la ltos nas dper na shing las thal ba 'byung ba dang 'o ma las zho 'byung ba la sogs pa dag la ni rgyu'i skad cig ma dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the later moment arising from the prior moment that is similar in type, the result is similar to the cause, for example, the prior moment of the cause is similar to the later moment of the flame and the stream of water and so on.
