analyzed: bya ba'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to state,üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is dissimilar to the cause.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra bar 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra bar 'dod pa'i phyogs dgag pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the refutation of the position that asserts the effect is dissimilar to the cause.

original: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba chos myu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid dang / sgrub pa'i chos mi 'dra bar bstan pa nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di bshad pa'i skabs 'dir yang bsgrub @52b par bya ba chos ni myu gu pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa'i 'brasüîΩbu ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ste /üîΩmyu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid ces nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba chos myu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid dang / sgrub pa'i chos mi 'dra bar bstan pa nye bar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di bshad pa'i skabs 'dir yang bsgrub @52b par bya ba chos ni myu gu pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba ste / myu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid ces nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The first half of the second verse is as follows:üîΩThe probandum is the fact that the sprout is not the effect of the seed, the cause desired by the opponent.üîΩThe probandum is stated to be the fact that the sprout is not the effect of the cause desired by the opponent.

original: sgrub pa'i chos ni 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra bar bstan zhes nye bar bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ni 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra bar bstan zhes nye bar bzhag pa yin no //
translated: The property of the probandum is stated to be the fact that the effect is not similar to the cause.

original: des na yan lag lhag ma yang snga ma bzhin du mngon no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pa des na 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i yan lag lhag ma chos mthun pa'i dpe yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: des na yan lag lhag ma yang snga ma bzhin du mngon no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar gzhag pa des na 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba nyid ma yin par bsgrub pa'i yan lag lhag ma chos mthun pa'i dpe yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: The remaining parts of the proof that the effect is not different from the cause are also as before.

original: sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bstan dgos par mngon te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos de'i dbang gis bstan dgos par mngon te /
translated: The example that is similar to the subject and the predicate of the probandum must be shown by the power of the subject and the predicate of the probandum.

original: gyo mo la sogs pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos myu gu pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba dag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gyo mo la sogs pa gang la bsgrub par bya ba chos myu gu pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / sgrub pa'i chos 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba dag yod pa yin no //
translated: The pot and so on, which are the subject and the predicate of the probandum, are the effect of the cause that the opponent wishes to state and the predicate of the probandum, ‚Äúthe effect is not different from the cause.‚Äù

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par myu gu ni smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par myu gu ni smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is: A sprout is not ultimately the effect of the cause that the opponent wishes to state because of being an effect.

original: mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag gi chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /üîΩdper na gyo mo la sogs pa ni pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag gi chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na gyo mo la sogs pa ni pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.üîΩFor example, potsherds and so on are not the effects of those, because they are dissimilar to the cause of those, such as grain, which the opponent wishes to state.

original: dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, a sprout is not the effect of those, because it is dissimilar to those, such as grain,üîΩwhich the opponent wishes to state as its cause.

original: ci ste yang 'bru ni myu gu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'bru ni myu gu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
translated: But if you say that grain is the cause of a sprout,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dper na rnga bo che'i sgra 'am nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa sa bon dagüîΩyin par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dper na rnga bo che'i sgra 'am nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu 'bru la sogs pa sa bon dag yin par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the proof that the effect is not similar to the cause.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The seed and so on are the subject, the probandum is the property, the proof is the property of the proof, and the example is in order.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu ni rnga bo che dang nas de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu ni rnga bo che dang nas de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley arise if the drum and barley exist,üîΩor the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley are designated by the drum and barley.

original: rnga bo che dang nas des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir rnga bo che dang nas ni rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i rgyu kho na yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang 'bru de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram 'bru des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i
analyzed: rnga bo che dang nas des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir rnga bo che dang nas ni rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu'i rgyu kho na yin pa de bzhin du myu gu yang 'bru de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ram 'bru des tha snyad 'dogs pa'i
translated: Just as the drum and barley are the cause of the sound of the drum and the sprout of barley, in the same way, the sprout arises if the seed exists, or the sprout is designated by the seed.

original: phyir 'bru ni myu @53a * //
analyzed: phyir 'bru ni myu @53a * //
translated: The seed is external.üîΩ

original: gu'i rgyu kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gu'i rgyu kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The seed is the cause of the sprout.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary states:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te skye ba can rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa thams cad du bkag pas dpe ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te skye ba can rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa thams cad du bkag pas dpe ma grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: That is not good, because the example is not established, since the arising of things that arise is completely refuted, and thus the fault of the incompleteness of the proof is present.

original: ci ltar kho bos 'bru dang myu gu dag bkag pa de bzhin du dngos po skye ba can thams cad kyi skye ba yang rnam pa thams cad du bkag pas rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa
analyzed: ci ltar kho bos 'bru dang myu gu dag bkag pa de bzhin du dngos po skye ba can thams cad kyi skye ba yang rnam pa thams cad du bkag pas rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa
translated: Just as I refute seeds and sprouts, so the arising of all things that arise is completely refuted. Since the sound of a great drum and the sprout of barley are not established, your proof

original: la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: la dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pas mi rung ste /
translated: has the fault of an incomplete example.üîΩTherefore it is not suitable.

original: des na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is the fault of contradiction, without error.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po
translated: Some say: Because the effect of the eyes and so on is dissimilar since the effect of the eyes is the dissimilar eye consciousness and so on, the reason dissimilar is indefinite.üîΩThis is the opponent's

original: dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ste /üîΩmig la sogs pa rgyu gzugs can shes pa med pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs med par shes pa yod pa mi 'dra ba dag 'byung ba'i phyir des na ci re zhig myu gu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir
analyzed: dag na re dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba ste / mig la sogs pa rgyu gzugs can shes pa med pa dag las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs med par shes pa yod pa mi 'dra ba dag 'byung ba'i phyir des na ci re zhig myu gu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir
translated: position because they say that the Madhyamaka reason dissimilar is indefinite.

original: myu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: myu gu smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Since dissimilar effects such as the formless eye consciousness and so on arise from causal form that is not consciousness, such as the eyes and so on, does that mean that a sprout is not the effect of a cause that is desired by the proponent of sprouts because the sprout is dissimilar to its cause?

original: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But since eye consciousness and so on are not similar to the eye and so on, eye consciousness and so on are the effect of the eye and so on.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro ;
translated: Therefore, the Madhyamaka reason called dissimilar is indeed indefinite.

original: / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here that is also not good.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid kyi skabs med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid kyi skabs med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since eye consciousness and so on are similar to the object of affirmation, they are to be refuted in the same way. Since there is no dissimilar class, there is no opportunity for it to be indefinite.

original: mig la sogs pa las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba 'byung bar 'dod pa de yang 'bru las 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'byung ba dgag par sgrub pa dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba 'byung bar 'dod pa de yang 'bru las 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'byung ba dgag par sgrub pa dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba
translated: Also, the assertion that the effect, such as visual consciousness, arises from the eye sense faculty and so on, is similar to the proof that refutes the arising of a dissimilar effect from a seed.üîΩTherefore it is to be refuted in the same way.

original: yin pa'i phyir 'bru las 'bras bu myu gu mi @53b 'dra ba mi skye ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mig la sogs pa las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba skye ba med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir 'bru las 'bras bu myu gu mi @53b 'dra ba mi skye ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mig la sogs pa las 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba skye ba med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
translated: Since a dissimilar effect such as a sprout does not arise from a seed, the arising of a dissimilar effect such as visual consciousness from the eye sense faculty and so on is not a counterexample to the reason.

original: kyi skabs med do //
analyzed: kyi skabs med do //
translated: Therefore my reason is not indeterminate.

original: yang na smra bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dag rgyu ma yin pas gzugs ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ci skad bstan pa'i
analyzed: yang na smra bar 'dod pa la sogs pa dag rgyu ma yin pas gzugs ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ci skad bstan pa'i
translated: Or else, since the desire to speak and so on are not causes, the object of the reason, ‚Äúbecause they exist,‚Äù is not established, or it is contradictory.

original: tshul dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
analyzed: tshul dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de bzhin du dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid
translated: Not only is there no fault of my reason being indefinite because there is no dissimilar instance,

original: kyi skyon med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: kyi skyon med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: but also there is no fault of my reason being unestablished.

original: sngar gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sngar gzhan dag na re don dam par sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Previously others said, ‚ÄúEarth and so on exist ultimately.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their effects exist.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Here if something does not exist, its effect is not apprehended, like a sky flower.üîΩBut because the effects of earth and so on, such as form, exist, therefore earth and so on exist.‚Äù

original: sa la sogs pa dag la ni 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i lan du bstan bcos mdzad pas /üîΩgal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag la ni 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir sa la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i lan du bstan bcos mdzad pas / gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: In response to that, the treatise states:üîΩIf form‚Äôs cause exists

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
translated: Without form existing,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
translated: The cause would be without an effect.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: There is no cause without an effect.

original: zhes bshad pas sa la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi
analyzed: zhes bshad pas sa la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi
translated: Thus, since earth and so on are by nature the collection of form and so on, they are essenceless. Therefore, like the cause, the effect is also not established. Thus, the reason stated earlier, ‚Äúbecause their effect exists,‚Äù

original: don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: has the fault of having a meaning that is not established.üîΩIf you say that what is commonly known is itself the reason, then it is contradictory.

original: spyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ci skad bstan pa'i tshul dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gal te gzhan dag na re don dam par 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin
analyzed: spyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes ci skad bstan pa'i tshul dang 'dra bar 'dir yang gal te gzhan dag na re don dam par 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa dag yod pa kho na yin
translated: In the same way that it was shown above, here, if others say, ‚ÄúIn reality, only grain and so on and eyes and so on exist,

original: te / de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their effects exist.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de /
translated: Here, if something does not exist, its effect is not apprehended,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa dag la ni 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs @54a * //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa dag la ni 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs @54a * //
translated: Because effects such as sprouts and eye consciousness and so on exist in seeds and eyes and so on, therefore seeds and eyes and so on definitely exist.

original: pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: pa dag yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If you say this,

original: de la yang /üîΩgal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de la yang / gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: then in response to that,üîΩif form exists

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
translated: without a cause of form,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
translated: then it would be a cause without an effect,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //üîΩzhes bya ba'i tshul nyid kyis 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do // zhes bya ba'i tshul nyid kyis 'bru la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas rgyu bzhin du 'bras bu yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir
translated: but there is no cause without an effect.

original: ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: ro zhes sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: In the same way, because seeds and so on and eyes and so on are by nature the collection of form and so on, they are also essenceless. Therefore, because the effect is not established like the cause, the error of the meaning of the reason being unestablished still exists.

original: spyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyir grags pa gtan tshigs nyid du brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: If you say that renown itself is the reason, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yin la mi 'dra ba yang yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yin la mi 'dra ba yang yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: An effect is both similar and dissimilar to its cause.üîΩThere is no example, because we accept that the active cause of a conditioned state is all active causes.

original: byed pa'i rgyus 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu ni thams cad yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re dbu ma pa'i dpe gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyus 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu ni thams cad yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag na re dbu ma pa'i dpe gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de
translated: This is what Vaibhasikas say: Madhyamikas say, for example, like a pot and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba stong pas ma grub po zhes zer ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba stong pas ma grub po zhes zer ba yin te /
translated: That is not established because the probandum is empty.

original: de dag na re 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag na re 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They say: An effect is twofold:

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yod la rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba yang yod la rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yod de /
translated: There are effects that are similar to their cause and effects that are dissimilar to their cause.

original: ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma states:

original: rang las gzhan pa byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: The active cause is other than itself.

original: zhes bshad pas 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu ni rang las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir des na gyo mo skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i chos thams cad ni gyo mo'i byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu ni rang las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir des na gyo mo skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i chos thams cad ni gyo mo'i byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, since it is accepted that the active cause of a conditioned phenomenon is all phenomena other than itself, then all phenomena that do not obstruct the arising of a pot are active causes of a pot.

original: de yang gyo mo skye ba'i rgyu bum pa ni 'bras bu dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang gyo mo skye ba'i rgyu bum pa ni 'bras bu dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, since a pot, which is the cause of the arising of a pot, is similar to its effect, it is similar to its effect.

original: gyo mo skye ba'i rgyu tho ba ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang mi 'dra ba yin pas 'bras bu rgyu 'dra ba las kyang skye la rgyu mi 'dra ba las kyang skye ba'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa na re don dam par myu gu
analyzed: gyo mo skye ba'i rgyu tho ba ni rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang mi 'dra ba yin pas 'bras bu rgyu 'dra ba las kyang skye la rgyu mi 'dra ba las kyang skye ba'i phyir khyed dbu ma pa na re don dam par myu gu
translated: Since a hammer, which is the cause of the arising of a pot, is dissimilar to its effect, it is dissimilar to its effect. Therefore, since it arises from a cause that is similar to its effect and from a cause that is dissimilar to its effect, a pot arises from a cause that is similar to its effect and from a cause that is dissimilar to its effect.üîΩYou Followers of the Middle Way say that ultimately sprouts

original: ni smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin te mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ni smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin te mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong par mi 'grub ste /
translated: The reason is not the effect of the cause of the desire to speak, because they are dissimilar, like a pot and so on.

original: gyo mo dang 'bru mi 'dra yang 'bru ni gyo mo skye ba la gegs mi byed pas gyo mo'i byed pa'i rgyu ni 'bru yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gyo mo dang 'bru mi 'dra yang 'bru ni gyo mo skye ba la gegs mi byed pas gyo mo'i byed pa'i rgyu ni 'bru yang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The example is not established as empty of the property of the thesis, because although a grain of barley and a pot are dissimilar, since the grain of barley does not obstruct the arising of the pot, the grain of barley is also a cause of the pot.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin @54b pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid 'gog par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin @54b pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid 'gog par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is asserted that the reason is the refutation of the special cause that generates a similar type, such as a unique cause.

original: kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo'i dpe med pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi klan ka de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: Because my example is not nonexistent, your criticism is not good.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bo ni 'bru la sogs pa 'bras bu rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa 'bras bu thug po che'i myu gu nyid skyed pa gzhan mi skyed ba dang / lhas byin gyi rgyud kyang lhas byin nyid skyed kyi gzhan mi skyed ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyu gang dag yin pa de dag gis 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa nyid du khyed 'dod pa de 'gog par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo ni 'bru la sogs pa 'bras bu rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa 'bras bu thug po che'i myu gu nyid skyed pa gzhan mi skyed ba dang / lhas byin gyi rgyud kyang lhas byin nyid skyed kyi gzhan mi skyed ba la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi rgyu gang dag yin pa de dag gis 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa nyid du khyed 'dod pa de 'gog par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: We do not refute the cause that produces a sprout of barley, for example, which is a cause that is not shared in common with other results, and which produces only a sprout of barley and not another result, or the continuum of Devadatta, which produces only Devadatta and not another.üîΩWe do, however, refute your assertion that such causes that are not shared in common with other results and that are qualified in this way are the causes that produce their results.

original: rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can dag ni 'bras bu dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa'i bzhin du pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe
analyzed: rigs mthun pa skyed pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can dag ni 'bras bu dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dper na gyo mo la sogs pa'i bzhin du pha rol po smra bar 'dod pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ma yin pas kho bo'i dpe
translated: Since the cause that is not shared in common with other results and is qualified in this way is not similar to its result, it is not the result of the cause that you, the opponent, wish to assert, just like a pot and so on.

original: med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, our example is not nonexistent.

original: de ltar na gzhung gi tshogs des 'byung ba'i gzugs dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bkag pas gzugs kyi phung po mi srid par bstan to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung gi tshogs des 'byung ba'i gzugs dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bkag pas gzugs kyi phung po mi srid par bstan to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the collection of texts does not conclude that the form aggregate is impossible because the form of the elements and the form derived from the elements are refuted.üîΩForm is not observed

original: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //üîΩgzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par // gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: apart from the cause of form.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from what is called form,

original: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo //üîΩgzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu yang mi snang ngo // gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma gtogs par //
translated: the cause of form is not seen.üîΩApart from the cause of form,

original: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par //üîΩthal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
analyzed: gzugs na gzugs ni rgyu med par // thal bar 'gyur te don gang yang //
translated: form would be without a cause.üîΩBut no object exists

original: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med //üîΩgal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni gang na'ang med // gal te gzugs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: anywhere without a cause.üîΩIf the cause of form

original: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu zhig yod na ni //
translated: existed apart from form,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyur 'gyur te //
translated: it would be a cause without an effect,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: but there is no cause without an effect.

original: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs yod na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: Even if form existed,

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: the cause of form would not be tenable.

original: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
analyzed: gzugs med na yang gzugs kyi ni //
translated: Even if form did not exist,üîΩthe cause of form would not be tenable.

original: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: The cause also would not be tenable.

original: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yi gzugs dag ni //
translated: Form without a cause

original: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
analyzed: 'thad par mi rung rung ma yin //
translated: is not tenable, nor is it not tenable.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par rtog //
translated: Therefore, the conception of form
